loans.name: Gs Nueva Jutiapa Group

texts.es:
El Señor Juan, se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria y la venta de repuestos de bicicleta y reparación de las mismas, el cuenta con mas 10 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio. Don Juan es una persona muy trabajadora, el cuenta con  la clientela de la zona y de las personas de las montañas cercanas a su comunidad, a través de su negocio a salido adelante, ya que ha sido una de las principales fuentes de ingresos, el se ha sabido ganar la clientela porque su manera de atenderlos es muy especial y es una persona muy querida en su comunidad.
Don Juan con el préstamo comprara llantas, cadenas, rines, manecillas, cables, arroz, maíz, manteca, jabón, detergente, aceite, frescos, pan, café, huevos etc. esto le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y  una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
Don Juan sueña con tener un taller con todos los implementos necesarios.
Don Danilo, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería), y el destazo de reses, el cuenta con 8 años de experiencia.
Don Jorge, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería), cuenta con 3 años de experiencia.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is a merchant whose main business activity is selling groceries, but he also performs bicycle repairs and sells the respective spare parts.  He has been in business for more than 10 years.  Don Juan is a hardworking individual and his clientele are from the area and include people who live in the mountains near his community.  Through his business, he has been able to move forward since it is one his main sources of income.  He knows how to attract customers because he gives them special attention.  As a result, he is well-liked in the community.

Don Juan will use his loan to buy tires, chains, rims, handles, cables, rice, corn, lard, soap, detergent, oil, soft drinks, bread, coffee, eggs, and other items.  This will enable him to have a better business.  As a result, he will be able to cover his household expenses and provide a better quality of life for his family.  Don Juan dreams of having a workshop with all of the necessary equipment.

The other members are as follows:
•	Don Danilo is a merchant whose main business activity is selling groceries and butchered cows.  He has eight years of experience.
•	Don Jorge is a merchant who also has a grocery store.  He has three years of experience.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - October 2012

loans.use: to buy tires, chains, rims, handles, cables, rice, corn, lard, soap, detergent, oil, soft drinks, bread, coffee, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Brisas De Leones Group

texts.es:
María Orbelina tiene 36 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una aldea que pertenece a Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. A ella le ha gustado el comercio, inicio vendiendo mercadería como ropa y otros, y hace 10 años decidió por dedicarse a la cría de cerdos para venderlos y es la actividad actual la que le genera sus propios ingresos. Su mercado está en la misma comunidad. Actualmente cuenta con 5 animales para engorde. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo en forma grupal, el grupo se llama Brisas de Leones y está formado por 8 miembros que en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda de blusa Blanca esta María Orbelina, luego  sigue María Deysy, Eusebio, Elvira, Jose, Mirian, Maribel y Nelly a la derecha. Todos viven en la misma comunidad,  7 de los miembros se dedican al cultivo de frijoles y maíz y ella se dedica a la  cría de credos. El préstamo total grupal que solicitan es por 52,000 lempiras y lo van a invertir en la asistencia al cultivo de maíz y frijoles para sacar mejores cosechas y en la compra de concentrado, vacunas, arreglo de corral para crianza y engorde de cerdos para mejorar el cuidado que requieren. 
María Orbelina tiene como meta hacer dos corrales mas para aumentar la cantidad de cerdos.
texts.en:
María Orbelina, 36, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children in a village belonging to Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  She’s always liked commerce.  She started out selling merchandise like clothes and others and ten years ago decided to start raising pigs to sell and this is her current source of income.  Her market is in her same community and she currently has five animals she’s fattening up.  She’s requesting this loan as a group loan.  

The group is called “Brisas de Leones” and it has 8 members who appear in the photo thus: on the left, wearing a white blouse is María Orbelina, next is María Deysy, Eusebio, Elvira, José, Mirian, Maribel and Nelly on the right.  They all live in the same community.  Seven of the members grow beans and corn and she raises pigs.  The total group loan is for 52,000 Lempiras and they will invest it in the corn and bean crops to attain better crop yields and in the purchase of animal feed, vaccines and to repair the corrals to improve the care the pigs need while they grow.  María Orbelina’s goal is to build two more corrals to increase the number of pigs.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, vaccines and to repair the corral gates.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a 51-year-old farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in rice farming with her husband for more than 20 years. It is the source of the family's income.

Prima works hard to help her husband in meeting the family's needs, especially for the children's schooling. Prima is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the crops so that they will be able to grow and harvest a good quality of rice. In the future, Prima wants to expand their business and explore new ventures to augment their earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the crops

loans.name: El Lindero Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad de Corrales existe un grupo que lleva por nombre El Lindero, ellos han decidido llamarlo así porque las reuniones se realizan en un pequeño rancho que lleva este nombre, el cual se ubica a orilla de la carretera a solo 5 minutos de la comunidad. Este grupo esta integrado por 9 personas cada uno de ellos tiene una actividad económica la cual se mencionan a continuación:

Florencia venta de pollo
Liliana venta de ropa
Cecilia venta de perfumes
Jorge venta de frutas y legumbres
Gregoria venta de refrescos 
Agustina venta de cosméticos 
Elodia venta de antojitos 
Gabriela venta de calzado
Lucrecia venta de ropa 


Jorge es uno de los miembros de este grupo y nos platica que el trabaja como jornalero pero hace un poco mas de un año decidió emprender su propio negocio ya que actualmente ningún dinero alcanza y tenia que sacar a delante a su familia y pagar la escuela de sus pequeños hijos, así que se puso a pensar en cual seria el negocio que hacia falta en su comunidad y que le dejaría una ganancia el cual también pudieran atender su esposa e hijos, así que después de mucho buscar decidió abrir un pequeño puesto en su hogar de venta de frutas y verduras, el esta muy contento ya que su negocio le esta dando buenos resultados y poco a poco lo va surtiendo mas, el también compra mojarra en la laguna que esta cerca de su comunidad  y revende  en las comunidades cercanas cuando no hay trabajo en el campo. Don Jorge es un hombre muy trabajador y que quiere que sus hijos continúen con sus estudios y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
In the community of Corrales, there is a group that calls itself El Lindero because it holds its meetings on a ranch with that name. The ranch is beside the road just five minutes from the village. The group has nine members, each of whom earns a living with a different economic activity:
Florencia sells poultry.
Liliana sells clothing.
Cecilia sells perfumes.
Jorge sells fruits and vegetables.
Gregoria sells soft drinks.
Agustina sells cosmetics.
Elodia sells snacks.
Gabriela sells shoes.
Lucrecia sells clothing.
Jorge is one of the members of this group. He tells us that he works as an agricultural worker but a little over a year ago decided to start his own business since he wasn't making enough money to support his family. He wants to give his family a better life and pay for his children's schooling, so he started thinking about what business was lacking in his community that would make a profit and that his wife and children could help him run. After a lot of thinking, he decided to open a small stand in his home to sell fruits and vegetables. He is very happy because his business is doing well and gradually expanding. He also buys bream at a lake near his village and sells it in nearby villages when there's no work in the fields. Jorge is a hardworking man who wants to give his children a better quality of life and see them continue their studies.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Fifonsi 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFONSI 2 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Wassilatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Wassilatou est âgée de 52 ans et est une veuve. Wassilatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Wassilatou est mère de deux enfants, dont aucun n’est scoarisé et dont tous sont à sa charge. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de sa famille, Wassilatou vend depuis dix ans des friperies de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Wassilatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Wassilatou sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI 2.
texts.en:
FIFONSI 2 is a group made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood.  It is the first time that this group is requesting financial assistance from Alidé in order to raise the level of its activity.

The group's representative, Wassilatou, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. She is 52 years old and a widow.  She has not attended school.  She is the mother of two children who do not go to school and are her dependents.

In order to provide for her family, Wassilatou has been selling used clothing for ten years, working as an itinerant seller.  This activity allows her to meet her needs without much difficulty.  She stocks up at a market located in Benin.

Eager to satisfy the needs of her customers and to increase her turnover and income, Wassilatou is requesting a first loan from Alidé, along with the other members of the FIFONSI 2 group.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Cañaveral Group

texts.es:
Cañaveral es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 6 mujeres alegres y amables, este grupo esta ubicado en la comunidad de Palma Cuata el cual se encuentra rodeado por sembradíos de caña azúcar y su gente se dedica al trabajo en el campo.

Doña Francisca tiene la edad de 45 años, estudio la primaria y esta casada con  don Mariano que trabaja como jornalero, como no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando su madre le enseño a trabajar en las labores del hogar y un poco mas tarde le enseñaron a bordar y tejer, cuando aprendió a realizar esta actividad solo hacia blusas para ella y tejía sus propias servilletas pero cuando salia a caminar a la calle las señoras veían sus blusas y siempre le preguntaban donde las había comprado o mondado hacer así que decidió  iniciar a hacer sus manualidades para venderlas con sus amigos, vecinos y así ganar un poco de dinero para ayudar a su esposo con los  gastos de su hogar, actualmente también vende refrescos desde su hogar y ha solicitado este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de  hilos, listones, telas, agujas, ganchos, zuelas y refrescos para continuar con sus ventas. ella espera ganar mas clientes para que sus ganancias aumenten y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Martha venta de calzado,
Noemi molino de maíz,
Rubí venta de abarrotes, 
Daniela venta de calzado,
Guadalupe venta de refrescos
texts.en:
“Cañaveral” is the name of a group consisting of six cheerful, kind women.  The group is located in the community of Palma Cuata that’s surrounded by sugarcane fields; its residents work in the fields.

Francisca, 45, went to elementary school and she’s married to Mariano who works as a day laborer.  Since she did not have the opportunity to continue with her schooling her mother taught her how to do household chores and later on taught her to embroider and to knit.  When she learned this activity she only made blouses for herself and knitted her own napkins but when she’d go out into the street women would admire her blouses and would ask where she’d bought them or had them made so she decided to start making her crafts to sell among her friends and neighbors thus earning a bit of money to help her husband with household expenses.  She currently also sells soft-drinks from home and has requested this loan to buy thread, ribbon, fabric, needles, hooks, soles and soft-drinks to continue selling.  She hopes to win over more customers so that her profits will increase and be able to have a better quality of life.

The other group members are:
Martha - shoe sales,
Noemi - corn mill,
Rubí - grocery sales, 
Daniela - shoe sales,
Guadalupe - soft-drink sales.

loans.use: to buy thread, ribbon, fabric, needles, hooks, soles and soft-drinks.

location.town: Palma Cuata, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa sells secondhand clothing at Nkrontrodo near Elmina. She has done this for three years. She is married with three children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay the utility bills. 

Adwoa needs this loan to purchase more secondhand clothes for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Adwoa will acquire a shop for the sale of her secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Mrs. Salma, is a war survivor and dedicated entrepreneur who lives in the highlands of Aceh, Indonesia. Her father and brother were killed during the Acehnese civil war and the shop of her family was burnt down. The sales of Nazava Water Filters offer a great opportunity for her and her husband to increase their daily income. 

In just 6 months Salma sold over 300 water filters and provided over 1500 people with access to safe and affordable drinking water. Most of Salma’s customers are poor to lower income coffee farmers that earn less than 5 USD per day. Compared to buying water households save 132 USD per year using Nazava Water Filters, which enable them to purify rain, well or river water and make it safe to drink. 

To respond to the high demand for Nazava water filters in her district, Salma would like to purchase bigger stock at reduced costs. She has already established a network of 5 sub-resellers that can directly sell the filters to their customers. “I currently have the cash for just 25 filters, that’s why I run out of stock easily, which is bad for my business. Transport costs are also relatively high when ordering just a few filters. “ With a 2000 USD loan, Ibu Salma can provide safe drinking water to 1000 people in just 1 month. The loan enables her to purchase around 200 water filters at a discounted price and with reduced transportation costs. This will provide more families with safe drinking water, increase their disposable income as well as the revenue for Salma

loans.use: to purchase a bigger stock of water filters and increase the access to safe and affordable drinking water in her district.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Mu´ssha Group

texts.es: Josefa tiene 67 años de edad es viuda, vive sola y es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy alegre ella pertenece a un pueblo indígena llamado Francisco Serrato donde todavía predomina la cultura mazahua, ella es parte del grupo llamado Mussha. Dice que hicieron este grupo porque varias de las personas querían emprender sus propios negocios ya que la gente en los pueblos grandes no les dan trabajo debido a su condición de ser de comunidad ella dice “la gente de las ciudades abeces nos discrimina porque hablamos nuestro dialecto y porque nos vestimos con faldones de colores y no nos quieren dar trabajos es por eso que pedimos mejor créditos para hacer nuestros propios negocios”. Dice que no estudio porque es huérfana desde muy pequeña y su abuela no le importaba que fuera a la escuela, dice que desde muy pequeña se enseño a bordar y a sembrar ya que tienen terrenos muy grandes donde la tierra es noble y da un maíz de muy buena calidad, ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces, frituras, refrescos jugos afuera de una escuela y del centro de salud de su población y dice que le va bien ya que nada mas son dos puestos que se ponen, los dulces los compra en una población cercana a la de ella donde le dan precios bajos y el refresco se lo llevan los carros de diferentes compañías refresqueras. Ahorita esta pidiendo un crédito porque quiere surtir su puestecito y también quiere comprar flores de cempasúchil y de terciopelo por que las quiere vender el día de muertos en su localidad, ya que años con año la gente de su comunidad va a las tumbas de sus difuntos y adornan con flores y con comida sus tumbas es por eso que ahorita le urge su préstamo para ir comprando lo necesario. Dice que las flores ira a comprarlas a una población que esta cerca de su comunidad donde se dedican a cultivar ese tipo de flores para la época de muertos. Dice que está muy contenta porque cree que le ira muy bien y agradecida con Visión Fund porque su vida a mejorado atravez de los créditos que ha pedido ya que con las ganancias ha estado comprando de una o dos laminas para mejorar su casita ya que es de madera y lamina de cartón. Los otros seis integrantes del grupo se llaman Venancio, Aurelia, Elpidio, Aurelia, María Eduviges y Yolanda ellos invertirán sus créditos  para una carpintería y comprar sus materiales que ocupa para hacer muebles, para un taller de costura comprara telas y material para hacer prendas de sus vestimentas indígenas, para surtir refresco que vende, para la compra de material para hacer bordados artesanales y para la compra de unos borregos para criarlos y después venderlos.
texts.en:
Josefa, 67, is a widow.  She lives alone and is a very hardworking, very cheerful woman who belongs to an indigenous town called Francisco Serrato where the Mazahua culture still predominates.  She’s part of the group called “Mussha.”  She says that they formed this group because several of the people wanted to start business of their own because people in the big towns wouldn’t hire them because they came from indigenous communities.  “People in the cities sometimes discriminate against us because we speak our own dialect and dress in traditional, multi-colored skirts and they don’t want to hire us which is why we are asking for loans to set up our own businesses,” she says.  

She says that she did not go to school because she’s been an orphan since she was very little and her grandmother didn’t care one way or the other if she went to school or not.  She says that she taught herself to embroider when she was very little and also how to plant since she has large parcels of land with very fertile soil that produces very good quality corn.

She has a business selling candy, fast-food snacks, soft-drinks and juice outside a school and her town’s health center and she says that she does well since there are just two stands there.  She buys the candy in a nearby town where she finds low prices and the soft-drinks are delivered to her by the various soft-drink company delivery trucks.

Right now she’s asking for a loan because she wants to stock her stand and also wants to sell marigolds and velvet to sell in her community for the Day of the Dead since year after year residents in her community visit the graves of their departed and decorate them with flowers and food which is why the loan is urgently needed now so she can buy everything she needs.

She says that she’ll go buy the flowers in a town near her community that specializes in growing this type of flower used for Day of the Dead.  She says that she’s very happy because she thinks she’ll do very well.  She’s grateful to Vision Fund because her life has been improving thanks to the loans she’s requested because with profits obtained she’s been buying one or two sheets of metal to make improvements in her little house because it’s made of wood and pasteboard.

The other six members of the group are Venancio, Aurelia, Elpidio, Aurelia, María Eduviges and Yolanda.  They will invest their loans in a carpentry shop buying supplies to manufacture furniture, in a sewing shop buying fabric and supplies to make traditional indigenous costumes, to stock up on soft-drinks to sell, to buy supplies to do artisanal embroidery and to buy some goats to raise and then sell.

loans.use: to buy marigolds, candy, soft-drinks and juice to sell.

loans.name: Ana Rufina

texts.es: Ana Rufina reside junto a su madre que es la única persona que vive y la acompaña en su vida. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser ejemplo para sus vecinos quienes admiran su vida ya que lo da todo por brindarle el mejor bienestar a su madre. Actualmente y gracias a su esfuerzo diario posee un negocio de venta de tortillas, pupusas y deliciosos platos típicos entre semana y es así como ella honradamente se gana la vida y tiene para que en su mesa no falte el pan de cada día. Ana siente el deseo de poder incrementar mas su negocio y a su vez generar mas ganancias pero no posee el capital para llevar a cabo tal acción, es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para que pueda comprar los insumos para llevar a cabo tal acción desea comprar: tomates, chile verde, maíz, frijol, chicharrón, sal, azúcar, repollo entre otros, para así tener mas contentos a los clientes que la prefieren por su manera de ser y atenderlos. Cabe destacar que tiene buenas referencias de pago y esto la hace que sea una mujer que siempre busca lo mejor para ella y por quienes la rodean y agradece por la ayuda que está solicitando sea brindada.
texts.en:
Ana Rufina lives with her mother; she’s the only person who lives with her and shares her life.  She’s a very hard-working woman who has always been noted for setting an example for her neighbors who admire her life since she gives her all for her mother’s wellbeing.  Currently and thanks to her daily efforts, she owns a shop where she sells tortillas, pupusas [filled, grilled corncakes] and delicious traditional dishes during the week which is how she earns an honest living and has what she needs so that her table never lacks daily bread.

Ana wants to be able to increase her business while generating higher profits but does not have capital to do so which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy ingredients to carry out said plan.  She wants to buy tomatoes, green chilies, corn, beans, pork, salt, sugar and cabbage, among others to keep her customers happy who prefer her for the way she is and how she treats them.  It’s worth mentioning that she has good payment references and this makes her a woman who is always looking for the best for her and her loved ones.  She is thankful that the help she’s requesting will be granted.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, green chilies, corn, beans, pork, salt, sugar and cabbage, among others.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: Don Emiliano es cliente de la institución desde hace varios meses, es una persona aún muy joven con muchas ganas de superarse. Don Emiliano tiene 40 años de edad, estudio hasta la secundaria,  está casado con la señora Azucena desde hace 19 años juntos han formado una familia con tres niños que asisten a la escuela, el señor Emiliano tiene una imprenta donde da servicio a las personas que necesitan alguna impresión, estampados, invitaciones, rútulos de publicidad etc. “Yo inicie desde abajo ya que estuve empleado 16 años también en una imprenta pero quise iniciar mi propio negocio donde yo manejara mis horarios y mi trabajo, ya contaba con la experiencia necesaria solo necesitaba decidirme e iniciar”. Don Emiliano desde muy temprano abre su local para dar el servicio lo mejor que puede. Actualmente está solicitando el crédito para comprar una maquina de impresión offset y algunas piezas para maquina, pulpa para imprimir en serigrafía, plancha para secado y equipo para diseño que le hacía falta ya que sin esta máquina no podría dar un buen servicio. Él siempre trata de mantener a su clientela contenta y afortunadamente no le va mal en su negocio “Me gustaría que mi negocio me ayudara a solventar los gastos de la educación de mis hijos me encantaría verlos graduados en alguna profesión, estoy muy agradecido con la institución ya que gracias a anteriores préstamos pude hacer crecer mi negocio como comprando mas material que me hacia falta, ahora ya puedo hacer mas trabajos como playeras estampadas, recetas medicas, invitaciones, lonas etc.”
texts.en:
Mr. Emiliano, has been a client of the institution for some months now. He is still a young person with a strong will to get ahead in life. Mr. Emiliano is forty years old. He finished high school and he has been married to Mrs. Azucena for nineteen years. They have a family, composed of three children that go to school. Mr. Emiliano has a printing workshop where he sells printing services (both on paper and on clothes), invitations, flyers, etc.

Mr. Emiliano says, ”I started from scratch, since I was and employee in a printing workshop myself for sixteen years, but I wanted to start my own business in order to be able to manage my own time and work. I had the experience that was required, so I just needed to make the decision and start this printing business.”

Mr. Emiliano opens his workshop very early and provides the best service possible. He is requesting the loan to buy an offset printer and some components for a machine, a screen printing machine, an iron for drying and some design equipment he was missing. Without this machine he would not be able to provide a good service.

He tries to keep his customers satisfied. Fortunately, he does well with his business. If things continue as they are, he would like to expand his business, saying: “I would like the business to be profitable enough to help me pay for my children’s education; I would love to see them getting a professional degree. I deeply appreciate the help of the institution, since with previous loans I have been able to expand my business, by buying more material that I was lacking. Now, I can provide more services, like printed t-shirts, medical prescription forms, invitations, canvas, etc.”

loans.use: to buy an offset printer, some components for a machine, a screen printing machine, an iron for drying and design equipment.

loans.name: Meloma Group

texts.es: El grupo Meloma está conformado por 8 mujeres muy trabajadoras ellas viven en una comunidad hermosa donde la gente aun conversa en su lengua materna, platican que el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque así se llama su pueblo solo que esta en su lengua materna llamada Mazahua. Doña Francisca quien es la representante del grupo platica que tiene 47 años de edad esta casada con el señor José juntos formaron una familia con siete hijos de los cual tres son dependientes, Doña Mago, como de cariño le dicen, platica que se dedica a la venta de guajolotes (pavos) desde hace ya 18 años. Ella aprendió la actividad de sus padres porque también se dedicaban a la crianza de animales como los guajolotes, pero también antes tenia pollos y borregos aunque considera que no era buena opción entonces fue como se quedo con sus guajolotes. Actualmente solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar cuatro guajolotes más, la única dificultad a la cual se enfrenta Doña Mago es cuando sus guajolotes enferman y mueren muchas veces pierde su ganancia y la inversión que hizo al comprarlos. Doña Mago Comenta “No importa, seguiré echándole ganas para poder ayudar a mi hijo que esta por concluir su preparatoria y me gustaría que siguiera estudiando y que tuviera una carrera aunque para esto necesito tener muchos más animales y sé que con el crédito de la institución y Kiva lo lograré”. Las integrantes del grupo son Dulce, Francisca, Genoveva, María Guadalupe, María, María Luisa quienes invertirán en becerros; mientras que María Guadalupe comprará pollos para engorda.
texts.en:
The “Melom” group comprises 8 very hardworking women who live in a beautiful community where people still converse in their native tongue.  They relate that the group name was chosen because that’s the name of their town but in the Mazahua mother tongue.

Francisca, who is the group representative, relates that’s she’s been married to José for 47 years.  They formed a family of seven children three of which are still dependent.  “Doña Mago” as she’s affectionately referred to relates that she’s been selling turkeys for 18 years having learned from her parents who worked raising animals like turkeys.  She also used to have chickens and sheep but didn’t consider them to be good options so that’s why she stayed with turkeys and why she’s asking for a new loan to buy four more turkeys.

The only difficulty Doña Mago has is when the turkeys get sick and die.  She often loses her profit and the investment she made when she bought them.  Doña Mago comments: “It doesn’t matter.  I will continue striving to help my son who is about to complete high-school and I’d like him to continue studying and have a career.  To do so, though, I’m going to have to have quite a few more animals and I know that with a Kiva loan I’ll be succeed.”

The other group members are: Dulce, Francisca, Genoveva, María Guadalupe, María and María Luisa who will invest in goats and María Guadalupe who will buy chicks to raise.

loans.use: to buy turkeys.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a small trader.  She sells foodstuffs like tubers of yams at Nkontrodo near Elmina. Her husband is a driver. They have four dependants. 

Mary has been in this business for some time now.  She wishes to buy other food items requested by her customers, so a loan from Kiva will be used to buy tubers of yams and other foodstuffs and vegetables to sell. 

She hopes to use the new profits  to expand her business.

loans.use: buy tubers of yams and other foodstuffs and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 49 years old.. He is married to a farmer. He has spent 19 years in farming. 

He would like to get a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor, instead of using human labor.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama  is a petty trader.  Some of the items she trades in are tomatoes, pepper, onions, salt, cassavas, and plantains.  Ama has been into this business for five years now. 

She is married to a driver and has four children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  

Ama needs this loan to purchase more tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassavas, plantains, and other food items for sale. With the new profit, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassavas, plantains, and other food items for sale.

loans.name: Lara Group

texts.en:
The Lara group consists of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They have taken out a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Karima, 30 years old, is a very hardworking person who lives with her four children. They help her with her perfume and incense sales business that she started 6 years ago. Karima's business has great clients. She needs a youth loan to buy more perfumes and incense. Karima hopes that this financing will increase her sales, as she will be able to buy a variety of products to satisfy the needs of each one of her customers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and incense for her business

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano is a 30-year-old married man and the father of a one-year-old from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a fisherman who has also been engaged in a seaweed farming business for more than three years as his source of income.

Victoriano aims to expand his business but lacks the financial resources to do so. He is asking for a loan to buy straw and rope for seaweed farming and fuel for the fishing boat. In the future, Victoriano wants to make his seaweed and fishing business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for his daughter's future schooling.

loans.use: to buy straw and rope for seaweed farming and fuel for the fishing boat

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es: Don Rosalio es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable siempre muy amable con todas las personas. El señor Rosalio es cliente de la institución, tiene 39 años de edad y esta casado con la señora Rosario desde hace 7 años, juntos han formado una familia con tres niños que asisten a la escuela. Don Rosalio tiene un taller mecánico en el municipio de San Felipe “Yo inicié mi negocio porque me gusta mucho arreglar los carros y ver que mis clientes se van muy contentos porque sus carros ha quedado muy bien, sin embargo para lograr tener un buen trabajo con los autos de los clientes tuve que estudiar y aún sigo asistiendo a cursos”. A Don Rosalio le encantaba mucho la idea de poner su propio negocio entonces se decidió y desde hace 15 años ha estado dando sus servicios en su taller mecánico, en el cual también participan sus hermanos. La dificultad que presenta el taller de don Rosalio es la falta de herramientas más sofisticadas para realizar un mejor trabajo, es por eso que solicita un crédito a la institución para ver si puede comprar el equipo que le hace falta, así como algunas refacciones para autos. “Estoy muy agradecido con VisionFund y con Kiva por la oportunidad de obtener un crédito ya que me servirá de mucho porque podré comprar lo que me hace falta en mi taller mecánico, también gracias al crédito podre llegar a en mi propio espacio y en donde no tenga que pagar renta ya que el lugar donde tengo mi taller es un lugar rentado y me gustaría que fuera mas grande ya que si mi negocio crece satisfactoriamente para mi será mas fácil solventar los gastos educativos de mis hijos y ver algún día que se gradúan como profesionistas”.
texts.en:
Rosalío is a very hardworking, responsible man who is always very kind to people.  Rosalío is a client of the institution.  He’s 39-years-old, and married to Rosario for seven years.  They have formed a family together and have three children attending school.

Rosalío has an auto repair shop in the town of San Felipe.  He says, “Well, I started my business because I like repairing cars very much and seeing my customers leave happy because their cars have been repaired well.  However, in order to do good work on customer cars I had to take courses and still take them.”  

Rosalío was very keen on opening his own shop and for the last fifteen years he has been providing auto repair services in his shop.  The shop is called “El Niño” and his brothers work there with him.  The difficulty the shop has is lack of more sophisticated tools to do better work which is why he’s requesting a loan from the institution to see if he can buy the tools he needs and some auto spare parts.

Rosalío makes this statement: “I am very grateful to Vision Fund and to Kiva for the granted loan because it will be very useful for me because I’ll be able to buy what I need for my auto shop.  Also, thanks to the loan I will be able to have my own space and not have to pay rent since I rent my shop’s current location.  I’d also like it to be bigger because if my business grows satisfactorily it will be easier to pay for my children’s schooling and someday see them graduate as professionals.”

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Doña Daysi, es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a vender ropa usada, actividad que ejerce desde hace quince años.
Ella también se dedica a la compra y venta de desechos plásticos para ser reciclado.
Sin embargo para esta temporada navideña son los que ella necesita para comprar una paca para niños, y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos.
Es una persona trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante, y cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo, el préstamo le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Daysi is a small businesswoman who sells used clothing.  She has been in this line of work for 15 years.  Daysi also buys and sells discarded plastics for recycling.  

For this Christmas season, she is requesting a loan in order to buy a bale of children’s clothing so that she can improve her earnings.  Daysi is a hardworking person who wants to succeed and have the support of her son.  

The loan will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of used children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to provide coffee crop maintenance and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of five children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than ten years.

Vilma is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and buckets for storage. With these items, she and her husband will be able to enhance their catch thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market. In the future, Vilma hopes to make their business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and buckets for storage

loans.name: Enedino

texts.es: Enedino se dedica a la producción de café desde hace 32 años, aunque desde que era pequeño aprendió todo lo relacionado con este oficio al lado de su padre. Él está casado con Genoveva y tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 son solteros y aún viven con él y lo ayudan en las labores del campo. Para la siguiente cosecha Enedino necesita un crédito para pagar a los cortadores que contratará para que trabajen en sus fincas. Además de producir café Enedino también es un productor de caña y nos cuenta que produce hasta 80 toneladas anuales de caña de azúcar. Pasando la cosecha a Enedino le gustaría arreglar la cocina de su casa y también invertir un poco de dinero en la caña.
texts.en: Enedino has worked producing coffee for 32 years.  Since he was young he learned everything about this work at his father's side.  He is married to Genoveva and they have five children, of whom four are single and live with them and help with the field work.  For the next harvest, Enedino needs to a loan to pay the cutters he will hire to work on his land.  In addition to producing coffee, Enedino also produces sugar cane.  He says that he produces 80 tons of sugar cane each year.  After the harvest, Enedino would like to make improvements to the kitchen in his house and also invest some money in sugar cane.

loans.use: to pay laborers who will cut coffee.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana Elizabeth de 38 años de edad, vive junto a su familia su esposo y su hijo, gracias a Dios viven en casa propia ya que con esfuerzo han hecho que poco a poco su calidad de vida mejore un poco más. Ana es un mujer luchadora que sus visiones siempre han sido  darlo todo por el bienestar de su hijo es responsable, honesta, sincera y trabajadora es muy amable y eso a ella le llena de orgullo ser una buena madre, esposa, amiga u otros. Ana posee una pequeña tienda donde vende artículos básicos y de primera necesidad como leche, huevos, papel higiénico u otros. La tienda está ubicada en su casa y gracias a la manera de atender a los clientes ella posee de clientela quienes son los que la buscan para comprarles productos a diario. Lastimosamente  ella no tiene el capital necesario para hacer que su tienda crezca un poco y es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como: Sopas, café, maíz, frijol, Huevos, leche, pan dulce, chocolate u otros. La clienta cuenta con buenas referencias de pago y eso la hace que las personas depositen su confianza en ella, Confía en que Dios no la va a dejar sola y la ayuda pronto será entregada.
texts.en:
Ana Elizabeth, 38, lives with her husband and son.  Thanks to God they live in a house of their own since they’ve gradually improved their quality of life by means of their efforts.  Ana is a very tenacious woman who has always visualized giving her all for her son’s wellbeing.  She’s responsible, honest, sincere and hardworking; she’s very kind and it fills her with pride to be a good mother, wife, girlfriend, etc.

Ana has a small store where she sells basic items and staples like milk, eggs, toilet paper and others.  The store is located at home and thanks to the way she treats customers she has a clientele that seeks her out to buy from her every day.  Unfortunately, she does not have enough capital to make the store grow a bit and this is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy more raw materials like soups, coffee, corn, beans, eggs, milk, sweet bread, chocolate and others.  She has good payment references and this makes people trust her.  She trusts in God that He will not abandoned her and that the requested help will soon be delivered.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
La señora María, se dedica arduamente a la labor como maestro de Primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio de Larreynaga  dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 27 años, es soltera con 1 hijo al que está apoyando en sus estudios Universitarios, Una de las necesidades que la  señora  María  atraviesa, es de mejorar sus condiciones de su vivienda debido a que esta en malas condiciones, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Tablas, Clavo, Alambre de amarre, hierro, cemento, ladrillos de pared, arena y mano de obra., para  realizar el levantamiento de la pared , piso del cuarto y acera,  para mayor seguridad de su vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a su hijo.
Es importante destacar la importancia de la misma, y le agradece a ceprodel por el apoyo del financiamiento oportuno para resolver su necesidad.
texts.en:
Maria has worked arduously as a grade school teacher in a small, local high school in Larreynaga. She has worked as a teacher for 27 years, she is single and has one son who she is supporting through university studies. One of the needs that Maria faces is improving the condition of her home as it is currently in poor shape. For this reason she made the decision to turn to CEPRODEL to request a loan for purchasing building materials such as boards, nails, tie wire, rebar, cement, floor and wall bricks, sand, and to pay for labor in order to construct a wall, a floor in one room, and a walkway. This will increase the security of her home and thereby bring much improved living conditions for her son. 
It's important to underline this last point, and Maria is grateful to CEPRODEL for the financial assistance provided in resolving this issue.

loans.use: to purchase boards, nails, tie wire, rebar, cement, brick for floors and walls, sand, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Ramonito

texts.en:
Ramonito is a 22-year-old married man from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is engaged in a food vending business selling native snack foods called "puto" (steamed cakes). He is also a fish pond operator.

Ramonito works hard to earn a living in order to support his family. He is in need of additional capital for his food vending business and is applying for a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, etc. Ramonito dreams of making his business grow and become prosperous. He also wants to explore other ventures to enhance his income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Dushirukumwete Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline fait partie du groupe  Dushirukumwete et habite à Gitega. Elle a 38 ans et est mariée à Elias, un commerçant de vin de banane. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants.

Elle fait le commerce de vin de banane depuis  20 ans.

Elle est à son onzième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  bananes pour préparer  beaucoup de litres de vin de banane ,à vendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle  espère réaliser de grands  profits.Elle va s’acheter une grande propriété foncière et se doter d’un bon logement.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a member of the Dushirukumwete group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 38 years old and married to Elias, a banana wine seller.  They have three children together.

Jacqueline has been selling banana wine for 20 years.

This is her eleventh loan with Turame.  With the loan obtained from Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to make many liters of banana wine for resale, in order to make more money.

In the coming years, she hopes to make large profits.  She plans to buy a large piece of land and have a nice house to live in.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to make many liters of banana wine for resale.

loans.name: Lillian Eliza

texts.es:
Estimados señores de kiva, presento ante ustedes a la señora lillian, una señora que por veinte años se ha dedicado a elaborar con sus propias manos un producto muy popular en la dieta de los nicaragüenses como son las tortillas suaves y tostadas.
El dinero lo invertirá para comprar maíz por quintales, ya que de esta forma ella disminuye los costos de producción de tortillas.
Con los ingresos que genera su actividad comercial contribuye para los gastos del hogar.
Su estado civil es acompañada, Es una persona honesta y trabajadora.
su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos;solicita un crédito a ceprodel con el que pretende  mejorar su actividad comercial y sus ingresos
texts.en:
Being presented to the Kiva lenders is Sra. Lillian.  For the past 20 years, she has devoted herself to making products that are very popular in the Nicaraguan diet – soft tortillas and tostadas.  The money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of corn by the “quintal” (1 quintal = 46 kilograms).  This will enable her to reduce her production costs for making tortillas.  

With the income she generates from her business activity, Lillian will be able to cover her household expenses.  She lives with her husband, and she is an honest and hardworking women.  Her husband works buying and selling seafood.  

She intends to use it to improve her business and her earnings.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en:
Priscillar is a resident of the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. Priscillar owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for nine years. She began the business from the capital she received after selling one of her dairy cows.

Priscillar learned about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are bad debts and fluctuating prices. Priscillar is applying for a loan of 73,100 Kenya shillings to buy foodstuff such as cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living standards. Priscillar hopes to own a wholesale shop and to pay for her children’s education from this loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff such as cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki is a resident of Malindi in Coast province, Kenya. She is a single mother of two school-going children. She owns a food cafe, a business that she has been running for four years. In this cafe, she sells cooked potatoes, beverages and buns. Her main challenges are competition and a lack of funds to grow the business. She learned about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. She is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenyan shillings to purchase chairs, tables, utensils and foodstuffs like potatoes, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of the family and help with the education of her children. She aspires to own another cafe in future.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, utensils and foodstuffs

loans.name: Kadii

texts.en:
Kadii is a resident of the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for nine years. Kadii began the business from the capital she received after selling the produce from her farm.

Kadii learned about Milango from her friends and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is fluctuating prices. Kadii is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock such as cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living standards. Kadii hopes to set up a wholesale shop and pay for her children’s education from this loan.

loans.use: To buy retail stock such as cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Marlon José

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón una preciosa ciudad dedicada en diferentes actividades ubicada en el departamento de León, el Joven Marlon José es conocida como una persona responsable, honesta y dedicada a trabajo.

Marlon José se Llama el joven de 38 años, nacido en este bello municipio, se dedica a brindarle su servicio de conductor en uno de los ministerio de salud, cuenta con tres hijos bajo su cargo, su esposa no cuenta con ningún empleo únicamente es ama de casa.

Con lo poco del salario que él gana como conductor, no puede construir un cuarto que son sus sueños para su familia ya que se le va creciendo y amerita un mayor espacio para las condiciones de vida, es por eso que solicita financiamiento a Ceprodel y Kiva.

 Dicho crédito lo estará invirtiendo en la copra de Sementó, Arena, Ladrillo y pago de mano de obra, sus principales sueños es construir un dormitorio que le dará mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

 El estima que a fines de año su vivienda estará mejor, pero para entonces necesita que Ceprodel y Kiva le brinden este tipo de crédito, de momento solo cuenta con su buena salud, su capacidad de trabajo, y su honradez.

"Agradezco a Dios como primer instancia por haberme encontrado con Ceprodel y Kiva, para que estos me sigan dando su mano amigable"
texts.en:
In the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, a beautiful city with a variety of activities, Marlon José is known as a responsible and honest young man who is dedicated to his job.  Marlon José, born in this beautiful town, makes a living as a driver in one of the health departments in his town.  He has three children in his care.  His wife doesn't have a job, only as a housewife.

With the small salary he earns as a driver, he can't build a room, which is one of his dreams for his family because they're growing and need more space for their living conditions.  This is why he's requesting a loan from CEPRODEL and Kiva.  He'll be using this loan to buy cement, sand, and bricks, and to pay for labor.

His main dream is to build a bedroom so his family will have better living conditions.

He estimates that his home will be better by the end of the year, but he needs CEPRODEL and Kiva to give him this type of loan.  At the moment he only has his good health, his capacity to work, and his honesty.  "In the first place I'm grateful to God for getting me together with CEPRODEL and Kiva, so they continue extending me a friendly hand."

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a resident of the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children and owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for six years. Umazi began the business from the capital she received after selling the produce from her farm.

Umazi learned about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is high transportation costs. Umazi is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock such as cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living standards. Umazi hopes to own a wholesale shop and pay for her children’s education from this loan.

loans.use: To buy retail stock such as cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
En un bello Municipio de Santa Rosa Del Peñón Ubicada en el departamento de león una Preciosa ciudad dedicada a la agricultura, el comercio y la ganadería es donde habita la Señora Fidelina.
 
Fidelina necesita un financiamiento de Ceprodel y Kiva para la compra de: Cemento, Arena y Pago de Mano de Obra  para la mejorar las condiciones de su casa, debido a que no la podido mejorar por sus bajos ingresos que únicamente recibe de lo poco que se gana. 

Fidelina no es profesional, pero si es una persona trabajadora donde le pone amor a su trabajo, trabaja como empleada doméstica ya que únicamente cuenta con este tipo de experiencia que lo obtuvo de su madre. 

De manera, solo cuenta con su honestidad, su buen record crediticio, su buena salud y su amor al trabajo, esto la hace a que pueda pagar el crédito solicitado. 

Con toda su honradez Agradezco Ceprodel y Kiva, para que estos le sigan financiando un buen crédito para ella seria de mucha importancia para el desarrollo y condiciones de su vida
texts.en:
In a beautiful town of Santa Rosa Del Peñón, located in the province of Leon, a lovely city dedicated to agriculture, commerce and stockbreeding is where Ms. Fidelina resides.

Fidelina needs financing from Ceprodel and Kiva to buy cement, sand and labor needed to improve the condition of her house.  Due to low pay, the only income she receives is small and as a result, she has not been able to make the improvements.

Fidelina is not a professional, but she is hardworking and puts her heart in her work.  She works as housekeeper at a health center. It is the only type of experience she has, which she learned from her mother.

In a way, she only counts with her honesty; good credit record, good health and love for her work, which give her the ability to repay the loan.

She honestly would be grateful if Ceprodel and Kiva continued to finance her loan, which would be very important to her progress and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and labor.

loans.name: Jose Raimundo

texts.es: José de 54 años de edad vive junto a su esposa de 41 años de edad y sus 3 hijos los cuales son su fuente de inspiración día a día. Es un hombre ejemplar, buen padre, esposo y amigo el cual se interesa por el bienestar de su familia y siempre le ha importado darlo todo por ellos, algunas de sus cualidades es que pacifico, trabajador, honesto y sincero. José se gana la vida honradamente vendiendo billetes de lotería, cada mañana emplea nuevos horizontes y sale a vender en conocidas zonas de la capital por su forma de ser tiene clientela la cual decide buscarlo y jugar lotería con billetes que el vende, ya que dicen que les da suerte. José desea comprar billetes de lotería a la propia empresa y no a revendedores para tener mayores ganancias y sea poco apoco su propio negocio pero por el momento no posee lo necesario para invertir en tal acción es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito y así poder cumplir su sueño cuenta con excelentes récords crediticios ya que es responsable en sus pagos. Confía en Dios que su vida poco a poco se solucionará y podrá cumplir sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
José is 54 years and lives together with his wife, 41 years old, and three children who are a source of inspiration to him every day. He is an exemplary man, a good father, husband, and friend. He is interested in the well being of his family, and it has always been important to him to give everything he can to them. He is peaceful, hardworking, honest, and sincere. 

José earns an honest living selling lottery tickets. He goes out every morning to sell with new goals, selling in areas that he knows in the capital. He has customers that decide to seek him out and play the lottery with the tickets that he sells since they say that he brings them luck. 

Jose wants to purchase lottery tickets from the business itself and not from the re-sellers in order to have better earnings and make it little by little his own business. For the moment, he does not have everything he needs to invest in such an action. This is way he joined up with INTEGRAL, to request a loan and be able to accomplish his dream. He has excellent credit records since he is responsible with his repayments. He trusts in God that his life little by little can be improved and he will be able to accomplish his dreams and goals.

loans.use: purchase lottery tickets from the business itself and not from resellers.

loans.name: Vida Concepción

texts.es:
Estimados señores de kiva, doña vida es una comerciante de ropa, su negocio lo empezó hace ocho años, fue motivada por su hermana a iniciar en esta actividad comercial, con apenas C$ 1,000.00 que le dio su esposo, y con las ventas fue motivada a desarrollar poco a poco hasta tener al día de hoy una tienda que ofrece una variedad de prendas de vestir.

Sin embargo para seguir ampliando su actividad comercial en esta temporada navideña, ella necesita el prestmo para comprar productos de mayor demanda en su punto de venta.

Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a vender comidas fritas y nacatamales.

Su estado civil es casada y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Introducing to you, Vida, who sells clothing, and who started her business eight years ago. She was motivated by her sister to begin this business, with about 1,000 córdobas that her husband gave her, and through the sales she was motivated to develop little by little until today she has a store that offers a variety of clothing.

However, in order to continue expanding her business for this holiday season, she needs this loan in order to buy merchandise most in demand at the point of sale.

She used to work selling fruit and tamales. She is married and has two school-aged children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, including pants, blouses and children's t-shirts to sell in her store

loans.name: Aura Luz

texts.es:
Achuapa, es un pueblo ubicado a 110 km del departamento de León rodeado de montañas verdes y florecidas donde producen las riquísimas rosquillas y es una de las actividades principales que son a base de cuajada y dulce.

Doña Aura Luz se siente muy orgullosa de ser originaria de este poblado humilde porque en él habitan personas de escasos recursos que luchan día a día por salir adelante ejerciendo cualquier actividad que le genere ingresos para sobrevivir.


Ella ejerce la profesión de maestra desde hace  más de veinte años, diario se levanta desde muy temprano para caminar 20 km para llegar a la comarca Los Hornos donde está ubicada la escuela donde imparte clases a todos los niños de dicha comarca y para poder cumplir con su horario sale a las 5 am ya que no hay acceso en vehículos y solamente a pie se puede llegar.

Se siente muy satisfecha de tener su propia vivienda la que ha ido mejorando con el paso de los años  gracias a su esfuerzo y al sudor de su frente.

Solicito la ayuda a KIVA a través de Ceprodel para que le otorgue un crédito  para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, zinc y pago de mano de obra, con el fin de terminar de construir un cuarto.
texts.en:
Achuapa’s a town located 110 kilometers from León Department; it’s surrounded by green, flower covered mountains where the delicious ‘rosquillas’ [donut-shaped cookies] are made; it’s one of the main activities and they are made from cheese and sweets.  Aura Luz is very proud to be from this humble town because people of scarce resources live here who strive daily to get ahead doing whatever activity that generates income to survive.

She has worked as a teacher for more than twenty years.  She rises very early every morning to walk 20 kilometers to reach Los Hornos which is where the school is located where she teaches all the children from said district.  To meet her work schedule, she leaves at 5am because there is no vehicular access and it’s reached only by foot.

She’s asking KIVA through Ceprodel for a loan to buy bricks, cement, sand and metal sheeting and to pay labor costs to finish building a room.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, metal sheeting and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Una de las tradiciones  de Nicaragua en Diciembre, sobre todo en el Sauce es que se celebra la gritería de la Virgen María, la cual es una alegre actividad donde se le canta a la virgen y se regalan golosinas y comida.

En este pueblo lleno de tradiciones y costumbres habita doña Andrea una señora de 55 años, madre soltera de cuatro hijos que le han costado únicamente a ella sin la ayuda del padre y que ha tratado de ayudarle en lo que puede bajo su pobreza y con su pequeño salario laborando como cocinera en un centro de enseñanza donde tiene más de 20 años de laborar.
Se siente muy orgullosa que gracias al sudor de su frente hoy tiene su propia casa la que ha ido mejorando con la ayuda de los créditos pero que necesita ampliarla más para que sus hijos tengan mejores condiciones de vida por lo que su familia es bien numerosa.
Por tal motivo solicita a KIVA la ayuda con un prestamo,para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra. ya que tiene como meta terminar de construir un cuarto.
texts.en: A December tradition in Nicaragua, especially in Sauce, is the “Gritería de la Virgen María” [feast celebrated on December 7] that’s a joyful activity where people sing to the Virgin and exchange snacks and food.  Andrea, 55, lives in this town that’s rich in traditions and customs.  She’s a single mother of four children who she’s been raising alone with no help from their father.  Despite her poverty, she’s tried to help them in every way possible with her small salary earned working for twenty years as a cook at a school.  She feels very proud because thanks to the sweat of her brow she now owns her house that she’s been gradually improving with help from loans.  She needs to enlarge it so that her children can have better living conditions because her family is large.  Because of this she’s asking Kiva for help with a loan to buy bricks, cement, sand and to pay labor costs since her goal is to build a room.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El Sauce es muy alegre en época de Navidad, es muy bonito ver las calles adornadas de árboles navideños como es el pino natural que crece en montañas sobre todo en estos meses.

Don Eleuterio es originario de este poblado, es un señor de 52 años padre de familia responsable que ha dedicado casi toda su vida a servirle a su gente, a salvar vidas de todas las edades ya que lucha y arriesga su vida día a día por tratar de llegar a tiempo al hospital.

Esta labor le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y mejorar en lo que puede su vivienda para brindarles a sus hijos un hogar digno donde vivir.

Hoy solicita la ayuda a KIVA a através de Ceprodel para que le otorguen un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y zinc con el fin de terminar de ampliar un cuarto.
texts.en:
El Sauce is very cheerful during Christmas.  It’s very pretty to see the streets decorated with Christmas trees like the natural pine that grows in the mountains especially during these months.  

Eleuterio is from this town.  He’s a 52-year-old responsible father who has dedicated almost his entire life to serving others, saving lives of all ages because he strives and risks his life every day to try to reach the hospital.  

This job has made it possible for him to provide daily bread at home and to make home improvements wherever possible to provide his children with a proper place to live.  

He’s now asking Kiva through Ceprodel for a loan to buy bricks, cement, sand and zinc to finish enlarging a room.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Pablino

texts.es:
Estelí el diamante de las Segovia de esta bella ciudad ubicada en la parte norte de Nicaragua es originario el señor Pablino, su estado civil es acompañado el cual tiene dos hijos estudiante universitario.

Pablino es una persona de mucha visión empresarial y muy trabajador y con la responsabilidad de darle lo mejor a su familia, actualmente trabaja como seguridad de una Universidad pero aparte de eso el también se dedica al comercio y tiene dos negocio diferente uno que es una librería , este lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y hace unos poco días dio apertura a otro negocio que consiste en la venta de carne de pollo y huevos este  ultimo negocio lo tiene ubicado en otro barrio del mismo Estelí.

Con el préstamo que se le entrego lo destino para la compra de un freezer con capacidad de almacenar 500 libra de carne el cual va ser utilizado para su nuevo negocio.
Los negocio son atendido por Pablino en su tiempo libre y también por sus dos hijos, toda la familia se siente motiva y agradecida por Kiva y ceprodel por brindarle el apoyo a través del préstamo ya que ha sido posible mejorar la economía de su familia y a la misma vez generarle empleo.
texts.en:
Estelí, the city nicknamed "the Diamond of the Segovias," is located in the northern part of Nicaragua. Pablino is a native of this city. He lives with his partner, with whom he has two children that are studying in the university. Pablino is a responsible person with a big vision for his business. He works hard to be able to give his family the best.

Currently, Pablino works as a security guard at a university as well as in two other businesses. He operates a bookstore out of his home and he also recently opened a shop selling chicken meat as well as eggs from another location in the city. He attends to these businesses in his free time with the help of his children.

Pablino is requesting this loan to buy a freezer with the capacity to store 500 pounds of meat, which he will use in his newest business. His whole family is motivated and grateful for this loan and support from Kiva and Ceprodel. This will make it possible to improve the family's financial situation and, at the same time, create work for them.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Seydi Areli

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón una preciosa y encantadora ciudad dedicada en diferentes actividades comerciales, donde cuenta con lugares turísticos ubicada en el departamento de León, es donde habita la joven Seydi Arelis de 32 años de edad.

Seydi Areli se llama la Joven que en la actualidad se dedica a brindarle enseñanza a estudiante de educación primaria, necesita un financiamiento de Kiva y Ceprodel para la compra de madera y Zin, con esto  mejorara el techo de su vivienda ya que ella ha sido afectada por fuertes lluvias que le han ocasionado mucho daño.

Es madre soltera con dos hijos bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana desea mejorar su vivienda y no seguir enfrentando esos problemas que le han ocasionado mucho daño a su familia, pero esto solo se le puede obtener a través de un crédito que le financie kiva y Ceprodel. 

Ella cuenta con la esperanza de obtener este tipo de financiamiento o a lo contrario seguirá viviendo duras penas con su familia.
texts.en:
The town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, a precious and enchanting city dedicated to activities such as shopping, and where touristic places are found, is located in the territory of Leon. Here is where Seydi Arelis of 32 years of age resides.

Seydi Areli is the name of the young woman presently dedicated to bringing education to primary school-age students. She is in need of a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel to buy wood and zinc.  With these, she will repair the roof of her house, which was badly damaged as a result of heavy rains.

She is a single mother in care of two children; wishes to use her small earnings to improve her house and end dealing with those problems that have hurt her family.  But this is only possible with a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel.

Seydi is hopeful she will get this type of financing, or else she and her family will continue to live with hardship.

loans.use: to buy wood and zinc

loans.name: Apolloh

texts.en:
Apolloh is married and lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a photographer who began his business three years ago. Apolloh first trained as a tutor at a college in the area but after saving some money, he decided to purchase a camera and carry out photography.

Apolloh is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy another camera to take the business to a higher scale. Apollo was introduced to Milango by his friend and decided to join in order to access credit. Apolloh’s main challenges are clients who do not pay for the services on time and limited clientele. Apolloh looks forward to establishing and making his business known. He also wants to set up a studio.

loans.use: To buy another camera.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Siempre las personas buscan superarse, no importa el momento en que lo hagan porque el motivo es salir adelante y construir un futuro mas prospero, es el caso de esta joven mujer,  ella tiene grandes habilidades es honesta, emprendedora y muy trabajadora, vive con su grupo familiar el cual es su principal fuente de inspiración, quiere ofrecerles una vida mejor alejada de la delincuencia que los rodea. Desde hace tiempo tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende ropa en variedad para damas, caballeros y  niños como camisas, blusas,  vestidos, pantalones entre otros, comercia todos los días y es muy conocida por las personas de la zona y gracias a su manera de atenderlos la prefieren además de la calidad de producto y los buenos precios. Desea comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, pero no posee el capital suficiente para hacerlo, es por eso que solicita un credito para la compra de ropa  y calzado por mayor. La joven posee buenas referencias de pago y cuenta con la satisfacción de que nunca le ha quedado mal a nadie. Agradece desde ya el apoyo que le brindan y tiene fe en Dios que de ahora en adelante podrá darle a su familia la calidad de vida que tanto se merecen.
texts.en:
People are always looking to better themselves; it doesn't matter when they do it because the goal is to get ahead and build a more prosperous future, which is the case with this young woman. She has great skills, is honest, hardworking and enterprising. She lives with her family, who are her main source of inspiration. She wants to offer them a better life, far away from the crime that surrounds them. 

For some time, she has had a small stall where she sells a variety of clothing for men, women and children such as shirts, blouses, dresses, trousers and others. She does business every day and is well known and preferred by the people in the area, thanks to the way she serves them as well as product quality and good prices. 

She wants to buy more merchandise, but does not have enough capital to do so, which is why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of wholesale clothing and footwear. She has good payment references and has the satisfaction that she has never done harm to anyone. She is grateful for the support she has been given and she has faith in God that from now on she can give her family the quality of life they so deserve.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing and shoes, a variety of blouses, skirts, trousers and new styles of shoes.

loans.name: Elmer Enrique

texts.es: Elmer de 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. Él es muy emprendedor y se dedica a la venta de mosquiteros, que son hechos a base de fibras de hilos y sirven para protegerse de los mosquitos; los comercializa de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias, departamentos y ciudades, de esta manera él puede vender más con diferentes personas quienes en varios casos le hacen pedidos previos. Elmer desea contar con más cantidad de mosquiteros en distintos tamaños y colores con lo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y de este modo obtener lo mencionado anteriormente.
texts.en: Elmer is 39 years old, and lives with his wife and two young children. He is very enterprising, and sells mosquito nets, which are made from fibers and he sells traveling through different neighborhoods, apartment buildings and cities. In this way, he can sell more to different people who in some cases do pre-orders. Elmer wants to have more nets in different sizes and colors so that he can increase his sales. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, so he can obtain what was previously mentioned.

loans.use: to buy mosquito nets en different sizes and colors

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Wafa prefers that her photo not be on the Internet. Therefore, the photo is of her husband Mahmoud inside his printing house.

Wafa, 30 years old, is married and has one son and one daughter. For the past six years, Wafa's husband has operated a printing house, processing orders for publications, flyers, etc. for customers and institutions. The business has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family. However, it needs more support from time to time to cover the costs.

Wafa is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing quantities of paper and doing the necessary maintenance on the printing machine, This will increase the project's efficiency and meet the clients' demands, which will increase the family's income positively and offer better living conditions to Wafa and her family.

loans.use: To buy paper for the printer and to pay for maintenance of the printing machine

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BADEGNA  est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur dixième prêt. Les neuf précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait essentiellement le commerce de condiments. 
DJENEBA qui est la présidente du groupe  est la la seule femme assise dans la photo. Elle fait l’achat vente de condiments et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 cartons de concentrée de tomate et 2 paniers de poivre et d’aubergine avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The BADEGNA group consists of six women who are all married. On average,  they are 39 years old and have five children each.  They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons, and they reside in the Massablacoura neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They know one another through ties of community, friendship and commerce. In order to bolster their financial capacity and to do better at business, they have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their tenth loan with the institution; their nine previous loans were properly repaid.

This women's group essentially sells condiments.

Djeneba, the president of the group, is the only one sitting in the photo. She buys and sells condiments, and she is planning to use her loan to buy 10 boxes of tomato puree and two baskets of pepper and eggplants from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She sells at the market and from home, for cash and on credit, to a retail customer base which essentially consists of women. 

She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 75,000 CFA francs, which will be invested in her business and also used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Alejandro Ramon

texts.es: Alejandro Ramón de  41 anos de edad, casado con dos hijos e 13, 8 anos de edad, es originario del Jicaral lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Alejandro se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, preocupado por el bienestar y futuro de sus hijos. Tiene por actividad económica una pulpería y librería desde hace 1 anos que tiene experiencia en el negocio.El cambio de actividad economica El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Y consiste en vender producto comestible de consumo diario para el hogar como arroz, frijoles, pan, leche, azúcar, huevos, jugos, gaseosas. Y productos de librería como cuadernos, lápices, borradores, fomi, pega, regla, folder, resma de papel. El negocio lo inicio hace varios anos con ayuda económica de sus padre. Y en la actualidad ha crecido poco  a poco y a mejorado su  clientela y ganancias. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pequeño negocio y seguir luchando día a día. La rutina diaria de  Alejandro es trabajar unas  12 horas diarias para brindarle mejor servicio a su clientela. Alejandro Ramón agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Alejandro Ramón, 41, is married and has 2 children aged 13 and 8.  He is a native of Jicaral, a place located in the western part of the country. Alejandro is known for being a very hardworking and responsible man who is concerned for the welfare and future of his children.  He has had a business for 1 years selling grocery items and stationery products, and so he is experienced in this line of work.  He has change his line of work from before.  His business is located in his house.  He sells basic food products such as: rice, beans, bread, milk, sugar, eggs, juices, and soft drinks.
