He also sells stationery items such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, sheets of foam craft paper, glue, rulers, folders, and reams of paper.  He started this business a number of years ago with the financial help of his father. Over time, he gradually grew the business, increasing his customer base and his earnings.  

Alejandro Ramón needs a loan to invest in working capital to stock his small store, so that he can continue to strive for success day by day.  Alejandro's daily routine is to work 12 hours a day to provide the best service to his customers.  Alejandro Ramón appreciates the help that the Kiva lenders are providing to people who have few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a means to a decent life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, bread, milk, sugar, eggs, juices, and soft drinks, and also stationery items such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, sheets of foam craft paper, glue, rulers, folders, and reams of paper

loans.name: Petronila Del Socorro

texts.es: Petronila del Socorro de  53 anos de edad. De la localidad de la Paz Centro. Lugar que. Casada  con un hijo que estudia en la universidad. Ella tiene por actividad económica el servicio de taller de costura y venta. Tiene 20 anos de trabajar en dicha actividad. La cual surgió por la necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo para ayudar al esposo con los gastos del hogar. El negocio consiste en elaborar prendas de vestir como pantalones, uniformes, camisas, short, faldas, vestidos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en s casa de habitación. Con el financiamiento compra materia prima  para elaborar sus prendas como: telas, hilos, aceite de maquina, carrete, agujas. Petronila del socorro siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Y su mayor sueno y anhelo es poder ayudar a su hijo que se supere profesionalmente. Petronila del Socorro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Petronila del Socorro, 53, lives in the town of La Paz Centro.  She is married, has a son who is a university student, and works as a seamstress.  She has been in business for 20 years and started it to help her husband cover household expenses.  The clothing she makes includes pants, uniforms, shirts, shorts, skirts and dresses, and she works out of a room in her house.

She plans to use the loan to buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, sewing machine oil, bobbins, and needles.  Petronila del Socorro has always been a very hard-working, responsible person with determination to improve her situation.  Her greatest desire is to help her son get professional training.  Petronila del Socorro is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people with low incomes in poor counties like Nicaragua to be able to earn a decent living.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, sewing machine oil, bobbins and needles.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es: Marcos tulio tiene  40  años de edad, esta soltero actualmente. El con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos y fumigantes. Este agricultor que por mucho tiempo ha tenido que velar por su madre, piensa dar asistencia a sus cultivos de café, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar ingresos económicos para poder salir adelante, el no cuenta con el capital necesario para realizar esta compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Marco Tulio is 40 years old, and single.  He intends to use the loan to buy farm supplies like manure and pest killers.  This farmer has had to care for his mother for a long time and plans to provide maintenance to his coffee crops so that they won’t be damaged and production won’t be lost and he can earn income from his coffee-growing project to be able to continue moving forward.  He does not have the capital necessary to make this purchase because he’s of limited resources and does not have any way to get the money needed for this which is why he’s requested a loan.  This is his first loan from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur has given him the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella se dedica al oficio de corte y confección desde hace tres años, lo aprendió gracias a que asistió a una academia en 1992, situada en la ciudad que esta a media hora del lugar en donde vive. Antes solo se dedicaba a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa; pero ademas de dedicarse a la sastreria ella cuida una vaca, para obtener leche.  Ella camina unos treinta minutos hasta llegar al lugar en donde aborda el autobús que la conduce al lugar donde compra los insumos, viaja una vez al mes. Rosa confecciona los uniformes escolares de dos escuelas, son 129 unidades cada 6 meses para llegar a estos lugares, ella debe caminar treinta minutos para abordar el autobús y este tarda una hora quince minutos en llegar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca más. Para aprovechar el tiempo que le dedica a una y poderlo dedicar a dos. Con la inversión desea incrementar la producción de leche y asegurar la alimentación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 40, is married and has 3 children.  She's had a dressmaking business for 3 years.  She learned this trade by attending classes at an academy in 1992, located in a city a half hour away from where she lives.  Prior to that, she worked mainly in the home; but in addition to working as a seamstress she also raises cows so obtain their milk.  She walks 30 minutes to arrive at the bus stop, where she takes a bus to the place where she buys her supplies.  She makes this trip once a month.  

Rosa makes school uniforms for 2 schools.  She delivers 129 uniforms every 6 months to these places.  To do this, she must walk 30 minutes to board a bus, and then it takes her an hour and 15 minute to arrive.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundacion Campo is to buy another cow.  In the time it takes her to care for one cow, she could care for two.  With this investment, she wants to increase her milk production and ensure that there is food for her children.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase inventory for more product lines and plus size clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar terreno

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire an additional employee.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi  est constitué de trois femmes mariées et une veuve ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Dougounina de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur dixième prêt. Les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments, de céréales et d’autres articles divers. 
Awa qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première de la gauche vers la droite, fait l’achat vente de condiments. 
Awa  compte acheter avec son  prêt, ½ tonne d’oignons, 5 paniers de choux et poivron et 1 sac de sel de cuisine avec les grossistes de Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group consists of three married women and a widow.  On average, these women are 49 years old and have six children each. They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons, and they reside in the Dougounina neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They know one another through ties of community, friendship and commerce. In order to bolster their financial capacity and to do better at business, they have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their tenth loan with the institution; their previous loans have been properly repaid.

The women from this group sell condiments, grains and various other goods.

Awa, the president of the group, is the first woman from the left in the photo. She buys and sells condiments, and she is planning to use her loan to buy 500 kg of onions, five baskets of cabbage and peppers and one bag of kitchen salt from wholesalers in Sikasso. She sells at the market and from home, for cash and on credit, to a retail customer base which essentially consists of women.

She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 85,000 CFA francs, which will be invested in her business and also used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Joen Patricia

texts.es: Joen  Patricia de 43 anos de edad, madres soltera con un hijo de 14 anos de edad, del departamento de Chinandega, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 15 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. La actividad consisten vender granos básicos, pollo, embutidos, salsas, jabones, detergente, gaseosas, huevos, jugos. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para poder mantener a sus hijos y poco a poco  con los créditos que fundación le ha prestado le ha invertido al negocio. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería con productos de consumo diario y obtener mejores ingresos y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Joen Patricia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brinda a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Joen Patricia, 43 years old, is a single mother of a 14-year-old son. She is from the Chinandega region and works in a grocery store that is located in her home. She has had this business for the past 15 years. Her job consists of selling basic grains, chicken, sausage, salsa, ham, detergent, soft drinks, eggs, and juice. The business was started due to her need to have a source of income to support her children. Little by little, she has been able to invest in her business with the help of the loans she has taken out.

The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital, stock her grocery store with everyday consumer products, earn more income, and provide her customers with better service. Joen Patricia is thankful that Kiva lenders provide support for people with limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they may have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with products such as basic grains, chicken, sausage, salsa, ham, detergent, soft drinks, eggs, and juice.

loans.name: Mfungoni

texts.en: Mfungoni is a resident of Malindi in Coast province, Kenya. She is a mother of three grown children. She owns a food cafe, a business that she has been running for five years and which employs three other people. In this cafe, she sells cooked food and beverages. She learned about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are bad debts and competition. Mfungoni is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to renovate new premises where she will set up another cafe. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of the family and help with the education of her grandchild, who lives with her.

loans.use: to renovate new premises where she will set up another cafe.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a single business lady living in Changamwe, Kenya. She owns a butcher shop, which she has been operating for five years, as well as a grocery stall. Christine joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of meat and groceries. The extra income will form part of Christine’s future savings. Her current challenges are the high cost of stock and bad debts. She wants to own a larger business venture in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of meat and groceries.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is married and has two children. He is a retail shop owner living in Changamwe, Kenya. He has been operating the business for three years. The family also earns some income from his formal employment. He intends to improve his retail shop. His current challenges are the high cost of transport and bad debts.

Josphat joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of retail products like soap, vegetables, sugar, flour, etc. The extra income will form part of Josphat’s future savings and help him pay for his children’s school fees. His desire is to set up a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of retail products like soap, vegetables, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en: Asmahan is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother Osama appears in her Kiva profile photo, inside his store. Asmahan is an 18-year-old single woman. For the past two years, her brother has had a store selling spare parts for motorcycles, which is a means of transportation used frequently by people in the area where Asmahan and her family live. This venture has been considered a profitable one, since it has high demand from customers; but it needs more support to cover its costs. Asmahan is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her brother cover the cost of purchasing a collection of motorcycle spare parts. This will increase sales, improve the business, and increase the family's income, which will provide Asmahan and her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of motorcycle spare parts to resell

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is a taxi owner living in Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He has been operating the business for twelve years. His family also earns some income from a retail shop run by his wife. 

Boaz joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings (KES) to repaint the taxi car and to carry out minor repairs. His ambition is to register the business and provide the best taxi business in the area. 

The extra income will also form part of Boaz’s future savings and help him pay for his children’s school fees. The challenges currently are high cost of fuel, bad debts arising from the business, and at times a seasonal business climate. He desires to own more taxis in the future.

loans.use: To repaint the car and carry out minor repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock of retail products like soap, vegetables, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es: Jesús Antonio de 49 anos de edad, soltero sin hijos. Del departamento de Chinandega. Lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Jesús Antonio tiene por actividad económica la venta de comida rápida como: hot-dog, sanwis, hamburguesas, entre otros. Lo tiene ubicado de en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante. Desde hace 8 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. El negocio surgió como una iniciativa de trabajo para tener un ingresos para ayudar con los gasto de su casa. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en productos como pan. Salsa, lechugas, mortadela, queso, pepinillo, mostaza. Jesús Antonio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua par tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jesús Antonio is 49 years old, single and does not have children. He is from Chinandega department, a place located in the western part of the country. Jesús Antonio's work is selling fast food such as hot dogs, sandwiches, hamburgers, and other items. 

His business is located in his home, and he is also a street vendor. He has been doing this work for eight years. His business came about as a work initiative so that he could help with the household expenses. 

He needs the loan to invest in products such as bread, salsa, lettuce, cold cuts, cheese, pickles and mustard. Jesús Antonio is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to low-income people and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that people can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making fast food such as hot dogs, sandwiches and hamburgers, as well as to invest in working capital.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a resident of Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She operates a salon business, which she has been running for three years.

She learned about Milango through a friend and joined the group with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are a seasonal market and competition from other businesses of the same kind.

Janet is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to buy supplies such as hair chemicals, creams, and other items. The extra income arising from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her living standard. She aspires to open other branches in future and to build a family residential house.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as hair chemicals and creams.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old single young man. For the past year, Ahmad has been working in transporting goods to clients by driving a rickshaw. Ahmad wants to have independence in his work. By owning his own rickshaw, he would be able to work freely and improve his income.

Ahmad has an amount of money which is not enough to cover the price of purchasing a new rickshaw. Thus he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to complete the cost of purchasing the rickshaw. Taking this loan will enable Ahmad to have his own rickshaw and enable him to increase efforts to work extra hours and increase his income in order to ensure to himself better future.

Ahmad is photographed next to the rickshaw.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing rickshaw

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is single and owns a barber shop which has been in operation for five years. He began the business from savings he had made over a long period of time. He also sells recorded compact discs.

Stephen is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenyan shillings to purchase shavers and other business equipment, as well as to buy new compact discs to sell. He was introduced to Milango by his friends. Although the business faces the challenge of high cost of purchasing equipment, Stephen believes that the addition of these new machines will help improve his sales.

His ambition is to open other shops in the future to increase his sources of income.

loans.use: To purchase shavers and other equipment, and to buy new compact discs.

loans.name: Dayana Gabriela

texts.es:
Dayana es una joven de 18 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Dayana no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional de Idiomas, ya que se encuentra trabajando para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, gracias a los ahorros que pudo conseguir de trabajos anteriores, Dayana pudo comprar un pequeño auto, el cual utiliza para alquilarlo a choferes que brindan servicios de taxi, ella trabaja todos los días y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Dayana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y mantenimiento general a su auto, ella desea poder cambiar los amortiguadores y las llantas; de esta manera Dayana tendrá su auto en mejores condiciones para poder seguir alquilándolo, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para cumplir su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dayana is a young 18 year old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Nazca with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person with a strong desire to get ahead. Unfortunately, Dayana has not been able to study for a professional in languages because she must work to support her parents with the household expenses. In her free time she likes to listen to music and occasionally she cooks a delicious "arroz con pollo" (rice with chicken) to share with her family. 

With much perseverance and dedication, and thanks to savings from previous jobs, Dayana bought a small car which she uses to rent to drivers who provide taxi service. She works everyday and believes that it is going well for her because of her responsibility and for her friendly manner that she shows to her customers. 

Dayana is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the brought to her she will be able to repair and have general maintenance done on her car. She hopes to change the muffler and the tires. In this way Dayana will have her car in better condition to continue renting. She will continue working and putting the effort in to fulfill her largest dream of studying for a professional degree and getting ahead.

loans.use: to repair and have general maintenance done on her car.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a bicycle repair mechanic living in Malindi, Kenya. He is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. Gabriel has been operating his bicycle repair business for six years; in addition, he is a dairy farmer. The family also earns some income from a retail shop run by Gabriel's wife. 

Gabriel joined Milango at an invitation from his friends, and he is applying for a loan of 83,450 KES to purchase additional spare parts, such as tires, chains, spokes, and dynamos, to use in bicycle repair. The extra income from the loan will contribute to Gabriel’s future savings and help him pay for his children’s school fees. Gabriel faces challenges like the high cost of spares and bad debts arising from the shop. He desires to set up a new bicycle sales shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy parts for bicycle repair.

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.en:
Balinese artisan Nyoman specializes in handcrafted sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of such raw materials as silver and natural gemstones to build up his stock.

Nyoman has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I began learning to carve wood when I was in elementary school. My grandfather, an architect of traditional Balinese buildings and also a senior carver, was very supportive of me. Then my father introduced me to a leading silversmith in my village, and I began to learn from him. Now I make use of my carving ability when creating silver jewelry."

"Thank you for supporting me through this microloan; with this support I'll be able to have some capital to build up my stock. May life reward you accordingly. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Nyoman's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3703

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of such raw materials as silver and natural gemstones to build up his stock

loans.name: Dunia Arely

texts.es:
La señora Dunia tiene 26 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene dos hijos, reside en compañía de su familia en  una comunidad urbana del municipio de Gracias, Departamento de Lempira. Ella tiene 2 años de haber establecido su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijoles, manteca, condimentos, refrescos, churros y productos de limpieza.
Ella anteriormente se dedicaba a oficios domésticos, pero debido a la situación económica, decidió contribuir con la economía de su hogar. Con el fin de mantener surtido su negocio ha solicitado un préstamo  por la cantidad de 6000 Lempiras. Ella espera aumentar su clientela y generar mayores ingresos.
Su meta es mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dunia, 26, lives with her common-law husband and her 2 children in an urban community in the municipality of Gracias, in the department of Lempira.

For 2 years, she has had her own grocery store business where she sells consumer staples such as: rice, sugar, corn, beans, butter, condiments, beverages, chips and cleaning products.

Previously, she devoted herself to working in the home, but because of the economic situation she decided to contribute to the household finances.  With the goal of keeping her business well-stocked, she is requesting a loan of 6,000 Honduran lempiras.  She hopes to expand her customer base and generate more income. 

Dunia's goal is to improve her business and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, corn, beans, butter, condiments, beverages, chips and cleaning products

loans.name: Henry Anthony

texts.en:
Henry Anthony is a Balinese artisan specializing in sterling silver and leather jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of sterling silver to continue production of his crafts.

Henry Anthony has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story:

"I studied in the United States and traveled to Japan and Europe. Jewelry is my passion, and my work let me gain experience in jewelry design and crafting. I moved to Bali in 2002 and established my own workshop. My collections are influenced by my Indonesian surroundings and my admiration of Japanese artistry. Designing jewelry for men has become part of my lifestyle.

I wish to thank you for assisting me with this microloan. It really helps my financial situation, and I'll be able to create new pieces in time for the holiday season. Thank you very much for your support."

Use the link below to view Henry Anthony's sterling silver and leather jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7116

loans.use: to purchase sterling silver.

loans.name: Putu Gede

texts.en:
Putu Gede is a Balinese artisan who specializes in sterling silver jewelry with gemstone accents. He would like to invest in the purchase of silver and natural gemstones to increase his stock.

Putu Gede has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is his story:

"I have been passionate about designing since childhood. I love to create pieces based on traditional styles combined with a modern look. I've come to realize the importance of having a skill, so I've made a point of offering free training in silversmith techniques. My hope is that by doing so, I will enable people in need to earn a modest living and support their families."

"I feel so lucky to meet people like you who care about my situation over here. Your support through this microloan is meaningful to me, as it is very useful: it means I can continue the work that I had to suspend for a long time because of limited financial resources. I will not misuse the trust that you have placed in me. I will try to give all that I can give. Please accept my love and respect."

Use the link below to view Putu Gede's handmade jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6981

loans.use: to purchase silver and natural gemstones.

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.en:
Nyoman is a master carver from Bali who specializes in traditional masks and sculptures. He would like to purchase wood to increase production and also to be able to employ others in his community.

Nyoman has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I was taught to carve by my older brother. The traditional forms and poses are beautiful and of fine workmanship, which inspired me to learn this style. My favorite themes to work on are characters in religious mythology because they offer a variety of ways for an artist to express creativity and style. What I wish now is to continue upholding the values of those who taught and inspired me, while being able to continue taking very good care of my family and my woodcarving group.

I really want to thank you all for contributing to this microloan. I'll be able to get my workshop started again after I had to close it due to a lack of financial resources. I want to say many thanks once more: without your support I would not be able to continue my wood carving work."

Use the link below to view Nyoman's masks and wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/381

loans.use: to purchase wood and to employ others in his community.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua  is a fish monger; in the picture above  she is smoking some of the fish she has bought from the market for resale. Efua has been selling smoked  fish for 3 years now. She is married with 4 dependants.  She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Efua will use her loan to purchase fresh  fish to smoke and then sell. She will expand her business with the new profits.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke and then sell

loans.name: Tului

texts.en:
Tului is 23 years old and single with no children. For three years, she has had a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, yams, and other fruits and vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. Tului needs a loan to buy farming supplies like a new weed sprayer, gramoxone, bush knives, and fertilizer.

Tului has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Taupaolo

texts.en: Taupaolo is a 65-year-old married woman with 7 children.  She makes and sells pork buns, pancakes, and pies to earn a living.  She has 4 years of experience with this business.  Taupaolo needs a loan to buy ingredients (flour, sugar, baking powder, etc).  She plans to use her profits to support her business and to provide good financial support for her family.  Taupaolo has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, yeast and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ulata

texts.en:
Ulata is a 56-year-old woman who is married with eight children. For three years, she has been running a business providing taxi services in her community. 

Ulata has requested a loan to purchase spare parts. She plans to use her profits to provide financial support for her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her taxi service such as fluid, filter oil, engine oil, and tires.

loans.name: Claudia Del Carmen

texts.es: Claudia del Carmen de 42 anos de edad. Madre soltera de dos hijos de 15,13 anos de edad de la localidad de Chinandega. Lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Claudia tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, cosméticos, cajetas de  leche y coco, y repostería.  Tiene diez  anos de tener dicho negocio y lo realiza de forma ambulante. El negocio lo inicio con fondos propios la elaboración de cajetas y repostería lo aprendió de su familia, y la venta de  cosméticos y mercadería las  por las tardes con clientes fijos  y eventuales. Con el propósito de mejorar los ingreso de su hogar y ayudar a sus hijos que se formen profesionalmente para que tengan un futuro mejor. Claudia ha tenido créditos de fundación león  y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con productos como cajetas, reposteria, ropa de ninos, pantalones, blusas, faldas, vestidos,  y de dicha forma  mejorar sus ganancias. Claudia del Carmen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Claudia del Carmen is 42 years old.  She is the single mother of two children, who are fifteen and thirteen years old, and lives in the town of Chinandega.  Chinandega is located in the west of the country.  Claudia's business is selling general merchandise, cosmetics, caramels, coconuts and confections.  She has been in her business for ten years, and sells her products from the street.  She started the business with her own funds earned from making caramels and confections, which she learned from her family.  She sells cosmetics and merchandise in the afternoons to both regular and occasional customers.   Her goals for her work are improving her household income and helping her children to develop professionally so that they can have a better future.  Claudia has previously taken out loans from Fundación León and has shown herself to be responsible in repaying her loans in a timely manner.  She needs the loan to invest in working capital and to stock up her business with more products, like caramels, confections, children's clothing, blouses, skirts and dresses in order to improve her income.  Claudia del Carmen is grateful for the the help that the Kiva lenders offer to low-income people so they can earn a dignified living.

loans.use: to invest working capital in the purchase and re-sale of caramels, confections and merchandise, like pants, blouses, skirts and dresses.

loans.name: Avalisa

texts.en:
Avalisa is a 47-year-old woman who is married with two children. For five years, she has run a business selling general produce and other goods in her community. 

Avalisa has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, lamb, and corned beef to sell in her shop. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and provide financial support for her family and children. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to purchase produce and other foods for sale.

loans.name: Casto

texts.es: El Sr. Casto  tiene 25 años, tiene un hijito de la edad de cinco años,  el se dedica  a la construcción y remodelación de viviendas, el es albañil,  el vive en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Casto va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta, que le hace mucha falta ya que esto le permitirá realizar su trabajo de manera eficiente ya que tiene contratos que cumplir, y esto le permitirá movilizarse de manera rápida a sus obras ya que son distancias largas que tiene que recorrer,  como es del área rural las distancias entre localidades son muy largas y el camino no está en buenas condiciones para que entren movilidades por lo que una  motocicleta es de muy buena utilidad, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, el  Sr. Casto  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Casto, 25, has a small 5 year-old son.  He is a bricklayer who works in construction and remodels houses.  He lives in the town of El Torno.  This is his first loan from the institution.  

Casto will use this loan to buy a motorcycle, which is something he needs very much, because it will allow him to do his work in a more efficient manner.  He has contracts to complete, and this will allow him to get around more quickly to his work sites, because he has long distances that he has to travel.  He is in a rural area where the distances are long between the towns and the road is not in good condition for cars, and so a motorcycle would be very useful.  His reason for requesting this loan is so that he can continue to improve in his work.  

Casto is a very hardworking person who feels happy about the credit opportunity that he is getting, because this is the only activity he has that allows him to support himself.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man. For the past year, he has had a beauty & cosmetics store which has a good reputation among clients and many loyal customers. It is Mohammad’s  only source of income, and while it is considered a profitable venture for him, it still needs more support to cover its costs. Mohammad is requesting a loan from FATEN to purchase cosmetics and perfume that customers often request and buy. This will increase sales and improve his income, which will ensure that his business remains successful. Mohammad is photographed inside his store.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres de Unidas con el total de 10 Mujeres, todas tienen familias realizan respectivos trabajos. Todas se comprometen a juntar ya su ahorro para poder avanzar de ciclo. La señora Gloria es una de la integrantes del comité que trabaja en su pequeño copetín que actualmente ya es más grande y ya es una despensa, está contenta por la oportunidad que le dio la fundación ya que ninguna entidad no se la dio.
Vuelve a solicitar un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, verduras, comestibles, y demás insumos para poder seguir dadno buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: The Mujeres de Unidas ("Women United") group consists of 10 women, all of whom do their jobs while having families. All of them promise to work together to save for the future. Gloria is one of the group members, and she works at a little snack stand, which has grown and is now a convenience store. She is happy for the opportunity to work with Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya, since no other organization gave her one. She is requesting the loan to purchase drinks, vegetables, and other groceries to keep giving her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, vegetables and other groceries.

loans.name: Sarona

texts.en: Sarona is 32 years old and married with 4 children.  She has a small business making and selling hand fans, fine-mats, necklaces and other items in her community.  To do this, she needs a loan to buy materials and resources.  In the future, Sarona hopes to improve her business.  She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy pandanus leaves, a paint brush, paints and coconut shelves.

loans.name: Celina Estela

texts.es: Celina de 47 años de edad vive junto a su familia, su esposo y sus hijos mayores de edad y con esfuerzo aún están estudiando en el bachillerato, están muy contentos porque pronto se graduaran y podrán ayudarle a sus padres en la forma de llevar dinero a su hogar. Celina es muy amable y eso es una gran cualidad que posee gracias a ello, posee de clientes ya que ella con esfuerzo y dedicación se ha hecho acreedora de una bonita librería y es así como  ella se gana la vida honradamente. Ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo y a lo que hace para que en su hogar nunca falte el pan de cada día, aunque ella desea que su negocio crezca un poco más y es por eso que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL  para comprar: Resmas de papel, Pegamento, Sacapuntas, Lapiceros, Lápiz u otros. Busca con esto hacer de su librería un lugar donde las personas encuentren de todo y poco a poco ir mejorando su calidad de vida, confía en Dios que la ayuda será recibida y agradece a las personas que de buen corazón ayudan sin pedir nada a cambio
texts.en: Celina is 47 years old and lives with her family, her husband and their grown children.  Her children are working hard at obtaining their bachelor's degrees.  They are very happy because they will be graduating soon and will be able to help their parents to bring money into the home.  Celina is very friendly, which is a great quality of hers.  Thanks to her friendliness, she has a lot of customers.  Through hard work and dedication, she has made herself into the owner of a beautiful paper goods store, which is how she makes an honest living.  Celina is very dedicated to her work, because of which her family is never lacking in their basic needs.  Even so, she wants her business to grow a little more.  So she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase reams of paper, glue, pencil sharpeners, pens, pencils and other items.  With these purchases, her store will become a place where people can find anything they may need and little by little, it will improve her quality of life.  Celina has faith in God that she will receive the help she is asking for, and she is grateful to the people who, out of a good heart, offer help without asking for anything in return.

loans.use: to purchase reams of paper, glue, pencil sharpeners, pens, pencils and other items.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama produces kenkey for sale (kenkey is an African dish made out of maize).  She has been in this business for some time now. She is a widow and  lives together with her 3 children at Nkrotrodo near Elmina.  She uses her income to feed and clothe her children. Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the production of more kenkey. With the new profits, Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for the production of more kenkey

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is a 22-year-old single man. He is employed and earns a small salary which is not enough to cover his needs.  For the past two years, he has also had an aluminum workshop; he purchases aluminum and works it into multiple forms of windows frames and cabinets and other items upon the request of clients. It has been a profitable venture, but it needs more support to cover its costs. Rami is requesting a loan from FATEN to purchase more aluminum to continue his work. This will enable him to meet his customers’ demands, which will increase his sales and boost his income. Rami is photographed inside his workshop.

loans.use: To buy aluminum for his workshop

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Carmen es uno más situado en la ciudad de Curuguaty con  14 mujeres las cuales son vecinas, amigas y parientes, y todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante y velar por sus sueños.
Salvadora es parte de este grupo, y trabaja en la venta de ropas, cuenta que es muy difícil la competencia hoy en día, pero le gusta lo que hace y lucha por su familia, y no se cansa, solicita de este crédito para poder tener más prendas y de esa forma dar mejor variedad a sus clientes.
Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben, pues les es de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: The Virgen del Carmen group is from the city of Curugaty and consists of 14 women who are neighbors, friends and parents. All of them work and help each other to make headway and to reach their dreams. Salavadora is one of the members, and she works selling clothing. She says it is very difficult with all the competition, but she likes what she does and tirelessly fights for her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase more clothing items and in this way offer more variety to her customers. The group members are grateful for the opportunity they are getting and think it will be very helpful.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eric Jack

texts.es:
Eric es un hombre de 26 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene un pequeño hijo de cuatro años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, gracias a su esfuerzo Eric pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con su pequeño y en algunas ocasiones comen juntos un riquísimo Ceviche, el cual es el plato favorito de ambos. 
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Eric trabaja como repartidor en una empresa de mensajería de su ciudad, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, Eric se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable y traba bien a los demás.
Eric se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña moto de segunda mano, de esta manera Eric podrá transportarse desde las lejanías de su hogar hasta su centro de trabajo y podrá hacer las reparticiones de mensajes de manera más rápida, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr sus metas y su sueño de tener su casa propia donde podrá brindarle mayor bienestar y seguridad a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Eric is a man of 26. He is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa. He has a young son who is 4 years old, whom he loves and who is his principal reason for living. He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all his efforts to raising his little one. Thanks to his efforts, Eric was able to study for a career as a systems engineer. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his little son, and sometimes they enjoy eating a delicious ceviche together, which is the favorite dish of both.

On his own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Eric works every day as a deliveryman for a messaging business in his city. He can work about 8 hours a day. Eric feels comfortable doing his work and believes that it is going well for him because he is very responsible and works well with others.

Eric is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks the help offered he will be able to make the purchase of a small secondhand motorcycle. In this way Eric will be able to transport himself from the remoteness of his home to his work center, and he will be able to make deliveries of messages more rapidly. Thus he will continue working and striving to reach his goals and his dream of having his own house, where he will be able to offer well-being and security to his little son.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
En la  Ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron un grupo de mujeres con el fin de formar un grupo, el cual lleva por nombre Mujeres Solidarias, han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo y trabajar bajo un marco de responsabilidad, actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo.
Felia, miembro del grupo vende verduras y cuenta que este ha sido su sustento y el de su familia hace un tiempo. Es una persona muy trabajadora y se cree muy capaz de seguir ayudando a los suyos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, como ser tomates, locotes, zanahorias, cebollas y demás.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguarí, a group of women got together to form the communal bank which carries the name "Mujeres Solidarias."  They are committed to stay united as a group, and to work within a framework of responsibility.  They are currently in their 4th loan cycle.

Felia is a member of the group who sells vegetables.  She says that this business has been the means of support for her and her family for some time.  She is a very hardworking person who believes that she is very capable of continuing to help her family.

Felia is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of vegetables, such as: tomatoes, peppers, carrots, onions and other vegetables.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, carrots, onions and other vegetables

loans.name: Soi

texts.en: Soi is a 25-year-old single woman with no children.  She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living.  She has 3 years of experience with this business.  Soi needs a loan to buy mixtures, sugar, foam cups, etc.  She plans to use her profits to improve her small business and to help her family’s financial situation.  Soi has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy mixtures, sugar, and foam cups for her ice-cake business.

loans.name: Mujeres Anfitrionas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Anfitrionas nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, donde cada una de las miembros tiene su trabajo independiente, pero se ayudan también y así salen adelante.
La Sra. Carmen, una de las miembros, es costurera, cuenta que está creciendo gracias al apoyo que está recibiendo de sus compañeras y de  fundación. Su meta es poder tener un gran taller de confecciones y también poder ayudar a las demás personas con fuentes de trabajo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y creciendo.
texts.en: The Mujeres Anfitrionas group started by bringing together a collection of working women from the same place. This group is from the city of San Lorenzo, where each one of the women works independently but also help each other make headway. Carmen, one of the members, is a seamstress. She says her business is growing thanks to the help she is receiving from her fellow members and Kiva partner Fundacion Paraguaya. Her goal is to be able to have a big sewing workshop and to be able to help her fellow members with their jobs. She is requesting the loan to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons and other sewing supplies so she can keep working and growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Asoiva

texts.en:
Asoiva is 37 years old and married with 5 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years. Asoiva needs a loan to buy a new weed sprayer, 5L of Gramoxone, bush knives, fertilizer, and other equipment.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Asoiva will use the profits from her sales to extent and expand her plantation and also help to support her family and kids.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, bush knives, gramoxone, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
This is Lily, 43, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Victor, a seaman, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lily operates a retail business. She buys slippers and sandals at wholesale prices and sells them individually with a little profit. She also sell bags and notebooks. Customers are attracted to buy due to her low selling prices. She also operates a variety store for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lily hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Faamaini

texts.en:
Faamaini is 63 years old and is married with 10 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years. Faamaini needs a loan to buy a new weed sprayer, 5L Gramoxone, bush knives, fertilizer, and other equipment she needs.

Faamaina has been a member of SPBD since 2009. She will use the profits from her sales to extent and expand her plantation and also help to support her family and kids."

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, bush knives, weed killer, gloves, shovels, and other equipment

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
This is Nilda. She previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used buy of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. She also has a variety store and the loan will be of big help for her businesses. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lily hopes to grow her business and become successful through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Kaisalina

texts.en: Kaisalina is a 37-year-old married woman with 7 children. She makes and sells ice-cakes (similar to a snow-cone) in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Kaisalina needs a loan to buy flavor mixtures, sugar, foam cups, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her small business and to help her family's financial situation. Kaisalina has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy flavor mixtures, sugar, foam cups, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras De San Isidro Group

texts.es:
MUJERES LUCHADORAS DE SAN ISIDRO” esta en el tercer ciclo con 23 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción, donde cada una tiene su actividad productiva, pero también trabajan juntas y así se ayudan.
Una de las historias es la de la Sra. Cintia, quien se dedica a la venta de helados. Ella tiene su pequeña heladería, con la cual surte a la gente de su barrio con helados muy ricos y de buena calidad. Cuenta que ya tiene buena clientela y que de a poco está creciendo y mejorando.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de helados de variados sabores, con los cuales quiere poder dar una buena variedad a sus clientes y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Luchadoras de San Isidro", with 23 women from the city of Asunción, is on its third cycle. Each of them has her own productive activity, but they also work together so they help each other.

One of the stories is that of Cintia, who is dedicated to sell ice cream. She has her small ice cream shop, with which she supplies the people of her neighborhood with delicious and good quality ice creams. She is requesting this loan to buy ice creams of different flavors. She expects to provide good variety to her customers and continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy ice-creams to sale.

loans.name: 15 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité 15 de Mayo cuenta con 11 integrantes donde todas tienen actividades productivas. Formaron el comité con el compromiso de trabajar en  conjunto, para poder ayudar a sus familias e ir progresando en el trabajo de cada una de ellas.
Etelvina, la presidenta del grupo cuenta, que al principio fue difícil convencer a sus amigas, pero que después accedieron y gracias al trabajo de todas están mucho mejor. Ella tiene una despensa y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para abastecer su local, como ser fideos, arroz, leche, manteca, huevos y demás, ya que siempre quiere tener de todo, para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes.
texts.en: The May 15th group consists of 11 members who all have productive activities. They came together to form the group and help each other's family and make progress with all of their businesses. Etelvina, the group president, found it difficult to convince her friends at first, but once they joined, and thanks to everyone's hard work, they are doing much better. Etelvina has a convenience store and is requesting the loan to purchase supplies to stock her store, like noodles, rice, milk, lard, eggs and other items, since she always wants to have everything to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, rice, milk, lard, eggs and other items.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья уже несколько раз использовала средства, полученные от КИВА, для развития и расширения своего бизнеса. Наталья планомерно развивает две точки продаж, торгуя на одной из них самостоятельно и поставив реализатора на другой. Доходы у нее – стабильные. Недавно смогла приобрести для себя тренажер, чтобы внимательнее следить за здоровьем. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту от КИВА Наталья смогла выкупить коллекцию спортивного ассортимента весна-лето (костюмы, шорты, футболки) по хорошим ценам и успешно ее реализовала. 
В этот раз Наталья обратилась за кредитом в 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы завезти новый товар на вторую точку, увеличив сбыт. Она планирует закупить теплые спортивные костюмы и куртки под реализацию в зимний сезон, когда начинается сезон активного лыжного отдыха. Наталья не боится трудностей, однако, немного переживает по поводу роста продаж одежды через интернет, из-за которого молодежь стала меньше бывать на рынке и, значит, наблюдается определенный спад в торговле.
texts.en: Nataliya has received loans from Kiva a few times in the past in order to develop and expand her business. She is systematically developing two sales outlets, working at one herself and having hired a salesperson for the second one. She earns a steady income from them, and recently has been able to buy exercise equipment so she can take care of her health. Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, she was able to buy a collection of spring-summer sportswear (tracksuits, shorts, and t-shirts) at a good price, and successfully sold it. This time, Nataliya is seeking a loan of 8,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to buy new goods for her second outlet to increase sales. She plans to buy warm tracksuits and jackets to sell for the winter when the ski season kicks into high gear. Nataliya is not afraid of difficulties; however, she is somewhat worried about the increase of internet shopping for clothing, as young people are not coming to shop at the market as often, which is leading to a drop-off in business.

loans.use: to purchase new goods for her second sales outlet

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en: Rasela  is a 52-year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells popcorn in her community to earn a living. She has six years of experience in this business. Rasela needs a loan to buy popcorn, butter, popcorn machine and salt. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and provide the best quality product. Rasela has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy popcorn, butter, popcorn machine and salt.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en: Monina is 52 years old and married with four children. She is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Monina buys and sells ready-to-wear dresses and other clothes. She had been in this business for 34 years and earns 18,920 PHP a month. Monina joined GDMPC in 2007. Monina is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nuufou

texts.en: Nuufou  is a 59-year-old married woman with eight children. She makes and sells Samoan cocoa in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience in this business. Nuufou needs a loan to re-supply her business with more cocoa beans, a cocoa grinder and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to maintain her small business and provide support to her family. Nuufou has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy cocoa beans, a cocoa grinder and foam cups.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Villa Bonita Group

texts.es:
El comité es un grupo muy activo, y a pesar de tener algunos inconvenientes supieron salir adelante , el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo 7º .
La Sra. Maria es la tesorera del grupo , y siempre sabe  llevar bien adelante su puesto ya que es muy estricta, ella tiene ventas de Bijouterie de todas clases y quiere seguir trabajando ya que desea que su negocio crezca y poner otras cosas mas con lo que ya tiene  con su esfuerzo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar pulseras, cadenas, anillos y demás bijou, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes y así seguir ganándose la vida honradamente.
texts.en: This group is very active and despite some inconveniences the members have been able to overcome and make headway and are now in their seventh loan cycle. Maria is the group treasurer and takes her position seriously because she is very strict. She sells all kinds of jewelry and wants to keep working because she wants her business to grow and add more to it with hard work. She is requesting the loan to purchase bracelets, chains, rings and other jewelry to offer her customers so she can keep making an honorable living.

loans.use: to purchase bracelets, chains, rings and other items.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla is a 50-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Priscilla been raising pigs/hogs for five years and she earns an income of 6,500 PHP per month. Priscilla became a member of GDMPC in 2011. She is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feed for her pigs. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Uila

texts.en: Uila is 38 years old and married with four children. She has a plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Uila needs a loan to buy more taro and small banana plants to grow and tools. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Uila will use the profits from her sales to help the business extension.

loans.use: to buy taro and banana plants, fertilizer, shovels and gloves.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна выращивает помидоры, огурцы, редис в тепличных условиях для последующей реализации на рынках своего региона. Она занимается этим бизнесом уже 20 лет. У Татьяны две теплицы, плюс одна дополнительная для рассады. 
Татьяна планирует вложить кредит в размере 17 000 гривен в подготовку теплиц к высадке помидор, а также в закупку семян, пленки, навоза и удобрений для нового сезона. В этом году Татьяна планирует натянуть на теплицах вторую пленку, чтобы немного раньше высаживать овощи и, следовательно, начинать раньше ими торговать.
texts.en: Tatyana grows tomatoes, cucumbers, and radishes in greenhouses to sell at the markets in the region where she lives. She has been doing this business for 20 years. She has 2 greenhouses, plus another one for seedlings. She wants to take a loan of 17,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to prepare the greenhouses for planting tomatoes and to buy seed, plastic covering, manure and other fertilizers for the new season. This year, Tatyana plans to put a second layer of plastic film on her greenhouses so she can plant her vegetables a little earlier, thereby allowing her to start selling them earlier.

loans.use: to prepare greenhouses and to buy seeds, plastic greenhouse covering, and fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina "Mujeres Unidas”, tiene 13 integrantes, donde cada una tiene su respectiva ocupación. Gracias al apoyo de todas, ya están en su segundo ciclo y quieren llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
La  Sra  Paola, quien es la presidenta, se dedica a la venta de frazadas, comenta que en época de calor igual vende sus productos, ya que muchas personas en el calor utilizan acondicionador de aire y frazadas, pero también hace otros trabajos.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frazadas, para surtirse y seguir ganadose la vida de esta forma. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe, la cual no va a desaprovechar.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas (United Women) has 13 members, where each one has her respective occupation. Thanks to everyone’s support, they are already in their second loan cycle, and they want to reach the top level of the program. 

Paola, who is the president, works selling blankets. She says that during the warm season she still sells her products, since many people in the heat use an air conditioner and blankets, but she also does other work. 

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of blankets, in order to stock up and continue earning a living in this way. She is grateful for the help that she receives, which she is not going to waste.

loans.use: to purchase blankets to sell.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир живет в Мелитополе. У него есть собственный автобус, на котором он перевозит предпринимателей в Одессу за товаром. Этим Владимир зарабатывает на жизнь уже 15 лет. 
Владимиру необходима сумма в 5000 гривен для того, чтобы подготовить свое транспортное средство к зимнему сезону: поменять резину на зимнюю, сделать необходимый ремонт и прочее.
texts.en: Vladimir lives in Melitopol. He has his own bus that he uses to drive businesspeople to Odessa to buy goods. He has earned his living this way for the last 15 years. Vladimir is now seeking a loan of 5,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to prepare his vehicle for winter by changing to winter tires, doing necessary repairs, and so on.

loans.use: to prepare his vehicle for winter

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four children. Teresita has raised pigs for fattening and for meat purposes for almost 11 years. She usually gets a monthly income of 6,000 PHP. 

She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase feeding supplies. Teresita has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Teresita hopes to raise pigs on a large scale and gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга живет в Мелитополе. Она занимается торговлей мужской одеждой, рубашками, джинсовой одеждой, а также женской и подростковой одеждой на местном привокзальном рынке. В этой сфере Ольга работает вот уже 17 лет. Магазин, в котором она торгует, она арендует. 
Ольга обратилась к КИВА за суммой в 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонную мужскую, женскую и подростковую одежду под реализацию.
texts.en: Olga lives in Melitopol. She sells menswear, including shirts and denim clothes, as well as womenswear and clothing for teenagers at the local market near the train station. She has been working in this field for 17 years. She rents the shop where she works. Olga has come to Kiva for a loan of 21,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to buy seasonal clothing for men, women, and teenagers for her to re-sell.

loans.use: to buy seasonal menswear, womenswear, and clothing for teenagers to sell

loans.name: Glicelle Anne

texts.en:
This is Glicellle, 27, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Mario, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Glicelle operates an accessories retail business. What she basically does is buy accessory items from a wholesaler and sell them by the piece or pack for a profit. Her products range from beaded jewelry like necklaces and other similar products to bags, lotion and perfume. Customers are attracted to buy from Glicelle's business due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy greater quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Glicelle hopes to have her own house and dreams of being able to give her children a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Soifua

texts.en: Soifua is 51 years old and married. She has 2 children. She has a small garden where she grows taros and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Soifua needs a loan to buy new weed spray, fertilizers and etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Soifua will use the profits from her sales to increase the quality of her plantation and also the financial support for her family.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, fertilizers, shovels, gloves.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 32,000 PHP loan to buy beverages, groceries, toiletries and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josefina hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she dreams that her children will be successful. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beverages, grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials needed for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Sergio Sr.

texts.en: Sergio Sr. is 43 years old, and is a married entrepreneur of Militar, Tukuran with 7 children. He is earning from his fishing business. It has been running for almost 4 years now and he earns 3,000 PHP a month. To improve his business, he has borrowed 5,600 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit, which he just joined recently, to obtain fishing equipment such as nets. Before long, he is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain fishing equipment such as nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Apotala

texts.en:
Apotala is 49 years old and married. She has 6 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taros and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Apotala needs a loan to buy a new weed sprayer, 5L Gramoxone, bush knives, fertilizer and other equipment she requires. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Apotala will use the profits from her sales to extent and expand her plantation and also help to support her family and her kids.

loans.use: to purchase bush knives, weed killer, fertilizer, gloves and shovels.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, 32, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and she manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually support her own needs and the needs of her mother.

Evangeline buys and sells charcoal. She buys big quantities of charcoal and then sells it by the bucket or sack. She also sells ice and coconut. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 550 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of charcoal and additional capital for her electronic load. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evangeline hopes to help her mother financially and dreams to be with her longer. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
This is Gleceria. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Gleceria would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help Gleceria to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gleceria dreams to expand her store and hopes to give a good education to her daughter through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.ru: Зайнура   женщина в возрасте 35 лет.  Замужем, имеет 3 детей.  Она работает учительницей в средней школе  в своем районе  около 15 лет.  Муж её  водитель .   Занимается перевозкой  строительных материалов  по заказу. Дети Зайнуры  пока учатся в школе.   Дом   где они живут  нуждается в капитальном  ремонте, условия очень плохие. Зайнура   с  мужем  столько лет  работая накопили  денег  для ремонта но все же этих денег  не хватает и она обратилась в Арванд чтобы получить кредит и закончить свой ремонт.  На полученный кредит Зайнура планирует купить строительные материалы. Заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Zaynura is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. She has been working as a teacher in a junior high school in her area for around 15 years. Her husband is a driver who transports construction material. Her children are all in school. The house where she lives with her family is in need of major renovations as the conditions are very bad. Zaynura and her husband have been working for many years to save up money for repairs, but have not yet managed to set aside enough. For this reason, Zaynura has come to Arvand for a loan so she can finish the renovations. She plans to use the money to buy building materials. She is grateful in advance to Arvand for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is from Oroquieta City. She is 49 years old. Norma is married and has three children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business venture making and selling food like barbeque and many other types. Norma been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Norma joined GDMPC. Norma is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
This is Merlita. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and to pay her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Merlita dreams to expand her store and hopes to give her children a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
