This is Catalina. She previously accessed an 25,000 PHP loan that she utilized to purchase garden inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan that she will be utilizing to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for the maintenance of the garden. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Catalina hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
This is Adoracion. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan that she will be utilizing to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for the maintenance of the farm. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Adoracion hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a good life by the grace of God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en: Genevie, is married and has 3 children. She is 34 years old and lives in Militar, Tukuran. To earn a living, Genevie operates a family business venture: she sells fish while her husband harvests fish. She has been in this business for 11 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP from this business. She has requested a loan of 7,300 PHP to buy fishing materials. Genevie joined GDMPC this year. In the future, Genevie wants to build a house and to finish educating her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials.

loans.name: Saveun

texts.en:
Saveun (pictured here) and her husband are rice, potato and sugar cane farmers. They live in a village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and three daughters.

Saveun had asked and used her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides (http://partners.kiva.org/pa2/loan/357878).
 
She hopes to continue her farming business. This is why she has applied for another loan in the amount of $300.

loans.use: to continue her farming business by purchasing fertilizer and oil gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Maju Lancar 1 Group

texts.en:
Musalifah, 39, is blessed with two children: Rizky, 17 years old, now in Senior High School, and Riko, 15 years old, now in Junior High School. Her first business sold fried snacks with capital of 500,000 IDR. Now she has expanded and changed her business to sell "nasi uduk," one of traditional foods of Indonesia which consists of rice cooked with coconut milk along with a spread of egg and noodles.

Musalifah loves her business. Her dream is to send her children to a college until they attain master's degrees. Musalifah wears the black T-shirt in this photo.

loans.use: to add capital and to buy the material coffee

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en: This is 48-year-old Rosaline. She is married and has 4 children aged 5, 9, 14 and 21. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to help in running the business. In 2008, Rosaline established her food, drinks and catering services business. The business was started to help her retired husband in running the affairs of the home. Her business is located on the outskirts of town and her main customers are lectures' students and visitors to the area. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Rosaline requires this loan in order to buy drinks and beverages. She hopes that this loan can improve the stock and maximize profit. In the future, Rosaline plans to establish another canteen at the other side of the town. She thanks ARD for the support, and also thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks and beverages

loans.name: Tuinanau

texts.en: Tuinanau is 53 years old and married with 6 children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Tuinanau needs a loan to purchase more seeds and farming tools such as fertilisers, shovels and a bush knife to expand her vegetable garden. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Tuinanau will use the profits from her sales to save in her account for family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and farming tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed in making snacks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy turntables, amplifier, headphones, etc.

loans.name: Pablo Franco

texts.es: Pablo Franco cincuenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus  hijos en casa propia. Él posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora portones, balcones, entre otros ya tiene varios años de experiencia en el rubro, que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor y además obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar de trabajo se ubica en una zona de alta incidencia comercial y está en su residencia, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un servicio excelente; Pablo es un hombre emprendedor dispuesto a salir adelante y siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar y mantener el éxito, en esta temporada quiere aumentar la producción pero no posee de suficiente capital para la compra de materia prima por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro por mayor. Pablo Franco es muy responsable y tiene buenas referencias de pago, se siente satisfecho por la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pablo Franco, 59, lives with his common-law wife and children in their own house.  He has a metal structure workshop where he makes gates, balcony rails, etc. and has several years' experience in the sector, giving him the capacity to make quality products and earn a good profit.  He works from his home which is in a busy commercial area.  He has many customers because people know of his good quality and low prices, but especially his excellent service.

Pablo is an enterprising man who is determined to get ahead, always looking for new opportunities to be successful.  Currently, he wants to increase production but does not have sufficient capital to buy raw material.  Therefore, he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to buy wrought iron wholesale.  Pablo Franco is very responsible and has a good credit record.  He is satisfied with this support and sure he can pay back the loan, while giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy wrought iron wholesale.

loans.name: Emilio Ernesto

texts.es: Emilio Ernesto de treinta años de edad vive junto a sus padres y su hermano, el es empleado, un excelente trabajador honesto, responsable y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante pues quiere sobresalir y alcanzar el éxito, como todo buen hombre lo mas importante en su vida es su familia y el trabajo con el que sostiene su hogar, desde hace algún tiempo su vivienda ha tenido varios deterioros necesita cambio de techo y algunas otras reparaciones necesarias para la seguridad y la comodidad de todos los miembros de su familia, para este hombre es indispensable empezar cuanto antes la mejora de la vivienda pero tiene una dificultad y es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la inversión por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar sementó, tejas, polines, ladrillos, etc. Emilio Ernesto tiene buenas referencias de pago, se siente satisfecho con la ayuda y asegura que saldara la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez tiene confianza que ofrecerá en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Emilio Ernesto, 30, lives with his parents and brother.  He is employed and is an excellent, honest, responsible worker with a lot of determination to get ahead and be successful.  Like all good people, the most important thing to him is his family and the job he has to support the household.  For some time now, his house has been in a bit of disrepair and needs a new roof as well as other minor repairs for the family's safety and comfort.  He wants to start the home improvements but does not have sufficient capital.  Therefore, he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to buy cement, tiles, poles, bricks, etc.

Emilio Ernesto has a good credit record and is grateful for this support.  He is confident he can pay back the loan on time, while being able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cement, tiles, poles and bricks.

loans.name: Marleni Carmen

texts.es:
Marleni es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es madre y padre para sus hijos; lamentablemente Marleni no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Papita con Maní para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Marleni trabaja como cocinera en un pequeño hotel de su ciudad, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, Marleni se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Marleni se siente agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de la inscripción, matricula y materiales de estudio, ya que uno de sus hijos iniciará sus estudios universitarios y Marleni desea poder ayudarlo, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Marleni, 36, lives in the city of Nazca with her two children, who she adores and who are the main motivation in her life.   She is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who dedicates all her effort to providing for her family.  She is both mother and father to her children and, unfortunately, was unable to get professional training, although she would have liked to.  In her free time she enjoys watching educational programmes on TV and sometimes she cooks a delicious Papita con Maní (potato and peanut stew) to share with family.

Marleni is a dedicated employee who works as a cook in a small hotel in the city.  She works eight hours a day and enjoys what she does.  She believes she is successful because of her delicious cooking and the kind service she provides to customers.

Marleni is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to them she is able to cover education registration fees and materials costs for one of her children who is a university student.  She wants to continue working hard to reach her goal of helping her children become good professionals.

loans.use: To cover educational registration fees and materials costs.

loans.name: Unidas De Saguazu Group

texts.es:
El comite lleva por nombre Unidas de Saguazu,  ellas han asumido el compromiso de  mantener a su grupo unido y de solucionar cualquier problema que pueda surgir. Una de estas mujeres es Lidia, quien vende Carbón.
Ella comenta que la venta ha crecido mucho, ya que las personas hoy en día prefieren cocinar a carbón ya que es mas barato y eso la ayuda mucho,  a tener mas venta.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón en cantidad, ya que tiene siempre mucha venta y no quiere quedarse sin su principal producto.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Unidas de Saguazu".  The members have taken on the commitment to keep the group together and resolve any problem that may arise.  One of the members is Lidia, who sells charcoal for a living.

She says sales have increased dramatically because nowadays people prefer to cook with charcoal which is a much cheaper fuel.

She is requesting a loan to buy larger volumes of charcoal due to the large demand, as she does not want to run out of her main product.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes es de la ciudad de Pilar, ella es dueña de una despensa, se dedica a esta actividad  hace más de 5 años, no tiene esposo pero si dos hijos por quienes ella siempre ha luchado con todas sus fuerzas.
Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y con buena moral de pago. Nos cuenta que se ve sola con sus dos hijos, y por eso tiene que esforzarse el doble y darles todo y que tengan así una vida digna.
Solicita de este crédito para poder surtir su negocio con bebidas, comestibles, verduras, frutas y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Mercedes is in the city of Pilar. She is the owner of a store. She has done this activity ofr more than 5 years. She doesn't have a husband but she does have two children for whom she has always fought with all of her strength. 

She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman with a good payment ethic. She tells us that she is alone with her children, so she has to have double the effort and give them everything they need so they can have a dignified life. 

She is asking for this loan so she can stock her business with beverages, food, vegetables, fruit, and more. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving and it will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy beverages, food, vegetables, fruit and more.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora Rocio de 27 años, casada con el Sr Eladio, tienen un hijo de 7 años de edad que va a la escuela en el primer grado.
Ella es ama de casa, vive con su familia en la ciudad de Villa Elisa y con ellos también vive su suegra,  su esposo trabaja como vendedor en una casa de venta de autopartes, y es el sostén principal de la casa.
Ella cuenta que quiso ayudar a su marido y se puso a estudiar para hacer servicios de manicura y pedicuro, colocación de uñas, etc.  Y de esa forma esta ayudando a su marido, ya que realiza servicios a domicilio y están saliendo adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de esmaltes en variedad de colores, pestañas y uñas postizas, cremas exfoliantes para pies, cremas de masajes, etc.
texts.en:
Rocio is 27 years old. She is married to Eladio. They have a 7 year old son who is in first grade.  She is a housewife who lives with her family in the city of Villa Elisa and her mother in law lives with them as well. Her husband works in a car parts business and he is the family's main breadwinner.

She says that she wanted to help her husband so she began to study how to do manicures and pedicures, how to apply fake nails, etc. In this way, she is helping her husband, because she offers the service in people's homes and they are getting ahead. 

She is asking for this loan to buy nail polish is a variety of colors, fake eyelashes and nails, exfoliant creams for feet, massage creams, etc.

loans.use: to buy nail polishes in a variety of colors, fake eylashes and  nails, exfoliant creams for feet, massage creams, etc.

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
La Sra. Pablina tiene 48años. Ella es casada con dos hijos en edad escolar. Tiene su despensa ubicada en su propio domicilio hace más de 4 años. Además de esto ella tiene varias maquinas de costura, donde trabaja en confección de prendas de vestir sobre medidas y también algunos uniformes  para una escuela de la zona.
Necesita de este crédito para comprar unos rollos de telas para remeras y busos para las clases de educación física que se desarrollan en la institución escolar. Ella anhela ver que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y poderles servir de ejemplo a estos, pues toda su vida fue una persona emprendedora, legado que desea dejar muy profundo en sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pablina is 48 years old. She is married with two schoolaged children. She has had a store located in her own house  for 4 years. In additino to that she also has various sewing machines where she makes clothes to order and also some uniforms for a local school.

She needs this loan to buy rolls of fabric for t-shirts and sweatshirts for physical education classes that are offered in the school. She longs to see her children finish their studies and to be an example for them. All of her life she has been an enterprising person, and this is a legacy she deeply wants to leave her children.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Romanita

texts.en:
Romanita is from Sto Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 58 years old. Romanita is a widow and has one child. To make a living, Romanita has been running a general store for eight years and earns 5,800 PHP a month for these activities. 

Romanita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used  to purchase new items such as candies, milo (brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps etc. In 2008, Romanita joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo (brand of malted milk), shampoo and soaps.

loans.name: Anoanoai

texts.en: Anoanoai is a 53-year-old married woman with 7 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Anoanoai needs a loan to buy ingredients to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to fulfill her family's needs. Anoanoai has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil and baking soda for her pancake-making business.

loans.name: Triwana Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang was successful in maintaining her pigs and her husband supports her business because it can help to improve the family income. She was also successful in renovating the barn.

Now she needs a new loan to purchase piglets and she also has a plan to buy a saw. Because the loan is not enough to purchase it all, her husband has given her money to support the business. She hopes to get healthy piglets so she can sell them to other breeders in her village.

loans.use: To buy piglets and a saw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
Sari Karya group is receiving another loan from MUK of  22,500,000 IDR. There are 15 members in the group and each member will get 1,500,000 IDR. The loans are used to support the pig businesses.

Ni Ketut used the loan to buy two superior quality piglets for fattening. The price today is IDR 450,000 per piglet. The remainder of the loan was used to buy feed. To reduce the cost of feed, Ni Ketut is feeding her pigs with traditional feeds made from banana stems and various kinds of leaves.

Ni Ketut is pursuing this effort in order to support the family financially and particularly so she can participate in the cost of educating her two children.

loans.use: To buy two superior quality piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Faatolu

texts.en:
Faatolu is 50 years old and married with 11 children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Faatolu needs a loan to buy equipments and fertilizer for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. 

Faatolu will use the profits from her sales to pay her children's school fees and to purchase a new land for her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, a  wheel barrow, a bush knife and spears.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials needed in the beauty salon.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, ella vive junto a cuatro hijos menores de edad y dos de los mayores en ocasiones le ayudan con cosas pequeñas que hacer en el negocio. Pilar posee una venta de cosméticos, tintes para el cabello, cremas, productos para el cuidado de los pies entre otros más, siendo un negocio bastante surtido. Pilar  solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, debido a que cuenta con varios clientes, por lo que se le hace muy necesario invertir en muchos más productos sobretodo maquillaje y cremas para la cara las cuales poseen mayor demanda. Pilar deseo aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos quienes tanto necesitan de ella.
texts.en:
Pilar is a very hardworking woman and a fighter.  She lives with her four minor children; two of the older ones sometimes help her with little things in the business.  Pilar sells cosmetics, hair dye, creams, foot-care products, and other things in a well-stocked business.

Pilar is asking Integral for a loan because she has several customers, which makes it necessary to invest in many more products, especially make-up and face cream, which are in high demand.

Pilar wants to increase her income and give her children everything they need, and they need so much from her.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is from Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old, married and has two children. Elsa's source of income comes from her general store which she has run for five years and from which she earns 2,500 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines.  She is 36 years old and is married with two children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty food products in the local community. Jocelyn has engaged in her business for 3 years and earns 9,000 PHP a month. Jocelyn has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sale. In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Ms. Shahida is a 29-year-old married woman. She, along with her husband, are in the business of making artificial jewellery and have been for many years. The man shown in the photo is Shahida’s husband.  The business has great potential for growth and Shahida is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them. They have four children, none of them are going to school. The couple wishes to send them to school by trying to increase their earnings to afford educational expenses of their children. In order to meet the orders on time and boost their sales, Shahida requested for a loan of 10,000 PKR to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to increase their net income and intends to use that to provide good and quality education for their children.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 32-year-old married woman with one child. 

She would like to start growing taro plants and bananas to earn a living. Jacinta has requested a loan to buy seeds, tools and bushknifes to start her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD for two years.Jacinta will spend her profits to purchase a new land to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bush knives, fertilizers, shovels and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina is 33 years old. She lives in Camanga, Tukuran. Erlina is married and has four children. Erlina is a farmer and she operates a gardening business venture to earn a living. She's been doing this business for eight years. Every month she earn PHP 5,000 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 6,500 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This year, Erlina became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Erlina hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat to resell.

loans.name: Paulina De Jesus

texts.es: Paulina de 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su familia. Ella se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace algunos años. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener activo su negocio y es así como  quiere mantenerlo ya que es uno de sus principales fuentes de ingresos. El negocio está ubicado en su hogar de habitación el cual ha ubicado de manera estratégica de tal forma que parezca atractivo para los clientes y se sientan motivados a solicitar sus productos. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora y responsable ya que siempre que se pone una meta trabaja muy duro para lograrla, tomando en cuanta que siempre tiene presente que desea brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Paulina ha estado pensando en la forma de hacer crecer su negocio ya que últimamente ha notado un leve aumento en la demanda de sus productos. Todo esto la ha motivado a acercarse a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito y así poder invertir en productos de tienda como: frijoles, arroz, macarrones, pan, leche, café, azúcar,  etc. de tal forma que pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y pueda logar un amento en sus ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Paulina, 49, lives in her own house with her family.  She has made a living with her store for several years.  With a lot of effort and dedication she has managed to keep her business active because it's one of her main sources of income.  The business is located strategically in her home so it's attractive to the customers, who are motivated to request her products.

She's known as a hardworking and responsible woman because she always has a goal for herself.  She works very hard to achieve this, always keeping in mind that she wants to give her family the best.

Paulina has been thinking about how to make her business grow because lately she has noticed a slight increase in demand for her products.  All this has motivated her to approach Integral for a loan to invest in store products such as beans, rice, pasta, bread, milk, coffee, sugar, etc.  This way she can offer her customers better service and increase her profits, thus allowing her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, pasta, bread, milk, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Ana es una joven alegre y trabajadora quien vive con su pequeña hija de seis años de edad, y su madre. Para salir adelante y tener una vida estable junto a su hija, Ana trabaja comercializando carne de res en el mercado de su lugar de vivienda, negocio con el que puede sostener su hogar y ayudarle a su madre con todos los gastos. Ana solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de carne de la mejor calidad y así de esta manera poder agradas a todos sus clientes, quienes son su prioridad ya que gracias a ellos su negocio se mantiene firme, con lo que Ana aumenta sus ventas y tendrá una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Ana is a happy and hardworking young woman who lives with her young daughter, age 6, and her mother.  Ana works selling beef in the market in her home so she can get ahead and have a stable life with her daughter.  With the business she can support her household and help her mother with all the expenses.

Ana's asking Integral for a loan so she can buy the best quality of beef wholesale.  This will please her customers, who are her priority because thanks to them business is steady.  With this Ana's sales will increase and she'll have a better life.

loans.use: to buy beef

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Cherry Ly

texts.en:
This is Cherry, age 36, who is a resident of Caloocan in the Philippines. She is married to Von, a driver, and she is a mother to her child. She and her husband manage their household as they operate a business. She is working hard to provide an income to her family to pay for their everyday expenses.

Cherry has a franchise store called Buko Twister. She sells buko shakes (coconut smoothies), which are famous in the Philippines because of the tropical climate. She also has a direct selling business for additional income. Her customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns PHP 600 daily.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy ingredients and to pay for the maintenance of her equipment. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Cherry hopes to give her child a high-quality education and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and pay for the maintenance of her equipment for her business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 54-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Rosalina has been buying and selling fruits, particularly bananas, for two years now. She earns an income of 15,400 PHP per month. 

Rosalina became a member of GDMPC in 2010. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more bananas and other fruits to sell. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and other fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
This is Erminda, 30, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Erminda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Erminda dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly is married with 2 children. He is 38 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Rolly operates a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 2 years and every month he earns 7,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 24,800 PHP to purchase new items to expand his product offerings. This year, Rolly joined GDMPC. Rolly hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offerings.

loans.name: Soonalote

texts.en: For the last ffour years Soonalote, a 28-year-old married mother of two, has been operating a business selling twists, buns, donuts, sugars, powder, toothpaste, soups, etc. in her community. A member of SPBD since 2010, she has requested this loan to buy a variety of materials needed in her enterprise. Soonalote plans to use her profits to extend her business and to save for a better family future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour. twists, salt, ice blocks, and lolies for her store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Alma dreams that her children will finish studying with a good and quality education. She hopes that she and her family will continue to have good health and a strong spiritual life. She never fails to attend the fellowship* every week, for the teachings and sharing of the word of God continue to enlighten and uplift her spirit. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   DANAYA  est constitué de six femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Dialanikoro de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur quatrième prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments, d’habits et de céréales.
MARIAM qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première femme de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente de condiments et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 cartons de cube Maggi et 400Kg d’oignons avec les grossistes de Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The DANAYA group is made up of six women, all married, who are on average 41 years old and have five children.  They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers, and sons in the Dialanikoro district of the city of Bougouni.
They know each other as neighbors, friends, and through business.  In order to strengthen their buying power and to better conduct their businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their fourth loan.  The previous loans have been fully repaid.  This group of women is in the business of selling condiments, clothing, and cereals. 
MARIAM, the leader of the group, is the first woman from the right.  She buys and sells condiments and with her loan she plans to buy two cases of Maggi cubes and 400 kg of onions from the wholesalers in Sikasso.  She makes her sales at the market and from home, at retail, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed mainly of women.
She foresees making an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: With her previous loan, Alice was able to buy a gas cooker. This has made her services faster and more efficient. It has attracted more clients to her business, thereby increasing her sales. It's against this background that she now wants to buy warmers, which will further increase efficiency. With them, she will be able to prepare large amounts of food and still keep it warm regardless what time the customers come, especially since they do not all come to eat at the same time. With another loan she will buy more warmers which will support her outside catering dream. She is excited that the loans are helping her to improve her business, much as she still constrained by her limited funds.

loans.use: to buy food warmers.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion, a 56-year-old resident of Payatas, Philippines and a mother to her children, is married to Felomino, a driver. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Consolacion operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Erminda dreams of having a good life and hopes her grandchildren will have a good-quality education through all of her hard work on the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BENKADI  est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier DOUGOUNINA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de fruits et légumes avec BINTOU qui est la présidente du groupe  et la seule assise dans la photo. BINTOU et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 400Kg de pomme de terre avec les grossistes de Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group is made up of five women, all married, who are on average 34 years old and have six children.  They live together in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers, and sons in the Dougounina district of the city of Bougouni.
They know each other as neighbors, friends, and through business.  To strengthen their buying power and to better conduct their businesses, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their fifth loan.  The previous loans have been fully repaid.  This group of women is in the business of selling fruits and vegetables with BINTOU, who is the leader of the group and the only one seated in the photo.  With her loan, Bintou plans to buy 400 kg of potatoes from the wholesalers in Sikasso.  She makes her sales at the market and from home, at retail, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed mainly of women. 
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA which will be invested in her business and also go to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, age 44, who is a resident of Caloocan in the Philippines. She is married to Victor and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a tailoring business. At this time, she is working hard to continually earn an income to pay for her everyday expenses.  

Gina operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home-decorating items. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gina hopes her business will grow and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Purita is a farmer. She has been managing a gardening business of planting vegetables for six years. Every month she earns 2,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Purita has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Purita hopes her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Vine

texts.en: Vine is 49 years old and married with 5 children.She has a small plantation where she grows taro and banana crops that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Vine needs a loan to help pay for her children's education and tools for her business, such as  fertilizers, bush knives, and a wheel barrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Vine will use the profits from her sales to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy tools for her farm and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Puspa Kencana Group

texts.en:
Puspa Kencana group is getting their fourth loan from MUK. With eight members, the total loan is 12M IDR. The loan will be used to buy piglets and repair pens.

Ni Putu, as the head of the group, is using her loan to buy three piglets (superior species). The price for superior pig species is currently very expensive, ranging from Rp.400,000 - Rp.500,000. These pigs will be maintained for 5 months for fattening. Ni Putu expects that during the loan period, the pigs will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she has a dream of fixing her house.

loans.use: To buy three super quality piglets.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат молодая женщина, живет за городом в сельской местности со  своей семьей.   Её муж  сейчас находится в России на заработках, так как в селе нет хорошего постоянного дохода.   Он там занимается строительными работами и по возможности   каждый месяц присылает   домой деньги .  Вместе с Инобат жувут сын и дочь, которые помогают ей в хозяйстве.  Основным семейным доходом является откармливание скота. Накопив деньги которые прислал муж в течении года Инобат  недавно  купила еще несколько голов скота и старается развивать этот бизнес.  Таким образом она содержит семью.   Сейчас старший сын Инобат уже взрослый и она собирается его женить и она обратилась в нашу организацию за помощью и надеется получить у нас кредит на проведение свадьбы сына.  Она не в состоянии собрать большую сумму на это мероприятие и решилась взять кредит, а её муж обязуется помочь в погашении кредита.   Она заранее благодарит нас за   понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Inobat is a young woman who lives a lives in a small town in the countryside with her family.  Her husband is working in Russia, as there is no steady source of income in her village; he is a builder there and sends monthly money home as he is able.  Inobat lives with her son and daughter, who help her around the farm.  The main family income is from raising livestock.  By saving the money her husband has sent over the course of a year, Inobat bought a few head of livestock not long ago and she is trying to increase her business.  In this way, she can support her family.  Inobat's elder son is already grown up and she is preparing for his wedding, so she turned to our organization for help.  She would like to receive a loan to use for her son's wedding.  She is not capable of spending a large amount of money on this event and she has decided to take out a loan, which her husband has agreed to help repay.  She thanks us in advance for the understanding and support.

loans.use: to purchase wedding accessories

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a 51-year-old married woman with seven children.She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. Sina has requested a loan to buy seeds, tools and fertilizer to make an improvement in her business. She has been a member of SPBD for four years. 

Sina will spend her profits to pay for her children's school fees and to purchase more land to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, a wheelbarrow, and chemicals.

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara is 45 years old  and comes from Kobuleti, West Georgia. She lives with her husband and two children (15 and 16 years old). Her husband sells agricultural products locally with his own car. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 3 calves and 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. 

Lamara owns a plot of land where potatoes and 100 nut trees are grown. She sells harvested produce locally as well as in the nearby villages. She is a very hard-working woman and has a rich experience in her business. 

Lamara requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, Lamara will expand her dairy business. It will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Lamara awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   TIESSIRI  est constitué de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur quatrième prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habits et de condiments.
 MAMA, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente d’habits et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150 mètres de tissus pour sa tricoterie et des bobines de files  avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses articles tricotés au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group is made up of 4 woman, who are all married and who, on average, are 30 years old and have 5 children. They live in nuclear families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the town of Bougouni. They know each other from neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. To increase their financial capacity in order to better conduct their businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is now their fourth loan. All of their previous loans have been repaid.

This group of women deals in clothes and in condiments. Mama, who is the president of the group, is the first woman in the photo on the right. She buys and sells clothes. With this loan, she hopes to buy 150 meters of fabric for her knitwear and spools of thread from wholesalers in Bougouni.

She sells her knitted goods at a market and from home, accepting cash and credit from customers who are mostly women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which she will use to invest in the [group's] businesses and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DANAYA  est constitué de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments, de tubercules et des habits.
SALIMATA qui est la présidente du groupe  et la  seule femme assise dans la photo, fait l’achat vente de condiments. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, divers  colis de condiments avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The DANAYA  group is made up of four women, all of them married, who are on average 42 years old and have, on average, four children. They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the Médine district of the town of Bougouni. They met through being neighbors, friends and business associates. To strengthen their financial capacity and improve their businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their third loan. The preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

This group of women sell condiments, tubers and clothing. SALIMATA who is the president of the group and the only woman who is seated in the photo sells condiments. She intends to use her portion of the loan to buy various packets of condiments from the wholesalers of Bougouni. She makes her sales in the market and at home, retail and for cash or credit, to a clientele essentially made up of women. She expects to make a monthly average profit of 90,000 F CFA which will be invested in her business and used to reimburse the loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Sipaepae

texts.en:
Sipaepae is a 75-year-old married woman with 8 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu,and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years.

Sipaepae has requested a loan to improve her business by buying new equipment. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Sipaepae hopes to earn more money to provide her family with everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, seeds, and bush knives.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
This is Liberty, 47, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Dante, a lineman, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband manages their household as they operate the business. At this time, she and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

Liberty operates an internet café business. Services like this become a need  as customer demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who need her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or office documentation; as well as customers who would just love to surf the net and visit any social network.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Liberty dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education and hopes to have their own house through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel de 48 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus dos hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace varios años. La tienda está ubicada en su hogar de residencia la cual ha sabido adecuar de tal forma que llame la atención de los clientes.  Sus vecinos dan buenas referencias tanto de su trabajo como de su persona. Es muy conocida y preferida ya que es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora la cual ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos quienes ven como ella se ha superado día a día. Su mayor deseo es seguir recibiendo los ingresos de su negocio que hasta el momento le han ayudado a cubrir gran parte de las necesidades de su hogar. Es por esta razón que se decidió en hacer este préstamo con el fin de incrementar su inventario ya que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios  para realizar dicha inversión por sus medios. El crédito que solicita a INTEGRAL es para comprar variedad de productos de tienda tales como: maíz, arroz, aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, golosinas, bebidas, macarrones, sopas, etc. ya que desea cubrir una mayor demanda de mercado que le permita incrementar sus ingresos de tal forma que pueda ofrecer a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Isabel, who is 48, lives in her own house with her two children.  She has now been running her shop for a number of years.  The shop is situated in her home, which she has adapted to attract customers' attention.  Her neighbours are complimentary both about her work and about Isabel as a person.  She is well known and popular as she is a very friendly and hardworking woman, and she has gained the trust of her neighbours, who can see how she has bettered herself day by day.  

Her dearest wish is to continue making an income from her business which, to date, has helped her to cover most of her household  needs.  She decided to apply for this loan to enable her to increase her stock, as she does not have the means to make such an investment on her own.  The loan which she is seeking from INTEGRAL will be used to buy a range of goods for the shop, such as: corn, rice, oil, rice, sugar, beans, sweets, drinks, macaroni, soups, etc.  She wants to meet growing market demand, as this will allow her to increase her income and provide better opportunities in life for her family.

loans.use: to buy goods such as: corn, rice, oil, rice, sugar, beans, sweets, drinks, macaroni, soups, etc.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of a 15-year-old son from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in her fishing business for more than 15 years now. 

Esmeralda is asking for a loan to purchase fishing materials such as nets, lead weights, buckets, and fuel for the boat. Through this investment, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Esmeralda dreams of making her business a success and saving money for future use.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets, lead weights, buckets, and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a 30-year-old married woman with 4 children. She makes and sells banana chips and taro chips in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business.

Racheal needs a loan to improve her home condition. She plans to use her profits to provide her children's education. Racheal has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy roofing, cement, nails, paint, and timber.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for viands and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and has four children.

For the past ten years, Mwanasha has had a small business selling cereals. She sells at the market in a strategic position that has attracted many regular clients. She feels responsible since she can help her spouse to cover the basic expenses.

Mwanasha is requesting a KES 20,000 loan from Yehu to help her cover the cost of purchasing cereals like beans, maize, peas, and others. She is sure to achieve a good income out of this investment.

loans.use: to purchase cereals like beans, maize, peas, and others.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
This is Rafael, 36, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. He is married to Rosiel, an operations manager, and he is a father to their children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rafael operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Rafael dreams to have a good life and hopes his child will have a good and quality education through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 29 years old, from the small village of Lanchkhuti district. He lives with his mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. 

Guram is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns a plot of land where maize and nut trees are grown. Guram and his mother work hard to insure a good harvest.

Besides, the family has a dairy business. They have six milk cows and 30 calves. They sell dairy products locally in an open market.  

Guram requested a loan to rent agricultural land. After purchasing another plot of land, he will implement his future plans. He plans to purchase additional calves and expand his dairy business. It will increase their income and he will be able to improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to rent agricultural land and purchase additional calves.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 29-year-old man. He is newly married and works with the rest of his family in agriculture, specifically in olive trees. This has been a profitable project, but there is not enough to cover all the costs.

Currently, Alaa is preparing to live in his new house with his wife. But due to a money shortage, some of the work has been stopped for awhile. So he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to continue the house by installing new windows and doors. 

Taking this loan will offer Alaa and his wife suitable home conditions so they can enjoy living in their new house.

loans.use: To install windows and doors.

loans.name: Rose Bernadette

texts.fr: Rose est une femme de 32 ans, mère de 2 enfants dont les ages sont de 4 et 2 ans. Elle gère un petit bar dans un quartier de la ville depuis 7 ans. Elle y vend des boissons hygièniques. Elle a acquis au cours de ces années une expèrience ce qui lui a permis de gagner une clientèle considérable mais son stock de marchandises ne permet plus de la satisfaire. Elle sollicite alors ce crédit pour pouvoir acheter plus de casiers de boissons et renforcer son stock de marchandises (boissons hygiéniques). Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie reinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera injecter dans l'ouverture d'un nouveau site et pour les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Rose is a woman of 32, mother of two children aged four and two. For seven years, she has been running a little bar in town where she sells healthful drinks. She has acquired enough experience over these years to be able to attract a sizable clientele but her stock of merchandise does not permit her to satisfy her customers. She is thus asking for this loan to be able to buy more cases of drinks and grow her stock of merchandise (healthful drinks). The profit that this  loan will bring in will be in part invested in her business with the rest going into opening a new venue and for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Halema

texts.en:
Halema is a 51-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to three sons, 26, 22 and 20 years old. One of them is employed and another is a university student. 

Halema's husband is a worker who gets a low salary that is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Halema wants to make some improvements and repairs to her old house, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to cover the costs, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the costs of repairing the house such as changing windows and painting. Taking this loan will create to Halema and her family suitable home conditions and enable them to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To repair the house.

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 56 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have eight children between 8 and 24 years old. All of them are enrolled in schools. 

He has spent 38 years in farming. He would like to get the Kiva loan for buying fertilizers and paying labor cost during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys is 44 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have five children between 5 and 20 years old. They are all enrolled in schools. 

He has been a maize farmer for the past 15 years. He would like to get the Kiva loan for buying fertilizers and paying labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Aza

texts.en:
Aza is from the Zestaponi district of West Georgia. She is 43 years old, a widow and lives with her children (21 and 23 years old). Her elder son works as an artisan locally and gets a monthly income. 

Aza leads the family agricultural business. In particular, she runs an animal husbandry business and has two cows, an ox and a pig. She milks the cows twice a day and produces cheese products that she sells at the local open market. In addition, the family owns a vineyard and agricultural land where they grow different kinds of vegetables.

The family is the beneficiary of state financial assistance as a family living below the poverty line. 

With the requested loan, Aza plans to start up a trade in secondhand clothes. She will purchase the clothes from wholesalers and sell them in the village among the villagers. According to her estimations, she will have many customers as secondhand clothes will be popular because of affordable prices. With the increased income, this family will improve their living conditions by purchasing better food and household items. A part of the loan will be used for covering the expenses related to death anniversary of Aza’s husband. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 33 years old, married, and has children. She is a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Edna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of  500 PHP a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Edna is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands the business. 

Edna hopes to give her children a good education and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work with her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week,  where she draws strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Nenana

texts.en: Nenana sells cosmetics, panties, ladies wear, children's dresses, and underwear. She also sells body cream and hair creams.  She is a single parent and has 2 children.  They live together at Nkrotrodo near Elmiina.  As a single parent, she uses her income for the general upkeep of her children.  Nenana will use her loan to purchase more goods to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, panties, ladies wear, children's dresses and underwear to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making viands

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a food vendor. She cooks banku (a dish made from corn dough) and serves it with okra soup and fish under a tree at Nkrotrodo near Elmina.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her husband is a carpenter.  She supports her partner to educate, feed and clothe her children.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize, vegetables, fish and other ingredients to cook her banku for sale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a stall in which she can sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, vegetables, fish and other ingredients to cook her banku for sale.

loans.name: Twizerimana Group

texts.fr:
Léa fait partie du groupe Twizerimana et habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de  50 ans. Elle a 3 enfants âgés de 11 à 17 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de haricot,  de banane,  et de maïs depuis  3 ans.

Elle est à son dixième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, de haricot, et de bananes  à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Avec le gain du commerce, elle parvient à  payer les frais scolaires des enfants, assurer les  soins de santé et nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
Léa is part of the group Twizerimana and lives in Gitega. She is a widow of 50 years old with three children aged 11 to 17 years. She has been a merchant selling beans, bananas, and corn for the past three years. She is currently on her tenth loan with Turame. Léa plans to use this loan from Kiva to increase her capital. She will do this by purchasing a large quantity of rice, beans, and bananas and reselling them, thus earning more income.

With the gains she makes as a merchant, Léa will be able to pay for her children's school fees. She will also be able to feed her family and ensure that they have proper health care.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of rice, beans, and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Santos Virginia

texts.es: Santos vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como taxista y así mismo vive junto a su hija de 14 años de edad que se dedica a estudiar. Santos posee una venta de jugos naturales, tamales, y otros platillos típicos, el negocio se encuentra sobre una calle principal donde transita gran cantidad de personas, incrementando sus ventas por la mañana cuando las personas se dirigen a su trabajo o al estudiar. Santos solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de frutas para realizar más jugos y así mismo materia prima para realizar más platillos típicos, los cuales producen ventas muy estables, principal razón para invertir en sus ventas y así poder contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Santos lives with her husband, a taxi driver, and her 14-year-old daughter, a student.  Santos has a business selling natural juices, tamales, and other traditional dishes.  The business is on a main street with a lot of passersby, which increases her sales in the morning when people are going to work or school.

Santos is asking Integral for a loan to buy fruit to make more juices and ingredients for traditional dishes, which produce very stable sales.

Her main reason for investing in her business is to be able to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruit to make fruit drinks

loans.name: Fulvia

texts.es:
La  Sra. Fulvia es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 52 años, es soltera, con 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, trabajan independiente. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de menudencia en el Mercado tiene muy buena clientela formada, buen ingreso. Ella es una persona que desde siempre ha trabajado y que desea seguir haciéndolo, pese a su edad.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de menudencias y así seguir dando un buen productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fulvia, 52, is from the city of Santaní.  She's single and has four children, all adults who work independently.  She makes a living buying and selling offal in the market.  She has very good stable customers and a good income.  She's someone who has always worked and who wants to continue doing so, in spite of her age.

She's requesting this loan to buy offal so she can continue giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy offal to sell

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino es un hombre viudo de 56 años, a pesar de la irreparable pérdida de su esposa fue el soporte único de sus 6 hijos, por quienes hoy se siente muy orgulloso de haberles dado todo el apoyo necesario. Con el esfuerzo que lo caracteriza ha logrado construir una casa de material noble para sus hijos y ya mayores lo acompañan y forman una gran familia unida. Desde muy joven llegó a esta parte de la selva con el objetivo de superarse y buscar una mejor vida, al no conseguir terrenos para cultivo se vio en la necesidad de involucrarse en el rubro del transporte rural, es así que lleva 15 años desempeñándose como tal y ha sido el mejor de los sustentos para sus hijos. No obstante, necesita disponer de tiempo en cualquier momento haciendo de su trabajo uno de los más abnegados y a la vez reconfortantes. Sin embargo en temporadas de lluvias, haces que las vías de acceso se complican más de lo normal.
Aunando el esfuerzo de muchos años tiene el deseo de ampliar una pequeña tienda de abarrotes cuyas encargadas sérían sus hijas, dentro del cual incluye la compra de víveres de primera necesidad así como la de conservas entre otros.
Desea en lo posterior realizar el cambio de su unidad por una de mayor capacidad para así continuar laborando como transportista. Viene siendo parte de MFP con 14 créditos, pues siempre ha mostrado la responsabilidad en el cumplimiento de sus pagos. Lo motiva pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que siempre fue una buena manera de trabajo con microcréditos.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de mercadería para implementar su tienda, como conservas y cereales.
texts.en:
Paulino is a 56 year old widower.  Because of the irreparable loss of his wife he was the only support for his six children.  He is now very proud of having given them all of the support they needed.  With the effort that he is known for, he managed to build a house of strong materials for his children.  They are now adults, they join him, and they form a great united family.

Ever since he was very young he came to this part of the jungle in order to improve himself and to look for a better life.  When he did not get land for crops, he felt it was necessary to get involved in the rural transportation business.  That is how he has been working for 15 years.  It has been the best way to support his children.  However, he needs to be ready to work at any time, making his work self-sacrificing yet rewarding.  Even so, during the rainy season the access to routes is more complicated than normal. 

With his collective efforts of many years, he wishes to expand his small grocery store.  His daughters will be in charge of it.  They store will sell basic needs items like preserves, among others.

Afterwards he will exchange his vehicle for one with a greater capacity in order to continue working as a driver.
