He has been part of MFP for 14 loans.  He has always demonstrated responsibility in making his payments.  It motivates him to belong to his communal bank because it was always a good way of working with microloans.

He will use the 1,000 soles to buy merchandise to implement his store with things like preserves and basic grains.

loans.use: to buy preserves, basic grains, and canned goods.

loans.name: Josiane Carole

texts.fr:
Josiane est une femme mariée de 39 ans, mère de 6 ans dont l'âge du premier est 20 ans et le dernier est 7 ans.
Elle detient une petite unité dans un coin de la ville où elle vend des produits de premières necessités depuis 7 ans. Grace à son dynamisme et sa compétence dans ce domaine, elle s'est fait une clientèle grandissante qu'elle n'arrive plus à satisfaire. Afin de palier à ce problème, elle voudrait ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour augmenter le stock de ses marchandises (riz, farine, beurre, chocolaté, lait en poudre etc...)et de ce fait ces ventes et marges bénéficiaires. Ces bénéfices lui permettront d'agrandir son activité en vue d'en faire une grande boutique, mais également de subvenir aux besoins (éducation) de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Josiane is a 39-year-old married woman, and mother of six children between the ages of seven and twenty years old. She has her small shop in a corner of the city. There, she has been selling basic necessities for the past seven years. Thanks to her energetic personality and her expertise in this field, Josiane has amassed an ever-growing clientele whose demands she can no longer satisfy.

To overcome this problem, she is seeking a loan from ACEP Cameroun so that she can increase the stock of goods she has on hand. She plans to purchase rice, flour, butter, chocolate, and powdered milk among other things. With this increase in her supplies, Josiane will be able to increase her sales as well as her income. This loan will enable her to expand her business into a larger shop, as well as to meet the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (including rice, flour, butter, chocolate, and powdered milk), for resale in her shop.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.fr: Bernard est jeune homme de 32 ans, célibataire avec un enfant âgé de 3 ans. Il a ouvert un petit salon de coiffure pour hommes qu'il gère depuis 10 ans. Grâce à son accueil chaleureux et son rapport avec son voisinage, il a pu acquerir une très forte clientèle dont des hommes d'affaires. Afin de palier à ce problème,, il voudrait ce crédit afin d'augmenter son stock de produits cosmétiques pour augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent ses bénéfices. Il réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité pour agrandissement et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de son enfant (éducation et nutrition) et de sa famille.
texts.en: Bernard is a 32-year old man, single and the father of a 3-year old child. He has a men’s hair salon that he has been managing for 10 years. Thanks to his friendly welcome and his good community relations, he has been able to build up a strong customer base that includes some businessmen. To respond [to demand], he would like to receive this loan in order to increase his stock of cosmetic products so that to increase his sales volume and consequently, his profits. He will reinvest a part of the revenues in further growth of his business, and the rest will allow him to provide for the needs of his child (education and food) and his family.

loans.use: to buy materials and merchandise [cosmetic products for his hair salon].

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame sells sanitary pads in Nkrotrodo near Elmina, which she has done for three years. Maame is a single parent with one child, so she uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay her child’s school fees. Maame will use her loan to purchase more sanitary pads to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sanitary pads for resale.

loans.name: Forgive

texts.en: Forgive sells cooking utensils and saucepans in Nkrontrodo near Elmina. She is married and has six children. Forgive has been selling for 10 years now.  She supports her husband in paying their children's school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more saucepans and cooking utensils for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her cooking utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans and cooking utensils for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.ru: Рахим   клиент Арванда  с 2010года,он занимается продажей мужской одежды на рынке.  Ему помогают его жена и сын. По началу он  не хотел брать кредит,так как не был уверен в своих доходах. Но по совету своих коллег по работе  рискнул получить кредит и превзошел свои ожидания. Дела Рахима  пошли на лад и он получил хорошую прибыль.  Постепенно расширил свою торговую точку и ассортимент товара.  Теперь он не боится получать кредиты в более больших размерах. Накануне зимнего периода он собирается закупить партию зимних мужских вещей на продажу.  Он рад что сотрудничает с Арванд и надеется до конца работать с этой организацией .
texts.en:
Rahimjon is Arvand's client since 2010. He makes a living by selling men's clothing on a market. His wife and son help Rahimjon in running the business. Initially, Rahimjon didn't want to take out a loan, because he wasn't confident in his revenues. But, thanks to advice from his friends, he took a risk, asked for a loan and exceeded all of his expectations. He was able to expand his shop and product range with the new profits. Now, he ins't afraid to ask for bigger loans. 
On the brink of the winter season, he wants to purchase some men's winter clothing items for resale. He's happy to work with Arvand and wants to continue the cooperation in the future.

loans.use: to buy winter men's clothing.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama, 28, is a married woman. She has three children and lives with them in the suburban area of Likoni in the municipality of Mombasa. She makes and repairs clothing in her tailor shop. Her workshop is at the market and she makes items to order. She has a good clientele. The loan she is requesting from Yehu is her third and is for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy fabric and thread to make more clothes. This loan will help her fill pending customer orders and have more of her products in stock. Her goal is to continue growing the business because it has always been the source of family income.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and thread to make garments.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, She previously obtained a PHP 10,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 8,000 loan to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of helping her children in giving a good education to her grandchildren. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is married, with five children. She is 52 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin. 

Rosalyn has run a general store for five years to earn a living, and she earns PHP 7,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. 

Rosalyn has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Rosalyn's plan is to save her returns in order to support the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Pelagiaa

texts.en:
This is Pelagiaa. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy larger quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pelagiaa hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock needed for her business.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando's main source of income comes from his banana production business. He is 40 years old, married with five kids. He is from Carangan, Ozamis City and been five years in business, earning an amount of 5,200 PHP a month. In 2008, Rolando joined GDMPC. Rolando is requesting a loan of 6,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Callixte

texts.en:
Callixte is 47 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have four children aged between seven and thirteen years old; all of them attend schools. He has spent 25 years in farming. He would like to get the Kiva loan for buying fertilizers and paying labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Parmen

texts.en:
Parmen is 44 years old and from the small village of Samtredia district. He has a large family: his wife, two children (20 and 21 years old) and parents, who are provided with a retirement pension. 

The family runs agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow and two calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. 

Parmen owns a plot of land, where 200 nut trees are grown. He sells about 300 to 400 kg of nuts seasonally. Besides, he has a minibus and trades with fruits.  Parmen is very hard working and has a rich experience in his business. 

Parmen requested a loan to buy tires and an accumulator for his minibus.  The existing tires and accumulator are out of commission and need repair. 

After repairing his minibus, Parmen will be able to trade more fruits and thus increase his income. With increased income, he will expand his business and improve the living conditions for the family. Parmen awaits your support

loans.use: to purchase tires and an accumulator for the minibus

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
This is Tessie. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 17,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Tessie hopes that her business will expand and grow. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and  also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 27 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has been working as a farmer for the past 9 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs during maize production. She plans to use the profits for buying a tractor for better farming in the future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and cover labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
From Vani district of West Georgia, Ketevan is 36 years old and lives with her husband, her 11-year-old son, and a daughter-in-law who is a pensioner. Ketevan works as a masseuse locally and earns a monthly income. Additionally, she runs an animal husbandry business consisting of a milk cow and two calves. The family produces cheese products which they sell at the local open market. Ketevan also grows nuts on agricultural land that she owns, selling 200-300 kg of them each year. The family also sows watermelons and melons on the family-owned land, selling on average 5000-7000 kg seasonally.

A very hard-working young woman with a great desire to get ahead, Ketevan has requested a loan to fence her agricultural land. She will also cultivate it and purchase nut saplings to plant and enlarge their garden. After several years, they will be able to harvest more products and sell for a good price. The increased income will be used to improve the family's living conditions and finance the education of her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to fence her agricultural land, cultivate it, and purchase nut saplings.

loans.name: Las Dinamicas Group

texts.es:
Las dinámicas es el grupo que se formó en la ciudad de Encarnación, son 11 mujeres que están empezando a trabajar juntas. Están en su primer ciclo, y cuentan que están muy contentas por la oportunidad de progreso y prometen mantener unido el grupo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Ely, quien vende prendas y con esto quiere poder ayudar a su familia y tener los medios que necesitan para que no les falte nada.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder comprar prendas y así empezar con una buena cantidad de ellas.
texts.en: “Las Dinámicas” (The Dynamic Ones) is a group of 11 women from Encarnación who are starting to work together.  They are in their first cycle and they say that they are very happy for the opportunity for progress and promise to keep the group together.  One of the members is Ely who sells clothes and wants to help her family this way to have the resources necessary to cover all their needs.  She’s asking for this loan to buy clothes so she can start out with a good amount of them.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable con su trabajo, vive con su familia quienes son su mayor inspiración para brindarles lo mejor. Actualmente posee una tortilleria ya que con esfuerzo sea superado ante las adversidades que la vida le ha presentado y gracias a ellos e su hogar nunca ha faltado el pan de cada día. Carmen desea ampliar más su negocio es decir comprar mas suministros que le permitan tener su negocio mas rentable es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para comprar maíz, aceite, manteca entre otros para que los clientes queden satisfechos y siempre mantenga esa clientela que tiene. Ella espera que la ayuda sea recibida y que pronto su calidad de vida mejore con forme vayan pasando los días.
texts.en: Carmen is a very hardworking, honest woman who is responsible with her work.  She lives with her family who are the greatest inspiration for her to provide them the best.  She currently has a tortilla shop since she’s overcome the adversities life has presented thanks to her efforts and thanks to them too her home has never lacked daily bread.  Carmen wants to expand the business more, that is, to buy more supplies to have a more profitable business which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy corn, oil and lard, among others so that her customers will be satisfied and she will always retain the clientele she has.  She hopes to receive the help and that her quality of life will be improving as days go by.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil and lard, among others.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame sells sanitary pads and diapers at Nkrotrodo near Elmina. She has done this for five years. Maame is married to a plumber. She and her husband use their incomes to pay for food, clothing, and their children's school fees. Maame will use her loan to purchase more sanitary pads and diapers to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sanitary pads and diapers to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and married to a farmer. They have two children who are still very young. He has spent eight years in farming. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits to buy a tractor instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to pay for labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Phocas

texts.en:
Phocas is a 58-year-old farmer whose wife works as a farmer as well. He has spent 20 years in farming. He would like a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits to buy a tractor instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 47 year old married woman and mother of three young children, from Getafe, Bohol. 

She has run a sari-sari (variety) store business for almost four years now. Gaudiosa works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

She is asking for a loan to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as dry goods, sodas, snack foods, soaps, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as dry goods, sodas, snack foods, soaps, and toiletries

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar, de 21 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor, dinámico y alegre. Es soltero sin hijos, viven en casa de sus padres en compañía de uno de sus hermanos, su prima y una sobrina. El trabajo que realiza Omar es el alquiler de un equipo de sonido para las actividades sociales, siendo contratado cada fin de semana.  Lleva dedicándose a éste negocio hace más de  10 meses, le ha permitido hacerse muy conocido por la calidad de su servicio. Paralelo a ello, también vende ropa masculinas como polos, camisas y pantalones de buena calidad y que estén a la moda,  los cuales trae desde la capital, dedicandose a éste negocio desde hace mas de 01 año, contando con buen número de clientes, ambas actividades las realiza solo. Considera rentable sus negocios por las buenas ganancias que  le dejan.
Le gusta su trabajo por el ingreso económico, que le permite apoyar en la economía de su hogar y pagarse sus estudios, además de comprarse artículos personales. Por tanto, tiene muchas ganas de seguir progresando y con esfuerzo lograr abrir una tienda de ropas. Este sería el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, se siente muy contento y agradecido por la oportunidad brindada de tener acceso a un crédito financiero, por ello se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos, poder tener acceso  a más créditos y hacer realidad sus metas.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará accesorios para sus equipos de sonidos como parlantes y amplificadores, además de ropas masculinas en mayor cantidad y menor precio, las cuales comprará en la capital.
texts.en:
Omar is 21 years old and is a young, dynamic and cheerful entrepreneur. He is single, has no children, and lives at home with his parents, one of his brothers, his cousin and his niece. For work, Omar rents out sound equipment for social activities; he is hired every weekend. He has worked in this business for more than 10 months and he has become well known for the quality of his service. Alongside this business, he also sells men's clothing, such as polo shirts, t-shirts and pants that are good quality and in fashion, which he brings in from the capital. He has worked in this business for more than a year and has a good number of customers. He works in both businesses alone. He believes his businesses are profitable because of his earnings. 

He enjoys his work because of the income it provides, which allows him to help out economically in his home and to pay for his studies, as well as to buy personal items. For this reason, he is very excited to continue progressing and with some effort to open a clothing store. 

This would be his third loan with the institution MFP. Omar is very happy and thankful for the opportunity to have access to financial credit, and is committed to repaying his loans on time so that he can access more credit and make his dreams a reality. 

With the amount requested of 1500 nuevos soles, he will buy accessories for his equipment, such as speakers and amplifiers, as well as men's clothing in large quantities and at low prices, which he will buy in the capital.

loans.use: to buy speakers and amplifiers, as well as men's clothing.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen lives in Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City. She earns 5,000 PHP monthly by raising hogs. She uses her income to support the needs of her seven children. For a 44-year-old mother, there’s nothing that can make her happier than to see her children successful in their studies. This year, Helen borrows 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feed and other supplies. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business in order to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 31 years old, married, and blessed with two children, ages 3 and 2. She has been selling children's clothes for the past six years, and she earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of 30,000 KES. Caroline will use the entire loan amount to buy more children's clothing for resale during this festive season when sales are expected to be high. She plans to use the anticipated profit for saving and for paying the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more children's clothes for resale.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley has been selling household items such as jugs, glasses and bed covers for the last five years with a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

In the picture, he is displaying one of his very colorful bed covers, which he plans to sell to an interested buyer where he does his business. He 32 years old, single and supports his mother. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who had also benefited from KADET. Stanley is applying for his first loan of KES 10,000 to buy plastic cups, plates and water glasses for resale at a profit. He plans to use the anticipated income to invest back into his business.

In future he desires to grow his business and open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy plastic cups, plates, and water glasses for resale.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en: Remegia is 60 years old, married and has seven children. She resides in Calabayan, Ozamis City.  Remegia provides entertainment to local people by operating a karaoke machine to earn a living. Remegia engaged in this business to help her husband support her family. As a result, she was able to earn 3,000 PHP a month. Remegia requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair her karaoke machine. She's been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Remegia plans to improve their house to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to repair her karaoke machine.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois, 47, is married and has seven children, ages 7 to 22. All of them are enrolled in schools. He has spent 20 years in farming. He would like a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits to buy a tractor instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Sonia Cecibel Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia, es una persona muy trabajadora quien se dedica por completo al bienestar de su familia, ella vive junto a su madre y tres hijos menores de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Sonia posee una venta de tortillas desde hace dos años donde elabora las tortillas todos los días cada mediodía, con lo que pueda llevar el sustento a su hogar el cual depende por completo de ella, el negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación lo que le trae beneficios como estas cerca de sus hijos siempre. Sonia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor para poder obtenerlo a menores precios, así mismo cal para el maíz, con esto Sonia tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus ganancias y darle una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: Sonia’s a very hardworking person who is completely focused on her family’s wellbeing.  She lives with her mother and three younger siblings who are students.  Sonia has been selling tortillas for two years.  She makes tortillas every day at midday to provide sustenance for her home which is completely dependent on her.  The business is located at home which is beneficial because she can watch her children always.  Sonia’s asking for a loan to buy corn at wholesale so she can get it at lower prices and she will also buy lime powder for the corn.  With this, Sonia will have the opportunity of improving her profits and giving her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime powder to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Elsy Nohemy

texts.es: Elsy Nohemy vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos como langosta, camarones, conchas, pescado, entre otros, comercia desde su propio negocio todas las mañanas y es muy conocida, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles y sobre todo por su buen servicio y amabilidad; Elsy es una mujer entregada a su labor, responsable y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran puertas al éxito, no esta dispuesta a rendirse pues sabe que así podrá ganar un futuro mas prospero, en las últimos meses tuvo perdidas en las ventas y quiere recuperarse pero necesita de capital para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar langosta, camarones, pescado, etc.  Elsy Nohemy tiene buenas referencias de pago, se siente muy contenta con el apoyo que le brindan, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejore calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elsy Nohemy lives with her life companion and their children in her own house.  She works selling seafood like lobster, shrimp, clams and fish, among others.  She sells from her own shop every morning and is very well-known.  She has a large clientele because people prefer her because she always has what they need at affordable prices and above all because of her good service and kindness.

Elsy is a woman who is very dedicated to her work; she’s responsible and very enthusiastic about getting ahead.  She’s always on the lookout for new opportunities that will open doors to success.  She’s not willing to give up because she knows she’ll be able to attain a more prosperous future this way.

Her sales dropped in recent months and wants to recuperate but needs capital to make a new investment which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy lobster, shrimp, fish, etc.  Elsy Nohemy has good credit references and feels very happy with the support she’s getting.  She is sure she’ll be able to repay the loan while at the same time hopes to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lobster, shrimp and fish.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 30 years old and married with three children, ages 2 years, 7years and 10 years. She runs a clothing business at Kulanda town, Bo, Southern area, in Sierra Leone. She started to train to be in this business when she was in childhood.

She's been in this particular clothing business for eight years and sells blouses, skintights, and skirts within a busy market area. Her husband is also a businessman; she also receives income from him. Her only challenge with her business is sometimes the clothes get spoiled because of the rainy season.   

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy different kinds of clothing material such as blouses, skintights, and skirts. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve the life of her family and educate her children, since she did not go to school. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of clothing material such as blouses, skintights, and skirts.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es: María de 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil y así mismo vive junto a su hijo menor de edad.  María tiene una tienda en su casa de habitación donde trabaja comercializando productos alimenticios, golosinas, productos de limpieza y otros más, así mismo para esta época del año vende productos navideños como: adornos, guías de luces, muñecos y guirnaldas y otros más. Es por esto último que ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de los adornos navideños, y así aprovechar esta temporada al máximo, también pretende invertir en la tienda surtiéndola con todo lo necesario para mejorar sus ganancias contando con más clientes.
texts.en: María, 49, lives with her husband who works as a bricklayer; she also lives with her minor son.  María has a store at home where she works selling food items, snacks, cleaning supplies and others.  In addition, for this season of the year she also sells Christmas items like decorations, strings of lights, garlands, etc.  It’s for this last reason that she’s asking Integral for a loan so she can invest in Christmas decorations and take advantage of this season to the maximum; she also intends to invest in the store stocking it with everything necessary to improve her profits and acquire more customers.

loans.use: to buy Christmas goods to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Amalia

texts.es: Gloria de 55 años de edad, vive junto a dos hijos quienes trabajan y le ayudan con los gastos, así mismo junto a dos nietos menores de edad. Gloria posee una venta de zapatos para mujeres como: sandalias, zapatos cerrados, zapatías y todo tipo de calzado femenino el cual vende por pedidos y así mismo de forma ambulante. Lo que más desea gloria es poder aumentar la cantidad de zapatos que tienen, comprando variedad de estampados, estilos y colores y de esta forma abarcar más mercado a través de diversos gustos, así mejorar su venta y aumentar sus ganancias lo cual es muy importante para ella. Es por esta razón que Gloria solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL.
texts.en: Gloria, 55, lives with her two children who work and help out with expenses.  She also lives with two minor grandchildren.  Gloria sells women’s shoes like sandals, closed shoes, slippers and all types of women’s footwear both by prior order and from place to place.  What Gloria wants most is to increase the amount of shoes she has buying a variety of style, prints and colors so she can cover a wider marketplace through a wider range of tastes thus improving her sales and increasing profits which is very important to her; this is why Gloria’s asking Integral for a loan.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David, de 33 años de edad, es un joven amable y emprendedor. Es casado, vive en compañía de su esposa,  su pequeña hija,  sus 02 hermanas y sus 03 sobrinos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza David consiste en el  servicio de transporte para eso cuenta con 01 mototaxi, vehiculo propio el cual logró comprar con sus ahorros, paralelo a ésta actividad también se dedica  en la digitación en computadora de informes y todo tipo de documento que lo soliciten. Lleva dedicándose a ambas actividades desde hace 07 años, y desde entonces lo realiza solo. Considera rentable su negocios por la demanda que tiene y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta su actividades pues le permiten tener un ingreso económico y poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, así como la educación de su pequeña hija, quien es su motivación para  seguir adelante. Comenta además que tiene planes de ampliar su negocio de digitación, para también poder escanear documentos, ya que por la zona donde vive, él es el único que brinda este servicio. Este seria el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP, se siente muy bien con su grupo de su banco comunal, considera que todos son personas responsables y cumplidoras con sus compromisos.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará repuestos para su mototaxi, además de pagar por el servicio de mantenimiento del mismo, buscando tener operativa su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
David is 33 years old and is a young, friendly entrepreneur. He is married and lives with his wife, their young daughter, his two sisters and his three nieces and nephews. They all live together in his house. David works in transportation for which he owns a motorcycle taxi. It is his own vehicle, which he bought with his savings. Along with this, he also makes a living from typing out reports and any type of document requested. He has been working in both for seven years and has always worked alone. 

He believes his businesses are profitable because of the demand and the income it provides. He enjoys his work as it provides him income with which to pay the household expenses, as well as the education of his young daughter, who is his motivation to move forward. He also plans to expand his typing  business to including the scanning of documents, since in the area where he lives, he is the only person who provides that service. 

This would be his forth loan with the institution MFP. He is very pleased with his communal bank group and believes that everyone is responsible and will fulfill their commitments

With the amount requested of 1500 nuevos soles, he will buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi and pay for its maintenance, hoping to have his work tool in operation.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to take his vehicle to the mechanic.

loans.name: Jose Felipe

texts.es: José de 49 años de edad vive junto a su familia, su esposa y sus dos hijos es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre su mayor visión es brindarle lo mejor a su familia, es visionario, responsable, honesto y emprendedor y esto hace que sea ejemplo para sus hijos. El cliente se dedica a la venta de pescado y a la de maíz es así como se gana la vida honradamente y a su familia no le falta nada, se ha caracterizado por dar lo mejor de si. José desea ampliar más su negocio y es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito y que este sea una gran ayuda ara el primero desea comprar: fertilizantes, abonos y semillas para el maíz y luego comprar materiales para la pesca. Es un hombre agradecido que espera recibir buenas noticias ya que el solo no puede, agradece a Dios y a las personas que de buen corazón ayudan sin pedir nada a cambio
texts.en:
José, 49, lives with his family consisting of his wife and two children.  He’s a hardworking man whose greatest vision has always been to provide the best for his family.  He’s forward-looking, responsible, honest and enterprising which makes him a good example for his children.  He sells fish and corn; this is how he earns his livelihood honestly and how he sees to his family’s needs.  He’s been noted for giving the best of himself.

José wants to expand his business more which is why he approached Integral to request a loan that will be of great use to him.  First, he wants to buy fertilizer, manure and corn seeds and then to buy fishing supplies.  He’s a grateful man who hopes to get good news because he can’t do it alone.  He thanks God and the good-hearted people who help without asking for anything in return.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is 72 years old. He is married to a farmer, and they have three grandchildren living with them, ages 6 to 12 years old.  All three of them are enrolled in school.

Antoine has spent 50 years in farming. He would like to get a Kiva loan for buying fertilizer and paying labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor, instead of using human labor.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Marta Lizeth

texts.es: Marta tiene 27 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y  sus dos hijos menores de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio de productos de belleza tales como: variedad de lociones, cremas, maquillaje, y de más artículos que son atractivos para los clientes. Es una mujer muy emprendedora la cual trabaja duramente para colaborar con los ingresos del hogar y poder llevar un poco de dinero que le permita suplir algunas necesidades. Ha luchado mucho para poder mantener a flote su negocio ya que la competencia siempre está presente en todo. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más  ya que es una mujer muy carismática y honrada en su trabajo. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL por que quiere invertir en su negocio en la compra  mercadería  como: lociones, cremas, maquillaje, etc. Que le permita mantener su negocio surtido y estar al día de los nuevos productos que van saliendo en el mercado. Para que de esta forma pueda seguir atrayendo una gran variedad de clientes que le permitan mejorar sus ganancias que le den la oportunidad de ingresas a una mejor calidad de vida. Ella expresa estar muy agradecida con esta institución ya que en el pasado le brindaron ayuda cuando más lo necesitaba. Espera poder obtener  resultados favorables en esta ocasión.
texts.en:
Marta, 27, lives in her own house with her husband and two minor children.  She’s sells beauty products like various lotions, creams, make-up and other items that are attractive to customers.  She’s a very enterprising woman who works hard to help cover household expenses and earn a little money to cover some needs.  She’s struggled to keep her business afloat because competition is always there.  She’s been in business for many years so has many regular customers who prefer her more every day since she’s a very charismatic, hones working woman.  

She’s decided to ask Integral for a loan because she wants to invest in her business buying merchandise like lotions, creams, make-up, etc. that will allow her to maintain her business well-stocked and be up-to-date with the latest merchandise entering the marketplace so that she can continue attracting a large variety of customers that will lead to improved profits that will give her the opportunity of attaining a better quality of life.  She states that she’s very grateful to this institution because it provided her with help in the past when she most needed it.  She hopes to have favorable results this time too.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer alegre, luchadora y emprendedora. Es separada, vive  en compañía de sus padres, su hermana y sus 03 menores hijos. Juntos habitan en casa de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Lita es la costura, oficio que aprendió viendo a sus amigas, desde entonces le gustó y decidió iniciarse hace 02 años. Actualmente es solicitada por el buen acabado que realiza, por lo que le motiva a continuar, ahora tiene muchos clientes y bastante pedidos por entregar cuenta con el apoyo de su hija mayor, quien también está aprendiendo el oficio,  y la llena de orgullo.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su actividad pues le ha permitido tener ingresos económicos sustanciales para pagar los gastos propios de su hogar y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, pero no le gusta de su actividad pues  tiene que estar hasta muy tarde en las noches para poder terminar y entregar los pedidos a la fecha solicitada. Pero no se desanima y  desea poder ampliar su negocio, instalando más maquinas de costura y personal. Este seria el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta poder contar con un capital de trabajo gracias a la institución, así poder entregar los pedidos que tiene pendiente. Además de estar a gusto con su grupo por el trato cordial que recibe. Con el préstamo solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de materiales de costura como telas e hilos, buscando precios bajos por sus compras al contado y en volumen.
texts.en:
Lita is 36 years old and is a cheerful, fighter and enterprising woman. She is separated from her husband and lives with her parents, her sister and her three underage children. They all live in her parents house. Lita makes a living from sewing, which she learned by watching her friends. Since she liked it, she decided to begin sewing two years ago. Currently, she is sought for of her beautiful workmanship, which motivates her to continue working. She has many customers now and lots of orders to deliver. She has the support of her oldest daughter, who is also learning the trade, which makes her proud. 

She believes her business is profitable because of the demand she has and the income she makes.

She enjoys her work as it provides substantial income to pay the household expenses and to provide a better quality of life for her children, but what she doesn't enjoy about her work is that she has to work until late at night to finish and deliver the orders on the days requested. But this doesn't discourage her and she would like to expand her business, installing more sewing machines and hiring personnel. 

This would be her third loan with the institution MFP. She is very pleased to have the working capital thanks to the institution and in that way be able to deliver the jobs she has outstanding. She is also very pleased with her group for the kind treatment she receives. 

With the loan requested of 1200 nuevos soles, she will invest it entirely in buying sewing materials such as fabric and thread, searching for low prices by buying with cash and in high volume.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa Elena de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus  hijos en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de flores al gusto del cliente margaritas, rosas, claveles, entre otros, son bonitas de muchos colores, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un aroma inigualable, su negocio esta ubicado en una zona que califico como muy buena para sus actividades comerciales, es muy conocida y se ha hecho de clientela muy valiosa que le permite estar adelante de la competencia; Rosa es una mujer activa, dedicada a su labor, con muchos sueños que desea realizar, esta dispuesta a lograr el éxito, piensa que solo con constancia y mucha motivación podrá alcanzarlo, su negocio ha tomada mucho auge y como toda buena comerciante necesita acrecentar la inversión pero para eso necesita de suficiente capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar flores, plantas por mayor, Rosa Elena tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida como se la merecen.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena, 54, lives with her life partner and their children in their own home.  She makes a living selling flowers that suit her customers' tastes, like daisies, roses, and carnations, among others.  They are beautiful, many-colored flowers at affordable prices, but above all, they have an unrivaled aroma.

Her business is located in an area that is quite good for her commercial activities.  She is well-known and has made herself a very valuable customer base that allows her to be ahead of the competition.  

Rosa is an active woman, is dedicated to her work, and has many dreams that she hopes to make come true.  She is ready to achieve success and thinks that only with consistence and a lot of motivation will she be able to attain her dreams.  Her business has grown and like any good merchant, she needs to increase the investment.  For this she needs sufficient capital, and so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy flowers and plants wholesale.  

Rosa Elena has good payment references and has an impeccable morality.  She ensures that she can pay off the debt, and she has faith that she will be able to offer her family a better quality of living, just as they deserve.

loans.use: to buy flowers and plants wholesale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has been hawking household items to his customers in Kangemi for the past seven years, and he earns a monthly income of KES 16,000. He is single and 23 years of age.

This is his second loan after he repaid his previous loan successfully. He will use the entire loan amount to buy to buy more plates, spoons, tea mugs, knives, and blankets to sell.    

In the future, Charles hopes to grow his business and open a supermarket in his village.

loans.use: to buy plates, spoons, tea mugs, knives, and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc was born in 1966. She has two daughters. Her oldest girl is studying at a college. Her younger girl is learning at the 9th grade. Her husband is a farmer. His income is about VND 3,000,000. 

Cuc is a teacher. She has done this job for 23 years. Her salary is about VND 4,200,000 a month. Her family’s total earnings are about VND 7,200,000 per month. 
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed VND 8,736,000 and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 736,000 to earn more money by raising pigs and chickens in her small garden. She wants to use her benefit to bring up her children to grow well.

loans.use: to earn money by raising pigs and chickens in her small garden.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 32 years old and married to a farmer. They have four children, ages between 4 and 15 years. 

She has been a farmer for 14 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizer and help pay labor costs. She will use the profits from the business to make savings in order to own a tractor in the future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is 42 years old. He is married to a farmer, and they have five children. 

He has spent 20 years in farming. He would like to get a Kiva loan for buying fertilizer and paying labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor, instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Con 35 años de edad Roxana es muy trabajadora. Convive con Yudel de 36 años y juntos tiene dos hijas. Es poseedora de una vivienda hecha a base de material noble. Ella desempeña con orgullo su negocio el cual es producto de muchos años de trabajo y esfuerzo consistente en la venta de lubricantes para vehículos, lleva 10 años con su labor el cual se encuentra establecido en el primer piso de su vivienda en un ambiente cálido y cómodo. 
Lo considera un buen negocio debido a ser productos donde no se necesita mucha mano de obra salvo para la aplicación de los lubricantes en los vehículos que realiza contratando personal especializado en el área, volviéndose éste un negocio rentable. 
Actualmente ha notado cierto incremento en sus ventas motivándola a realizar la compra de más mercadería para así mantener su negocio bien abastecido.
Espera seguir laborando con el mismo entusiasmo de siempre ya que su objetivo es ampliarlo con más servicios a largo plazo. Uno de sus próximas metas es el de adquirir otro terreno en el cual planea construir otra vivienda y aperturar mas negocios del rubro para así consolidarse como una de las grandes  microempresarias de su localidad. Tiene un impecable record de 15 créditos, la clave de su inversión ha sido tener siempre todas sus cuentas al día ya que es indicio de progreso según comenta. Le agrada mucho ser parte de su banco comunal ya que también en una ocasión fue parte de la junta directiva.  
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles complementará su capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de mas lubricantes de los distintos tipos y marcas.
texts.en:
Roxana is very hardworking and has 35 years of experience.  She lives with Yudel, 36, and together they have two daughters.  She owns a house made of good materials.  She proudly carries out her business, the product of many years of work and consistent effort in selling automotive lubricants.  She has 10 years of experience in this business, which is set up on the first floor of her house in a warm and comfortable environment.

She considers it a good business because they're products that don't need a lot of manual labor except for the application of the lubricants on the vehicles.  She does this by hiring specialized personnel in the field, making hers a profitable business.

Currently she has noticed some increase in sales, which motivates her to buy more merchandise to keep her business well stocked.  She hopes to continue working with her customary enthusiasm because her long-term goal is to expand her business with more services.  One of her short-term goals is to acquire another plot of land on which to build another home and to open more businesses in the field to become one of the biggest micro-entrepreneurs in her town.

She has an impeccable record of 15 loans.  The key to her investment has always been to have all her bills current because she says it's an indication of her progress.  She likes to be part of her communal bank because she also was on the board of directors at one point.

With the 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll supplement her working capital for buying more lubricants of all types and brands.

loans.use: to buy different types and brands of lubricant

loans.name: Gayatri Indah Group

texts.en: Gayatri Indah group got a loan for the 3rd time. The number of members is 10 and the total loan is for 20 million IDR. They have a bigger loan size. Having been successful with fattening pigs, Ni Komang will use her portion of the loan to purchase four types of local pigs intended for pork rolls and will maintain them for 2 months. The remainder of the loan will be used to fix the cage for the preparation of the new birth of a sow that she already owns. The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but she remains optimistic about her business going forward. With all the benefits she gets, she plans to repair her home and also save for the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase four types of local pigs intended for pork rolls

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Madame RAMATA est âgée de 33 ans,  mariée  et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit chez son mari dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Pelengana de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait de l’huile et des condiments. Cet apprentissage dura pendant 15 ans. Nantie de cette expérience, elle évolue  seule en menant le commerce d’habits depuis maintenant 5 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Pour augmenter son fonds dans le double souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de renforcer son commerce,  qu’elle a  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 12 mois. Après 1er  prêt  individuel correctement bien remboursé, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 22 pièces de pagnes wax, elle s’approvisionne sur place.
Madame RAMATA vend en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes   majoritairement.  Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 44 000FCFA, ce dernier lui servira de prendre en charge certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mrs. RAMATA, age 33, is a married mother of three children. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family in the district of Pelengana, in Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having never attended school for social reasons, she started to work alongside her mother who was selling oil and condiments. This apprenticeship lasted 15 years, then her experience led her to the sale of clothing, which she has been doing on her own for five years. She has a large customer base consisting mainly of women. 

To bolster her working capital and meet customer demand, she turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso 12 months ago. Having correctly repaid her first individual loan, she is now seeking a second loan to buy 22 wax pagnes. She buys her merchandise locally.

Mrs. RAMATA sells at retail, for cash and on credit to a clientele composed primarily of women. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn a monthly profit of 44,000FCFA, which will allow her to help with some of the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Fatoumata Sidi

texts.fr:
Madame  FATOUMATA SIDI est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle   vit dans une  famille nucléaire   au quartier Hamdallaye B  de Ségou.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales car  ses  parents voyaient l’école pour les filles comme une porte de déperdition sociale, très tôt. elle commença à faire les activités génératrices de revenus telle la vente de poisson fumé auprès de son grand frère. Après plusieurs années d’exercices, elle  évolua seule maintenant en menant en plus de la vente de poisson fumé, de la glace et des jus de fruits, des poissons frais et la vente de barriques vides. Elle  mène cette activité  d’articles divers depuis 15 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 12 mois après 1er prêt individuel correctement bien remboursé, elle   est à son 2ème  prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 1 congélateur pour des jus de fruits. Elle  s’approvisionne sur place.
Madame   FATOUMATA SIDI  vend au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Avec ce prêt elle  envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser ses prêts ; de prendre en charge sa maman vieille de 93 ans.
texts.en:
Mrs. FATOUMATA SIDI is 41 years old, married, and the mother of six children.   She lives in a nuclear family in the Hamdallaye B district of Ségou.  
She did not attend school because her parents saw schooling for girls as socially immoral.  Early on, she earned money by doing work such as selling smoked fish alongside her older brother.  With several years of experience, she is managing, on her own, sales of smoked fish, ice cream, fruit juices, fresh fish, and empty barrels.  She has been conducting this business of selling various articles for 15 years and enjoys considerable success and a large clientele. 

In the hopes of increasing her working capital and making better profits, she is requesting this new loan.  She has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for 12 months.  With her first loan having been fully repaid, she is on her second individual loan which she plans to use to buy a freezer for the fruit juices.  She gets her supplies locally.

Madame Fatoumata Sidi sells for cash, at retail, and on credit to a mixed clientele.  With this loan she plans to make an average monthly benefit of 45,000 FCFA.  This loan will allow her to pay back her loans and to take care of her 93 year old mother.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa del Carmen de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus  hijos en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa artesanal elaborada con manta y bordado, vestidos, blusas, pantalones,  todo al gusto del cliente, con material de primera calidad a excelentes precios pero sobre todo con excelente servicio, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de la localidad donde reside, es muy conocida y se ha hecho de clientela muy valiosa que le permite estar adelante de la competencia; Teresa es una mujer activa, dedicada a su labor, con muchos sueños que desea realizar, esta dispuesta a lograr el éxito piensa que solo con constancia y mucha motivación podrá alcanzarla, su negocio ha tomada mucho auge y como toda buena comerciante necesita acrecentar la producción pero para eso necesita de suficiente capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas, hilos, agujas, etc. Teresa del Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, agradece el apoyo brindad,o segura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida como se la merecen.
texts.en: Teresa del Carmen is 34 years old and lives with her life partner and their children in their own house. She makes traditional embroidered cotton clothing including dresses, blouses, pants, etc., which are all made-to measure with quality materials and offered at excellent prices. Above all she gives very good customer service. Her business is based in her local market, where she is very well-known and has won a lot of valuable customers, putting her ahead of the competition. Teresa is an active woman and dedicated to her work with many dreams that she wants to fulfill. She wants to be successful and knows that the only way to achieve this is through perseverance and with a lot of motivation. Her business has been doing really well, and like any good businesswoman she needs to increase her production, but for that she needs sufficient capital to invest. For this reason, she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan in order to buy fabric, thread, needles, etc. Teresa del Carmen has good payment references and is of high moral standing. She is grateful for the support given to her and certain that she will be able to pay back her debt. She is also confident that in this way she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life, and one that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, etc. to make clothing to sell.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza is married and has one child. She wants to provide him with a good quality of life, so she decided to start a new business selling fruits in order to generate an income and contribute to her home’s finances. Shahnoza studied the course of "To get ahead" at a women's organization and acquired business skills. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. 

Shahnoza is requesting a loan for 2,000 somoni, which she will use to buy fruits for her new business. She hopes that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase fruits for her new business.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
This is Brenda, 33, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Jorge and a mother to her four children. Together with her husband, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Brenda operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during the evening, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php12, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Brenda hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed for her food sales stall.

loans.name: Ritchie

texts.en:
Ritchie is a 42-year-old, married woman and the mother of six young children in San Francisco, Talibon.  She and her husband have been engaged in t-shirt printing for almost 20 years.  This is the source of their income.

Ritchie is asking for a loan to buy additional materials for t-shirt printing, such as paint and shirts.  With this, they will be able to attract and cater to more customers.

Ritchie aims to expand their business and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy paint and shirts for her t-shirt printing business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, el se dedica al transporte de carga, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este trabajo, y eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener el máximo de ganancias, tiene buena clientela pues saben que es confiable a la hora de transportar y tiene los mejores precios, además de un servicio excelente pues se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y no quiere decepcionar a los clientes, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a  INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita darle mantenimiento al camión. Juan Carlos es un hombre responsable honesto y con una moral intachable, tiene un buen record crediticio, por lo tanto asegura que tiene la capacidad de asumir el pago puntual de dicho financiamiento y al mismo tiempo tiene la esperanza que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica para la familia.
texts.en: Juan Carlos owns his own house where he lives with his life partner and their children. His business is cargo transportation. He’s been doing this work for many years and has gained invaluable experience, which has allowed him to make decent income. His clientele is good because they know he’s reliable and he has the best prices. In addition to his excellent service, he’s very kind. In the last months, the demand for his services has increased and in order not to disappoint his clients, he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL in order to keep up the maintenance of his truck. Juan Carlos is an honest, responsible man with impeccable morals. His credit history is good, and so he assures us that he has the capacity to assume punctual payments. He hopes to provide financial security to his household.

loans.use: pay the maintenance costs of his truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages, to resell in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages, to resell in her store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, 40, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roel, a construction worker, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elena operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like pineapples, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells bananas, papayas and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are the local tourists in their community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elena dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education and hopes to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of fruits that she will need in her business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen's children were able to study uninterrupted last term due to his previous loan that he used for their school fees. Therefore, their performance was better than previous terms. Now that they are in third term and looking forward to being promoted next year, Stephen is requesting another loan to help make full payments for his children's term fees. Exams are just around the corner and he wants his children to stay in school and concentrate rather than being sent home as a result of his half pay.

Stephen wants to thank UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for being partners with him in educating his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise is the mother of four children and married to a farmer. She is 31 years old. She has been a maize farmer for the past 18 years. 

She would like to get a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer and help pay labor costs during maize production. The profits from her produces will be used for buying a milling machine.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is 42 years old. He is married to a farmer, and they have three children. He has spent 20 years in farming. 

He would like to get the Kiva loan for buying fertilizer and paying labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits to buy a tractor, instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: Amparo de 45 años de edad, vive junto a su compañero de vida, y tres hijos menores de edad quienes estudian. Amparo es una madre de familia responsable y trabajadora quien trabaja largar jornadas todo con el único y fuerte deseo de que su familia cuente con lo  necesario para vivir. Ella trabaja comercializando ropa para niños y niñas, calcetines, punteras, licras y ropa interior la cual vende de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias, para aprovechar al máximo la semana ella visita diferentes colonias cada día y de esta forma cuenta con más clientes.  Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor variedad de ropa y estilos, y así mismo para cumplir con pedidos realizados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Amparo is 45 years old and lives with her life partner and three school-aged children. She is a responsible and hardworking mother who works long days with one, great dream of providing her family with the necessities of life. Amparo makes a living selling children's clothing, socks, tights, and underwear. She sells her products by going door-to-door in various neighborhoods. To make the most of her week, she visits a different neighborhood each day to gain more customers.

Amparo is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy a bigger variety of clothing and styles so that she will be able to fill the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
This is Gregorio, 41, resident of Payatas, Philippines. He is married to Normita, a housekeeper, and is a father to his children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.  

Gregorio is into selling fishnets. He gets a big amount of fishnets from a wholesaler and then sells them per piece. He also sells scouring pads used for cleaning pots and pans. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of fish nets and scouring pads for his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Gregorio hopes his business grows and dreams to be able to give his family a good future by the grace of God. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of fishnets and scouring pads needed in his business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 42.  She is the mother of four children.  She has been in farming for the past 20 years.  Her husband works as a farmer as well.  With this loan, she will buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.  The profits from farming will be for buying a tractor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
