She works alongside her laborers from Monday through Saturday and she arranges her schedule according to availability.  The buys the merchandise and supplies as needed from large suppliers who specialize in selling manure at low cost which is advantageous economically.  She will use the loan to buy manure, liquid seeds and to pay laborers.  One of Ximena’s goals is to continue growing and earning higher family income and to be able to provide jobs for those who need them.

Ximena lives with her two children who are 17 and 15 years of age and attend school.  Her dream on a person level is to have more resources because she needs to have more for home because the children are growing and the need to give them a good life and future schooling increases.

She’s very grateful and happy with the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza because it opened a work portal and will allow her to invest in her business and in her personal development since she’s learned how to organize and manager her income and investments better.

Talca belongs to the Maule Region, a zone in the middle of the country.  It’s the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region and the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  There’s a curious phrase about Talca in Chile that says: “Talca, Paris and London.”  Among the myths associated with is, some say it comes from something originally said by an Englishman “Talca parece Londres” because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in winter similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy manure, liquids, seeds and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Bety

texts.es:
Bety, de 30 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene 04 hijos y juntos habitan en su casa propia. Bety tiene como trabajo la venta de productos de primera necesidad, dicho productos lo compra al por mayor así utiliza minima inversion. Por otro lado se dedica al alquiler de mototaxis, siendo uno manejado por su hijo y el otro lo alquila, logrando precibir ganancias. Lleva trabajando con éste negocio más de 04 años. 
Considera rentable su negocio, además que le permite disponer y manejar su tiempo, cuenta que no fue fácil al momento de emprender éste negocio ya que las dudas y los temores le embargaban, pero poco a poco fue tomando mas fuerza y ahora cosecha el fruto de su esfuerzo.  Este será el préstamo numero 17 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, conservas, asimismo llevará al mecanico su vehiculo para su mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Bety is 30 years old and is a kind, friendly and responsible woman. She lives with her partner with whom she has 4 children and together they live in their own house. Bety works selling essential items, which she buys wholesale so that she can obtain a lower price. She also hires-out taxis, with one of them  being driven by her son and one being rented out. This allows her to earn an income. She had been working with this business for over 4 years. 

She considers her business to be profitable and it also allows her to organize her own time. She says that this was not easy when she first set up her business since doubts and fears inhibited her. However little by little she gained strength and she is now reaping the fruits of her hard work. This will be her 17th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she has financial support. With the amount she is asking for, of 1000 soles, she will buy products such as rice, sugar, oil and preserves. She will also take her vehicle to the mechanic for servicing.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and preserves and take her vehicle to the mechanic for servicing.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi, de 42 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, en toda su vida demostró ser una mujer muy pujante, pues es madre soltera y tuvo que criar a sus 02 hijos sola. Juntos habitan en una casa propia en donde les brinda educación y alimentación, ella desea que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
Deysi a diario se dedica en la crianza de aves de corral, siendo la huerta de su casa un lugar donde criar estos animales. Tiene más de 100 pollos, y cada cierto tiempo los lleva al mercado para su comercialización. Comenta que desde el comienzo hasta al finalizar la campaña le toma un promedio de 45 días. Dice que tiene buenos clientes pues siempre están a la expectativa de comprarle ya que sus pollos son muy buenos porque ella los cría con puro alimentos balanceados. Lleva trabajando en ésta actividad más de  06 años y le sirvió para poder salir adelante y progresar. Le gusta su trabajo ya que le permite disponer de su tiempo, aunque al principio se enfrentó con muchos problemas, entre ellos el de no saber como es el proceso completo de cada campaña, así como no saber que tendría que aplicarles vacuna a cada pollo. Pero ahora es todo una experta y cada día desea mejorar su manera de crianza. Este será el préstamo número 16 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado 1000 nuevos soles, comprará pollos bebes para iniciar con su crianza y alimentos balanceados, además de algunas vitaminas y vacunas necesarias para su buen desarrollo de estas aves.
texts.en:
Deysi, 42 years old, is a good woman, friendly and very hardworking. Throughout her life she has proved to be an energetic woman and as a single mother she had to raise her two children alone. Together they live in their own home and she provides them education and food. She wants her children to have a better quality of life.

Deysi works daily raising poultry, raising the animals in the garden of her house. She has more than 100 chickens, and every once in awhile she takes them to market to sale. She says that from the beginning to the end the venture takes 45 days. She says that good clients are always waiting to buy as her chickens are very good because she raises them on pure animal feed. 

She has been working in this activity more than six years and it has helped her to succeed and progress. She likes her work because it permits her to plan her own time, although at first she faced many problems, including not knowing the complete process of each cycle, and not knowing that she should give each chicken a vaccination. But now she is completely an expert and each day she wants to improve her method of breeding. 

This will be her sixteenth loan though MFP. She is very happy knowing she has financial support, as she feels secure moving ahead in her business.

With the 1000 soles she has asked for, she will buy baby chickens to begin raising, animal feed, some vitamins and necessary vaccines for the good growth of these chickens.

loans.use: to buy young chickens, animal feed, vitamins and poultry vaccines

loans.name: Maria Silvia

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mis Sueños” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de modista y venta de carbón, desde hace 20 años. Comenta que trabaja desde su casa de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad. Realiza arreglos en general en prendas de vestir, confecciona cortinaje, disfraces, fundas para sillones.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, donde encuentra gran variedad en productos y telas para la confecciones para dejar satisfecha a su clientela y para que vuelva con más pedidos a realizar, todo a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará solamente carbón.
Una de las metas de Maria es tener un bazar, adaptado en su casa, para poder atender mas cómodamente a su clientela, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y optar por una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a sus padres. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es emprender aun mas e implementar mas maquinarias de trabajo y dar la posibilidad de trabajo a otras personas.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
María’s part of the “Mis Sueños” (My Dreams) communal bank in the city of Talca.  She’s worked as a dressmaker and charcoal merchant for twenty years.  She comments that she works from home from Monday through Saturday and arranges her schedule according to availability.  She does general clothes repairs, makes curtains, costumes and seat covers.  She buys the merchandise and supplies as needed in Santiago where she finds a wide variety of fabric and dressmaking supplies at low cost which is advantageous economically to satisfy customers so that they’ll return to order more. She will use the loan exclusively to buy charcoal.  

One of her goals is to have a home-based dress shop to tend to customers more comfortably and generate higher income in order to be able to have a better quality of life.  María lives with her parents.  Her dream on a work level is to be more enterprising and set up more work machinery and to provide employment for others.  She’s very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her since it’s allowed her to invest in her business.  Also, she feels very comfortable in company of the other entrepreneurs in her communal bank because they share different activities and interests which she has enjoyed.  With respect to the training provided during the meetings, she’s learned to better manage her business.

Talca belongs to the Maule Region, a zone in the middle of the country.  It’s the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region and the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  There’s a curious phrase about Talca in Chile that says: “Talca, Paris and London.”  Among the myths associated with is, some say it comes from something originally said by an Englishman “Talca parece Londres” because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in winter similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: José Erasmo

texts.es:
Don José tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la pesca, aprendió cuando unos amigos lo invitaron que fuera con ellos al mar a pescar; antes se dedicaba a la agricultura y la albañilería. Manifiesta que la necesidad le hizo aprender muchas cosas para ganarse la vida y sostener a su familia. Es de esta manera, como José empezó con esa actividad, como vio que le dejaba buenos ingresos, con mucho esfuerzo compro una lancha y un motor usado, se introduce al mar durante dos días para pescar y salir con el producto.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reparar el motor de la lancha, ya que se le ha apagado y no arranca. Sin el motor en perfectas condiciones no puede ir a pescar y esa es su fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia. Su deseo, es comprar un nuevo motor y un nuevo equipo de pesca, construir su casa, ya que donde vive no es de él y que sus hijos estudien y se preparen para la vida.
texts.en:
José, 41, is married and has two children.  He’s been fishing for ten years having learned from some friends who invited him to go to sea with them fishing.  He used to work in agriculture and construction.  He states that need has led him to learn many things in order to earn his livelihood and support his family.  This is how José started out in this activity and seeing that it produced good income with much effort he bought a boat and a used outboard motor.  He heads out to sea for two days of fishing to bring in product.

The loan he’s asking from Fundación Campo is to repair the boat’s motor because it’s shut down and will not start up again.  Without a motor in perfect condition he’s unable to go out fishing and this is his source of income to support his family.  His wish is to buy a new motor and new fishing equipment, to build his house because where he lives now isn’t his and that his children to go school and prepare themselves for life.

loans.use: to repair his outboard motor.

loans.name: Angie Geovana

texts.es:
Angie es una joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su madre y su pequeño hermano, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su madres, Angie se encuentra estudiando el último año de la carrera técnica de Hotelería, ella es muy buena estudiante y ocupa los primeros lugares dentro de su institución educativa.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Angie trabaja como empleada del hogar, ella brinda servicios de limpieza y también cuida a una persona de la tercera edad, Angie trabaja por las mañanas un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Angie se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realiza la compra de sus materiales de estudios para realizar la elaboración de una pequeña maqueta, el cual es un trabajo muy importante que se considera en sus calificaciones, así pues Angie espera seguir trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante junto con su familia y espera lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Angie, 19, is a young woman living in Cañete in Imperial District with her mother and small brother who she loves and are the main reason for life.  She’s a kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Thanks to her effort and her mother’s support, Angie is in the final year studying the technical career of hotel management.  She’s a very good student and is always in the list of top students at her school.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Angie works as a domestic employee.  She does housecleaning chores and also cares for a senior citizen.  She works mornings for about 8 hours.  She feels good working and thinks she does well because of the good way she does her work and the kind way she treats others.

Angie is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she’ll be able to buy the study materials she needs to build a small model which is a very important graded assignment.  Angie will be able to continue working and striving to get ahead with her family and hopes to reach her dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to buy study materials.

loans.name: Richard Rafael

texts.es: Richard, de 37 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de León , casado, padre de 2 hijos , de oficio comerciante, se dedica la venta de repuestos y reparación de Bicicletas. Inicio con un pequeño préstamo que le hizo una vecina, fue ofreciendo su servicio de reparación de bicicletas de vecino a vecino poco tiempo después le agrego la venta de repuestos de bicicletas, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad  , en un pequeño local el cual alquila. Su esposa trabaja como estilista en belleza así se complementan para llevar a diario la comida para sus hijos. Está solicitando el financiamiento comprar llantas, rines de aluminio, marcos para bicicletas, neumáticos, asientos, valineras. Pues esto le ayuda a mantener surtido su negocio y atraer más clientela. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta vender repuestos de vehículos.
texts.en:
Richard, 37 years old, lives in the city of León. He is married and the father of two children. 

He works as a merchant, repairing bicycles and selling spare parts. He began with a small loan he got through a neighbor, and was offering his bicycle repair service neighbor to neighbor and soon afterwards began to sell bicycle parts. He has been doing this activity for four years in a small facility that he rents.

His wife works as a stylist in a beauty salon and they share in the daily feeding of their children. 

He is asking for funding in order to buy tires, aluminum rims, bicycle frames, inner tubes, seats, and hubs. This will help him to maintain his business and attract more clients. One of his plans for the future is selling car parts.

loans.use: to buy tires, aluminum rims, bicycle frames, inner tubes, seats and hubs for his bicycle repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Orlith

texts.es:
Orlith, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora. Es conviviente, vive en compañía de su pareja y sus 02 hijos, en una casa de su propiedad, que lo logró comprar con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Orlith, es la venta de comidas regionales, específicamente los Juanes (consistente en arroz envuelto en hojas, que es un plato típico de la regiones amazónicas), para ello se levanta muy de temprano se dispone a la preparación, contando con la ayuda de su pareja, para luego llevar todo lo preparado al mercado  en donde cuenta con un pequeño puesto de venta. Atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, se dedica a ésta actividad hace más de 08 años, tempo en el cual le ha valido para hacerse conocida y tener una regular clientela. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su actividad al contar con un ingreso económico propio que le permite apoyar en los gastos de su hogar, así como la educación de sus hijos. Tiene muchos conocidos que la esperan para degustar sus Juanes, tiene bastante demanda porque es un platillo de consumo habitual. Por tanto, quisiera poder ampliar su negocio y  poder abrir un restaurante. Este seria el  préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta por la oportunidad de poder contar con un capital de trabajo, manifiesta que será puntual en sus pagos para así tener acceso a más créditos. Con el préstamo solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará los ingredientes para la preparación de Juanes, como arroz, pollo, condimentos, huevos, aceitunas,  entre otros.
texts.en:
Orlith, 36, is a cheerful, hardworking woman.  She has a spouse and lives with him and their two children in a house she owns that she managed to buy with much effort.  The activity Orlith does is selling regional foods, specifically ‘Juanes’ (rice wrapped in leaves, a typical dish of the Amazonian regions).  To do so, she rises very early to cook the food with help from her spouse to then take everything that’s been made to the market where she has a small sales stand.  She takes care of customers very graciously and she’s been in this business for more than 8 years, time in which she’s become very well-known and acquired a good clientele.  She considers the business to be profitable because of the good profits it yields.

She likes her activity because she earns income of her own that lets her help cover household expenses as well as her children’s schooling costs.  She has many acquaintances that wait for her to enjoy her Juanes and demand is high because it’s a dish that’s consumed on a regular basis.  Because of this, she’d like to expand the business and be able to open a restaurant.

This would be MFP loan #3.  She feels very happy with the opportunity to have working capital she can rely on.  She states that she’ll be punctual with her payments so that she can access more loans.  She will use the requested 1,500 new soles to buy ingredients like rice, chicken, condiments, eggs, olives and others, to make Juanes.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, condiments, eggs and olives, etc.

loans.name: Maynor David

texts.es:
Maynor, 31 años de edad, casado, padre de 1 hijo de 4 años de edad, de oficio comerciante y técnico en computadoras. Inicio su negocio hace 4 años con el apoyo de un hermano 	que vive en el extranjero, compro su primer servidor poco a poco fue formando un pequeño Cyber , su esposa trabaja vendiendo cosméticos de esta manera ambos sostienen a su familia. 
Él está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar una computadora, memorias, mouse y teclados. Pues la tecnología va avanzando y necesita mantenerse actualizado ofreciendo máquinas para rápidas con el objetivo de no perder a su clientela sobre todo el sector joven quienes son los que más visitan su negocio. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta comprar su propio local para no estar alquilando, diversificar su negocio ofrecer recargas telefónicas y mejorar el servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
Maynor is 31 years old, married and father of one son, who is four years old. He makes a living as a merchant and a computer technician. He started his business four years ago with the support of a brother, who lives abroad. He purchased his first server and little by little, he transformed it into a small internet cafe. 

His wife works selling cosmetics and in this way both support their family. 

He requests a loan to purchase a computer, memories, mouse, and keyboards. Because the technology is moving fast, he needs to be updated by offering faster machines with the objective not to lose his clients, in particular the youth, who are the most frequent clients of his business. His future plans are to buy his own local, diversify his business, offer prepaid phone cards and improve telephone service to his clientele.

loans.use: to purchase a computer, memories, mouse, and keyboards

loans.name: Silda

texts.es:
Silda, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, dinámica  y alegre. Vive a lado de su pareja y sus 03 hijos, a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos habitan en una casa que es de su propiedad, la cual logró comprar con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Silda, es la venta de plátanos, contado con un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado de su ciudad. Desde entonces se levanta muy temprano y se dirige al puerto fluvial en donde espera la llegada de los productores de plátanos. Lleva dedicándose a ésta actividad hace más de 03 años, contando con la ayuda de su pareja para la atención a los clientes. Le gusta su actividad, el poder contar con un ingreso económico para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, pero no le gusta cuando tiene que levantarse muy de madrugada todos los días, también cuenta que los plátanos tienen una resina que marcha las ropas, y que es difícil de quitar. Pero no se desanima, ella espera poder incrementar su capital de trabajo para poder comprar y vender en mayores volúmenes, así podría obtener mejores ganancias. Este seria el  préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, se siente muy a gusto con el grupo comunal, agradece el apoyo y asesoría de está recibiendo.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más productos para su negocio, comprara plátanos en mayor volumen buscando precios bajos, y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Silda, 29, is a hardworking, dynamic, cheerful woman.  She lives with her partner and their three children who she loves very much.  They all live together in a house she owns that she managed to buy with much effort.  Silda’s activity is selling bananas; she has a small sales stand in her local market.  She rises very early and heads to the port river to await the banana growers.  She’s been in this activity for more than three years; her spouse helps her with customer service.  She likes her activity and being able to have a reliable source of income she can use to help cover household expenses but does not like having to rise at dawn every day.  She also says that the bananas have a resin that stains clothes and is hard to get out.  But she does not become discouraged.  She hopes to increase her working capital to be able to buy and sell larger volumes to earn higher profits.  This will be MFP loan #3.  She feels very comfortable in her communal group and is grateful for the support and guidance she’s getting.  She will use the requested 1,500 new soles to buy more products for her business.  She will buy bananas in larger amounts seeking low prices to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Tesalia

texts.es:
Tesalia, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, alegre y deseosa de progresar.  Está casada con William quien es policía y padre de su hijo José de 15 años de edad. Juntos habitan cómodamente en una casa que es de su propiedad comprada a base de esfuerzo mutuo con su esposo.
La actividad que realiza Tesalia es la costura, oficio que aprendió ayudando a una amiga en su taller, con los ingresos logró comprar su propia máquina de coser. 
Iniciándose de esa manera en éste oficio, y durante estos 10 años ha logrado hacerse conocida y hacer crecer su negocio. Actualmente ha contratado a una amiga como ayudante, pagandole por trabajo o pedido entregado. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja, y eso le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Le gustaría ampliar su negocio, instalar más maquinas y abrir un taller grande, donde podría atender a sus clientes, sabiendo que esto le generaría mejores ingresos económicos, así  como el dar empleos a otras personas. Este sería el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, le gusta su trabajo de su banco comunal, se siente cómoda y a gusto, espero seguir contando con el apoyo de la institución, comenta será puntual en los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el monto prestado de 1500 nuevo soles, lo invertirá en materiales de costura como telas e hilos en mayor cantidad y a menores precios, logrando así mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Tesalia, 44 years old, is a hardworking woman, enterprising, happy, and eager to get ahead. She is married to William who is a police officer and father of her son, José, who is 15 years old. They live together comfortably in a house that was purchased with the joint effort of her husband.

Tesalia works in sewing, a craft she learned helping a friend in her workshop. With her earnings she managed to buy her own sewing machine, beginning that way in this business, and during ten years she has become well known and her business has grown.

Currently she has hired a friend as a helper, paying her by piecework. She considers her business profitable because of the good earnings that it gives her, and that helps her support her husband with the household expenses.

She would like to expand her business, installing more machines and opening a large workshop where she could assist her customers, knowing that she could generate better income and also give employment to other people.

This will be her 10th loan through MFP. She likes her work with the communal bank. She feels comfortable and at ease. “I hope to continue enjoying the support of the institution,” she comments, and she will be punctual making her payments.

With the borrowed amount of 1500 soles, she will buy sewing materials such as fabric and thread in greater amounts at lower prices, thus giving her higher earnings.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread in greater amounts at lower prices to use in her business

loans.name: Al Ain Group

texts.en:
Ibtisam is the featured borrower of Al Ain group, she got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. Ibtisam is the one in the middle.

Ibtisam is a 45-year-old divorced woman, taking care of her only child, Ali (M), who is15 years old. Two years ago, Ibtisam opened a chicken selling shop to make sure that she can provide her son a secure living and provide him with everything he might need. She works hard to provide him with the best education and is hoping that he might be an important business man in the future.

Ibtisam is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for her son's school tuition fees. This is her second cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing paying back history. Her previous loan helped her in increasing her business capital and increasing her income.

Layla is 47-year-old widow, mother of three children (Ali (M) 26, Mohamad (M) 24, Huda (F) 23) who sells clothes in her house, to take care and raise her children. She has been doing this for two years.

She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to do necessary maintenance to her house. She will paste tiles to its floor. She hopes to open her own shop in the future. She is the one on the left.

Fatima is a 29-year-old married woman, mother of two boys (Mahdi 6, Hadi 3). She has worked selling makeup, perfumes and accessories for the past two years to help her husband in making their living and covering their expenses.

She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her products collection with special autumn and winter facial creams. She also hopes to open her own shop in the future. This is the second cycle as Al Majmoua borrowers and they are very excited to have this loan too.

loans.use: to pay for her child's educational fees.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang is from the Vani district of West Georgia. He is 59 years old and lives with his wife. The family earns its living through agricultural work. In particular, the family has a vineyard and a plot of land where they grow maize and nuts. Vakhtang picks grapes and produces wine. On average, he sells 300 kg of nuts, 500 kg of maize and 700 l of wine per year. He also runs a small dairy farm and sells approximately 20 kg of cheese per month.

Vakhtang owns his own tractor and serves the local farmers for a service fee. He has requested a loan to purchase tires for his tractor and to repair it. After the tires are changed and the tractor is repaired, Vakhtang will continue working intensively. This will increase his income and allow him to purchase another tractor to rent at a good price. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy tires for the tractor and to repair it

loans.name: Sofronia

texts.en: Sofronia is a fish vendor from Nocnocan, Talibon. She has been in the fish vending business for more than ten years now. She works hard to earn a living in order to meet the needs of her family. Sofronia is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell to the people in the community. With this, she will be able to enhance her stock and her profits.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Ms Fozia, 33 years old, is married and has three children. For the past 3 years, she has operated a small beauty parlor at the corner of her house. She offers many facilities to her customers; by providing makeup and hair styling services, she has become very famous in her street.

As customer demand is increasing day by day, Ms Fozia is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetic products for the parlor. Since she is facing the financial problem of low cash, she was compelled to contact Kashf Foundation to apply for her second loan. Ms Fozia needs a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy some furniture and bleaching and whitening products in large quantities. With the help of this loan, Ms Fozia will be able to handle more customers, which will ultimately increase her earnings. She dreams of expanding her business and providing a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: To buy some furniture and bleaching and whitening products in large quantities.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 50 year old married woman from Nocnocan, Talibon. She has been running a sari-sari or variety store for more than 20 years now. She sells various items to the people in the community. Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell such as soda, noodles, canned goods, and toiletries. With this she will be able to attract more customers and buyers to her store, thus increasing her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell such as soda, noodles, canned goods, and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plants for the reforestation of his plot of land as well as to pay laborers help him clean and plant his fields.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Mamie from Torkpoi town Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is a married mother blessed with 3 children between the ages of 5 and 11 years, two of whom attend school. In 2003, Mamie established her food stand business at home. She began the business because she wanted to raise money to educate her children since she did not go to school. She works at the business every day from morning until night, at times facing insufficient capital to operate her business. 

Mamie requires a loan in order to expand her business by purchasing additional rice and palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business and to pay her children's school fees. In the future, Mamie plans to make more profit and support her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional rice and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Afig

texts.en:
Afig is 31 years old and lives with his wife, and their daughter and son. He sells clothing, including shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, and other goods. He has been in this business for 12 years and has a good experience in sales, which allows him to get a better income. He works at the local central bazaar. He has a regular customer base, because they prefer the quality, affordable prices, and good service that he offers.
.
Afig is a resourceful and honest man, dedicated to his work. For him, the most important thing is to never give up and to meet adversities with head held high, because some day the door to success will be opened. He has been increasing his sales and wants to obtain a new loan that will allow him to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Moneera

texts.en:
Moneera is a 49-year-old married woman with no children. Her husband is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover all their needs. Moneera has a grocery store. It has been a profitable project and a second source of income for Moneera and her husband, but it needs more support to cover costs.

Moneera is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries, such as rice, cooking oil and canned food, that customers often request. This will increase sales and Moneera's income. Moneera is photographed inside her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en: Wilfreda is a 42 year old married woman and a mother of five school-age children from Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband have been in the fishing business for several years now. This is the source of their daily income. Wilfreda is asking for a loan to buy materials for fishing such as fishing nets, buckets and other things. With this, they will be able to enhance their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, she hopes to make their business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing such as fishing nets, buckets and other things

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of six children.  She is from Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in rice farming for more than 20 years now.

Prima works hard to support her husband in tilling their farm. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, they will be able to enhance and improve their crops, thus giving them a good quality harvest.

Prima dreams of improving their business in the future. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Liz Yesica

texts.es:
Liz es una mujer de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y su pequeño hijo de 3  años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Liz no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar para ayudar a su madre en la crianza de su ganado.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Liz se dedica a la ganadería, ella  cuenta con 5 vacas reproductoras y 2 terneras, las cuales alimenta y cuida con mucha dedicación, adicionalmente vende leche, Liz se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable.
Liz se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una vaca; de esta manera Liz espera poder aumentar su ganado y en poco tiempo desea poder tener un establo grande, así pues Liz espera poder lograr su sueño de tener su propia casa y poder darle la educación necesaria para que su pequeño hijo algún día sea una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Liz is a woman of 23. She lives in the city of Cañete in Imperial district, with her parents and small three-year-old son, whom she loves and is her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. 

Unfortunately, Liz has not been able to pursue a career as a professional, as from a young age she began to work in order to help her mother raise their livestock. With a great deal of effort and dedication, and thanks to her mother's support, Liz raises livestock. She has five breeding cows and two calves that she feeds and looks after with a great deal of dedication. She also sells milk.

Liz is happy doing her work and believes that it is going well because she is very responsible. Liz is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help offered, she will be able to purchase a cow. In this way, Liz hopes to be able to increase her herd of cattle, and in a short time wishes to be able to have a large cow shed.

Liz hopes to be able to achieve her dream of having her own house, and being able to provide the necessary education so that someday her small son can be a fine professional.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 30 year old married woman who has been engaged in the fishing business for several years now. She lives with her family in Talibon. Her husband also works as a fisherman. Teresita is asking for a loan to buy  new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and other supplies. Teresita is optimistic that this loan could help the couple in improving their fishing venture.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and other supplies

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Ms Rafia is a 28-year-old married mother of two. She has been in the carpet manufacturing business for the last four years. She offers various handmade carpets of beautiful designs and is famous in her circle for providing good quality products. Ms Rafia happily does this work for the sake of her family. She tries hard to fulfill their demands, including food, clothing and education. She also does sewing as her part time job. In this way, she is better able to manage her family needs and requirements efficiently.  

This is Ms Rafia’s second year with Kashf Foundation and she has shown excellent repayment behavior. She is happy with the support of Kashf foundation and has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase bundles of good quality wool, nylon and polythene fibers in different colors. She expects to get an increase in her sales and wants to spend part of her profits on house improvements.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of good quality wool, nylon and polythene fibers in different colors.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 31-year-old, married woman, and a mother of four children, living in Nocnocan, Talibon. Emma runs a variety store selling goods like canned goods, snack food and soap, among others.

Emma is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, such as snack food, soda, canned goods, shampoo and toiletries. Emma believes that this loan will help her augment her earnings. She uses her earnings to help her husband meet the family's needs, especially the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to resell, such as snack food, soda, shampoo and toiletries.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a 42-year-old, hard-working man, who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. For eleven years he has been distilling alcohol, and he also farms. Like most good fathers, he dreams of educating his children to attain degrees, and setting up sustainable income-generating activities, to secure their futures. His business goals are to add value to his alcohol by setting up a refinery, and to venture into modern farming activities. Joshua is requesting a loan to buy inputs, such as bananas, for distilling alcohol.

loans.use: to buy inputs, such as bananas, for distilling alcohol.

loans.name: Duba

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Duba from Moriba town Bo Southern area. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 11 and 19. They are currently attending school. She started her business when her husband retired from his job. She needs to works hard to create income for her family.

Duba operates a wholesale palm oil business within a busy market. She sells gallons of palm oil. She has been running this business for 8 years. She works at the business every day, 10 hours per day.  Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenges to her business are competition in the market and a poor road network.

Duba has requested a loan in order to expand her business and buy more gallons of palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and educate her children. In the future, she plans to build a big palm oil business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to expand her business and buy more gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: Dionesia is a 60 year old merchant from Talibon, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari or variety store for more than 30 years now. She sells various goods to people in the community. Dionesia is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, soda, soap and other products. Through this she will be able to attract more customers and buyers to her store. She dreams of making her business a success and making it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, soda, soap and other products.

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in her Kiva profile photo, in her place.

Hind is a 23-year-old, young woman, who is divorced and has no children. For the past seven months, Hind has had a bookstore. She has been selling stationery to students and to institutions. What distinguishes this project is that it is located near many schools and has many loyal customers. The bookstore has been a profitable project and the only source of income to Hind. But it needs more support to cover the costs.

Hind is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN, to purchase a collection of stationery that students and customers often request and buy. This will increase sales and improve Hind's income positively.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of stationery that is in demand, to resell in her bookstore.

loans.name: Marina Consuelo

texts.es:
Marina es una mujer de 58 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amble, trabajadora y entusiasta, que siempre ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente Marina no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Marina trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas en un centro comercial de su ciudad, Marina labora todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Marina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como cemento y cerámica, para renovar su local de ventas, de esta manera Marina espera seguir trabajando y esforzándose para que al lado de su familia puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marina is a 58 year old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her two children, who she loves and who are the principle reason for her life.  She is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who always has dedicated all of her efforts in order to help her family get ahead.  She has been both father and mother to her children.  Sadly, Marina was not able to study for a professional career in Gastronomy, but she very much would have liked to do so.  In her free time she likes to play sports and on occasion she makes a delicious Rice with Duck dish to share with her family.  

With much hard-work and dedication, day by day Marina works in her small business selling food.  She has a small stall for sales in a commercial center in her city.  Marina works every day from early in the morning and stays for approximately 8 hours.  She believes that things are going well because of her good seasonings and for the kind treatment that she offers to her clients.  

Marina is very thankful for Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to purchase construction materials like cement and ceramic in order to renovate the stall where she makes sales.  In this way Marina hopes to continue working and challenging herself so that together with her family they can get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Doña Lucrecia tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Ella se dedica a destazar cerdos desde hace tres años, actividad que aprendió por iniciativa propia, debido a que en el lugar donde ella vive no existía este tipo de negocio. Este trabajo le ayuda muchísimo para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pues antes solo se dedicaba a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa.

Los cerdos los compra a sus vecinos y cuando ellos no tienen, Lucrecia debe desplazarse hasta tres kilómetros a pie, para abordar el autobús que tarda cuarenta y cinco minutos en llegar al lugar en donde va a buscar cerdos; una vez a encontrado los cerdos paga un camión u otro vehiculo para trasportar los cerdos hasta su casa.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar cerdos para engordarlos y posteriormente destazarlos y apoyar a su hijo con el negocio de terneros. Ella desea enseñarle a su hijo el negocio del destazo. Con el préstamo ella tendrá disponible el dinero suficiente para comprar los cerdos por mayor y obtener mejores ganancias.  Para ofrecer a sus hijos una buena alimentación, vestuario, salud, educación. Ella piensa en comprar unas vacas, para tener otra fuente de ingresos y también una forma de obtener alimento para su familia.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is 46 years old, married, and has five children. She has been working as a pig butcher for three years. She learned the trade by herself, because where she lives there wasn't a business like this before. This job is greatly beneficial to her as she can now help her husband with the household expenses; before this she stayed at home to do domestic chores.
She buys the pigs from her neighbors, and if the neighbors don’t have any she has to walk up to three kilometers to take the bus for 45 minutes to the place where she can get pigs. Once she has got the pigs, she pays for a van or other vehicle to transport them to her house.
She will invest this loan in buying pigs to fatten and slaughter in order to support her son’s cattle business. She wants to teach her son how to be a butcher. With this loan, she will have enough money to buy pigs wholesale and increase her profits to be able to give her children better food, clothing, health, and education. She would also like to buy some cows to have another source of income and another way to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and slaughter in order to help her son's cattle business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Fatmata from Moriba town, Southern area, in Sierra Leone. She is married and has five children between the ages of 8 and 25 years.

Fatmata operates a general store within her community. She sells bread, eggs, sugar and pure water, and other items. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works very hard to provide for her family. She does not have any source of income, except her business. She says her business is doing well.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy a variety of items, like soft drinks, eggs, sugar and pure water, for re-sale. The profit from this loan will allow her to increase her products and improve her status of living. Her dream is to have a permanent structure for her grocery store. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items like soft drinks, eggs, sugar and pure water, for re-sale in her shop

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul is married, 45 years old, and father of two children, ages 18 and 16. Rasul started his business 21 years ago, when he was young and had to work with professionalism to provide necessary support for his future. Today he works hard to make his family's living conditions better, and to be able to give his children education on the modern level.
 
He owns a car mechanic shop where, with the two workers he employs, he repairs wheels and other car parts. During the 21-year period since he started his employment, Rasul has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. He plans to expand his business and increase this number further.

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva's partner, VFAC, to start repair work and improve the housing conditions where he and his family live.

loans.use: To start repair work at the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To put in a floor.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet has run his own trading business for about 5 years. He rents a stall in Vanadzor city where he sells fruits and vegetables. Thanks to his business, Hamlet was able to buy a truck which he uses to bring fruits and vegetables for his business from Yerevan wholesale markets and also from Georgia.
 
Hamlet is 39 years old. He lives in Vanadzor city with his retired mother, his unemployed wife and two school-aged children: a daughter and a son. Hamlet’s business is the only source of income for his family. 

Hamlet has received loans from Nor Horizon many times and he has never delayed his repayments. Now Hamlet is asking for a 350,000 AMD loan to buy a large amount of tangerines, lemons, Oriental persimmons, etc. from Georgia for his business.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of tangerines, lemons, and Oriental persimmons from Georgia for his business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph has been our conscientious customer, who services his loans on time. He says that, with the loan facility, he has been able to grow his business, and he is now one of the renowned cattle traders in the region. With the profits he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land for farming. His dreams are to see his children graduate and to expand to new markets. Joseph is requesting a loan to buy cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristóbal, de 65 años, casado padre de 2 hijos, lo cuales van a iniciar la universidad. Se dedica a atender su negocio de alquiler de sillas y mesas plásticas para eventos. Empezó con una camioneta de acarreo, después fue comprando sillas de maderas, después las vendió pues venia modernizándose y compro sillas plásticas, mesas, toldos, manteles, sillas para niños poco a poco ha ido manteniendo su negocio estable, tiene 17 años con esta actividad con la cual ha mantenido a su familia. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de cerdos. Actualmente alquila sillas, mesas, y toldos para todo tipo de eventos tales como cumpleaños, bodas, graduaciones, funerales, eventos de empresas.
La demanda de clientes ha aumentado sobre todo en estos meses que es cuando atiende varios eventos como graduaciones y bodas. Él está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar silla y mesas nuevas, esto le permitirá cumplirle a su clientela y ofrecer un mejor servicio. Pues su expectativa es darse a conocer en los barrios aledaños a su vecindario y expandir su servicio a mas personas.
texts.en:
Cristobal is 65 years old, married, with two children who are in university. He has a business renting plastic tables and chairs for events. He started the business with a small cargo truck. Then he bought wooden chairs, which he later sold. He updated his business by purchasing plastic chairs and tables and also umbrellas, tablecloths and children’s chairs. Little by little he established a stable business that has lasted seventeen years. His business has supported his family. Before this business he sold pigs. Now he rents chairs, tables and umbrellas for all types of events such as weddings, graduations, funerals and corporate events.
His customer demand has grown, especially in these months where there are a lot of events such as graduations and weddings. He is requesting this loan in order to buy new tables and chairs. This will help him meet customer demand and provide good service. He hopes to expand his business to neighboring areas and increase his customer base.

loans.use: to buy new tables and chairs.

loans.name: Yesenia Marylu

texts.es:
Yesenia es una joven de 18 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Yesenia se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Computación e Informática, en sus ratos libres le gusta bailar y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Yesenia trabaja como empleada del hogar, brindando servicios de limpieza y cocina, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Yesenia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una laptop, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder realizar sus trabajos académicos y prácticas; de esta manera Yesenia espera poder culminar satisfactoriamente sus estudios y así lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional y junto a fu familia, desea poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yesenia is an 18-year-old, single young woman. She lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Ica, which is in the district of Parcona. She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. Thanks to her efforts and her parents' support, Yesenia is studying the technical career of Information Technology. In her free time, she likes to dance and sometimes, she cooks a delicious "carapulcra" with "sopa seca," which are typical Peruvian dishes. She likes to share these dishes with her family.

With much effort and dedication, Yesenia works day to day as a domestic worker, providing cooking and cleaning services. She works approximately 8 hours a day and believes that her job is going well because of her good performance and kind treatment toward others.

Yesenia is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a laptop, which will help her substantially to complete her academic work and practical training. This way, Yesenia hopes to satisfactorily complete her education and achieve her dream of being a successful professional, and to move forward along with her family.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Nehemiya

texts.en: Nehemiya is a 42-year-old businessman who sells new clothes in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of whom are still in school. He has had his business for 15 years and it has been very lucrative; he has been able to build a house and pay school fees for his children. His business challenges are customers not paying on time and high taxes that minimize his profits. He dreams of educating his children so they can attain high qualifications, and of setting up a boutique. Nehemiya used his previous loan to buy clothes to sell. He is requesting another loan to buy new clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora. Convive con Humberto, quien es agricultor. Jutnos habitan en su casa propia a lado de sus 2 hijos a quienes quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Lola es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, para esto cuenta con una bodega instalada en su propia casa, la cual abrió por la necesidad económica que atravesaban, pues los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaba. Ahora cuenta con un ingreso adicional y eso le ayuda con los gastos de la casa. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso adicional con el cual puede apoyar a su pareja, además de poder estar en casa y cuidar de sus hijos, quienes están cursando sus estudios. Por lo contrario no le agrada cuando algunos de sus clientes le solicitan crédito por sus compras a lo que ella se niega ya que considera que su negocio está en crecimiento y no le conviene este tipo de venta. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la de productos al por mayor, buscando así tener mayores ganancias y surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Lola is a hard working 47 year-old woman.  She lives with Humberto, who is a farmer.  They live together in their own home with their two children, who they love very much.
   Lola sells basic goods, which she does out of a store that is set up in her home. She opened it up because of the economic hardship they were experiencing. Her partner's income was not sustaining them.  She now has additional income that helps her with household expenses. She likes her business because it allows her to have extra income with which she can support her partner. In addition, she is able to stay at home and take care of her children who are in school.  
  She does not like it, however, when some of her customers request to make purchases from her on credit. Her business is growing, and she considers this type of purchase not to be in her best interest.  This will be her second loan from MFP.  She is hoping for their collaboration so that she can follow through with her plans. With the requested amount of 1000 soles she will invest in bulk products. She is seeking to obtain higher profits and diversify her store.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, sugar, beans, and canned items.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is thirty five years old and is a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and four children who are all in school.  He has been in farming for the past six years producing eggs, maize and milk, which he sells to the people in his local area.

He is requesting 52,000 KES from Juhudi kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow from which he will get more milk for sale and more income that will help him improve his family's livelihood and educate his children.  He plans to have four more dairy cows and be the main supplier of milk in his area in the next five years.

Pests and diseases are his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
Pedro originario de la comarca la joya, Teustepe Municipio de Boaco, casado de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles, padre de 1 hijo de 3 años de edad. Empezó con capital propio, dinero que consiguió trabajando en la fincas de corte de café, en sus viajes a Costa Rica, ya que este negocio le genera ingresos par a sostener a su familia. Ya que  le gustaría a dar a conocer sus productos de granos básicos en la misma   comunidad, sus expectativas  es hacer crecer su negocio para que le genere más ganancias para poder comprar animales como  vacas paridas, terneros.
Pedro solicita el préstamo para pago de mano de obra y compra de insumo como abono y fertilizante. Ya que la estima que este préstamo le será de gran ayuda para levantar su  cosecha con el objetivo de incrementar sus ganancias en la próxima cosechas  y poder vender más productos de granos  básicos a un buen precio, su meta próxima es cancelar dicho préstamo para volver a solicitar otro, de esta manera poder comprar  más animales como vacas y tierras para cosechar.
texts.en:
Peter is from the region of La Joya and the town of Boaco. He is married and works in agriculture. He grows corn and beans. He is the father of a three-year-old boy. He started his business with his own money. This money he earned working in farms harvesting coffee in Costa Rica. This work allowed him to generate income to use to support his family. He would like to grow basic grains in his community. He hopes to grow his business so that he has more earnings. He will use this money to buy animals such as cattle.
Peter is asking for this loan in order to hire workers and buy supplies such as fertilizer and manure. He believes that this loan will be very helpful with increasing his harvest. This will increase his earnings. He will use the earnings to finance his next harvest. He will also get a better price for his grains. His goal is to pay off this loan so that he can ask for another loan, which he will use to buy cattle and land to grow crops.

loans.use: to pay for farmworkers and to buy supplies such as manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 19-year-old, single man. For the past two years, Abdullah has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him. But also it needs more support to cover the cost, from time to time.

Abdullah is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's reliable capacity to work extra hours. It will enable Abdullah to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve Abdullah's income positively.

Abdullah is photographed next to his taxi. His ambition for the future is to buy a new taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for the taxi

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 19-year-old single man who has been working as a barber for the past 2 years. He is a hard worker who puts a lot of effort into improving and expanding his business, to make sure that his customers are pleased. Ali is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy new cosmetics and beauty products necessary for his business. He will increase his stock of hair treatments, creams, facials and after shaves, to provide a wide variety for his customers to buy. These products are an extra source of income he relies on a lot in addition to what he gets for haircuts. Ali's customers are almost all his friends, neighbors and relatives. He is working hard to start saving as much money as he can to open a wider beauty therapy salon specializing in men’s facial treatments.

loans.use: To buy new cosmetics and beauty products necessary for his business

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Mamie, from Kandeh town Bo, Southern area, in Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children, ages 2 and 6 years. One of her children is currently attending school. 

In 2009, Mamie established her cookery business. She began her business because she wanted to raise income to support herself and her family. She works at the business every day.  She starts preparing her cookery at 4:30 a.m., and she does not rest until the food has been finished and taken to market, to prepare for the next day. She says her cookery business is doing well. Out of the food she prepares, she feeds her household. 

Mamie requires a loan in order to buy more bags of rice, oil, and cooking seasonings. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her cookery business and educate her child. In the future, Mamie hopes to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, oil and cooking seasonings for her cookery business.

loans.name: Almas

texts.en: Almas is 61 years old. She is an enterprising woman and mother of five children. 22 years ago, she understood that making pickles to sell was a good source of family income. That is why she continues growing vegetables with the support of her family. Having attained her fifth VFAC loan allows her to continue producing and firmly confronting her problems. It helps to support her children's future and her confidence. She will use the 1,000 AZN loan to buy vegetable seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Mariano Jose

texts.es:
Mariano 42 años de edad, originario de Comarcas Aguas Caliente, Teustepe Municipio de Boaco, de oficio agricultor, padre de 1 hijo entre la edad de 8 años de edad el cual estudia tercer grado de primaria en la escuela de la misma comarca él se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la compra y venta de ganado, ya que este negocio lo hace con ayuda de un amigo, el comenzó con capital  propio, dinero que ganaba como trabajador de motocierrista, el comercializa sus granos básicos en la misma comarca.
Mariano solicita el préstamo para comprar una mula(donkey) el cual le serviría para poder transportar sus ventas de granos básicos de una comarca a otra, sus expectativas es incrementar sus ventas y así obtener más ganancias en su negocio, ya que el estima que este préstamo le ayudaría hacer crecer su negocio y salir adelante con su familia, sus planes futuros es pagar el préstamo y poder solicitar otro, para comprar ganado.
texts.en:
Mariano is 42 years old and from the Aguas Caliente/ Teustepe region in the municipality of Boaco.  He is a farmer and the father of one son who is 8 years old and in third grade.  He works planting corn and buying and selling cattle.  He works at this business with the support of a friend.  He began with his own capital, money that he earned as a lumberjack.  He sells his staple goods in the same region.

Mariano is requesting the loan to purchase a donkey, which will enable him to transport his staple goods from one region to another.  His expectation is to increase his sales and thus, obtain greater profits for his business, since he estimates that this loan will help him to grow his business and move forward with his family.  His future planes are to pay back his loan and request another to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a donkey.

loans.name: Eva Del Carmen

texts.es:
Eva originaria de la comunidad San Nicolás en las afueras de Estelí , pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Estelí, soltera, madre de 2 hijos  entre las edades de 16 y 18 años de edad respectivamente, con pocos  conocimientos   académico, de oficio comerciante, ella trabajo anteriormente de doméstica, pero como miro que no le generaba mucho ingreso, fue cuando decidió poner su propio  comedor, ya que su hermana le ayudo económicamente para establecer su negocio en el mercado de  Estelí, ya que ella no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos, además le gustaría dar a conocer su comida en todo el mercado.
 Eva solicita financiamiento para comprar: arroz, frijoles, maíz y leña etc. Este crédito le ayudara a comprar  más  productos y de esta manera  poder  invertir  más en su negocio, ya que asi crecerá más la demanda de sus productos. A ella le gustaría poder ampliar más sus productos  para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y darles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eva is originally from the community of San Nicolás, on the outskirts of Estelí but now she lives in Estelí. She is a single mother of two children, ages 16 and 18. She had a minimal knowledge of business as before this she worked s a housekeeper. She realized she wasn’t earning much as a housekeeper so she decided to open a food stand. Her sister helped her establish her business in the market in Estelí, as she had no other source of income. She would like the market to become familiar with her food.
Eva is asking for this loan to buy rice, beans, corn and firewood. This loan will help her buy more products and further invest in her business. This is how she will increase customer demand for her products. She would like to increase the products she offers in order to satisfy her customers and provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 47-year-old married man and father of two children. He has been working in the wood business for 30 years. In 2011, he opened his present factory to expand his business more and more.

Elias is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary wood for a project he is working on and to increase his wood stock to benefit future requests.

This is his first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower and he hopes to invest his loan in the well-managed way that he is planning.

He hopes to expand his business in the future, move to a wider factory and recruit someone to help him.

loans.use: to buy wood to increase his stock for current and future projects

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es:
Serapio originario de la Comarca el Bramadero Teustepe, tiene  51 años, padre de 6 hijos entre las edades de 14, 15, 17, 24,25 y 27 años de edad  respectivamente, Soltero, de oficio agricultor, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol. El cuenta que su papa le enseño a trabajar desde la edad  de 10 años, en donde se sembraba granos básicos para el consumo de la familia, después el decidió sembrar granos básicos  para vender y asi mejorar la producción y obtener mayores ingresos  para el mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Ya que sus expectativas es poder seguir trabajando y  hacer crecer su negocio para que le genere mayor producción en su cosecha.
Serapio solicita el préstamo para pago de mano de obra y compra de insumo como fertilizantes, abonos,  que le permitirán ofrecer un producto de calidad a sus clientes para obtener mejores ganancias en su negocio, sus planes futuros es comprar tierra, para heredar  a sus hijos, una de sus metas es poder comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda y darles un techo digno.
texts.en:
Serapio is from Bramadero Teustepe. He is 51 years old and the father of six children, ages 14, 15, 17, 24, 25 and 27. He is single and a farmer who grows corn and beans. His father taught him farming when he was ten. First he grew grains for the family and then he decided to sell them to others. This is how he increased his production, which improved the quality of life for his family. He hopes to continue working, growing his business and increasing his crop production. 
Serapio is asking for this loan in order to pay for workers and to buy supplies such as manure and fertilizer. He wants to offer a quality product to his customers. In this way he will improve the earnings of his business. His future plans include buying land so his children can inherit it. One of his goals is to buy construction materials to use to improve his home and give his family a proper place to live.

loans.use: to pay farmworkers and buy supplies such as fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru started his catering business four years ago, when he decided to work independently. Having worked in several places for many years, he gained a great experience in the business-making. He has improved the quality of life of his wife and two children significantly, and his income has increased thanks to his efforts.
 
Nuru needs a loan of 1400 AZN, to improve his business place in order to offer better service to his customers, thus improving his sales. He will make repairs to his business place.

loans.use: To make repairs to his business place, so he can offer better service to his customers.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Salamatu from Torkpoi town Bo, in the southern area of Sierra Leone. She is blessed with three children between the ages of 6 and 19 years old. Both of her children are currently attending school. In 2004, Salamatu established her food stand business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. Before, she was a farmer. She works at the business 13 hours per day and 6 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transporting her business from her house to the market and the lack of a storage facility in the market.

Salamatu requires a loan of Le 800,000 to expand her foodstuff business by buying wood, fish, gari and palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family welfare and educate her children. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business to a shop level. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy wood, fish, gari and palm oil.

loans.name: Ilham's Group

texts.en:
Ilham is a 39-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of three children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Ilham is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has four years of experience with the home-based sewing and tailoring business activity, which she would like to improve now to be able to offer a better variety of creative services and products to her customers. She would like to buy an overlock machine (a serger). To be able to afford the purchase, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine (serger)

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, de 21 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Convive con Segundo, quien es empleado y padre de su único hijo, juntos  están cómodamente instalados en la casa de sus padres en compañía de sus padres y sus hermanos. La actividad que realiza Nelly es la venta de golosinas de diversas marcas y presentaciones. Para eso instala todos los días una mesa en el frontis de una escuela cerca a su casa donde atiende muy amablemente a todos sus clientes que en su mayoría son los escolares y jóvenes de la zona. Está en éste negocio más de 3 años y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola. Ella comenta que tiene problemas económicos pues con los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanza para cubrir todos sus gastos, por tanto quiere apoyarlo generándose un ingreso adicional.
Por tanto, viendo lo rentable que es su negocio, y las ganancias que le deja desea abrir una bodega de venta de abarrotes en su casa, así poder cuidar de su menor hijo. Este será el préstamo número 05 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que vienen dando las personas con el acceso a créditos.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas de diversos sabores y presentaciones  para surtir  su negocio,  buscando precios bajos por sus compras al contado y en volumen.
texts.en:
Nelly is 21 years old, and a woman with a great desire to succeed and offer a better quality of life to her family. She lives with her partner Segundo, who is an employee and the father of her only child. Together they are comfortably accommodated in her parents' house, living with her parents and her brothers. 

The work Nelly does is selling candy of various brands and packaging. For this, she sets up a table every day in front of a school near her home, where she serves all her customers in a very friendly way. A majority of them are students and young people who live in the area. 

She has been in this business for more than three years and so far has been doing it on her own. She says that she has financial problems, as even with the income of her partner, there is not enough to cover all their expenses. Therefore she wishes to help him by generating additional income.

So, seeing how profitable her business is, and the earnings it provides, she wishes to open a grocery store in her home, so that this way she can look after her youngest child. This will be her fifth loan with the MFP institution. 

She is happy to know that she will have financial assistance to make her plans a reality. Therefore she promises to be responsible in paying her installments as with her previous loans. In addition, she says she is happy with the communal bank because of the help they have been giving her through access to loans.

With the amount applied for of 2,000 nuevos soles, she will purchase candy of various flavors and packaging for stocking her business, seeking  low prices for her purchases in cash and in bulk.

loans.use: To buy various candy products.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
