Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Claudio is part of the Mis Sueños (My Dreams) communal bank in the city of Talca.  For ten years he has made a living in the area of selling firewood.  He says that he works outside of his home and in these moments he can be found gathering wood to sell in the winter season; the months with the strongest sales are March through September.  He goes out in search of firewood in the mountains and woods, and sometimes buys the wood to sell to his customers.  He sometimes buys his merchandise from wood distributers and other times he goes out to find it in the woods, countryside, and mountains. 

With the loan he will buy gasoline, chains, oil, and a power saw.  One of Claudio's goals is to sell much more than last year, which is why he can be found gathering wood and chopping it to sell and to generate higher income so with this he can aim for a better quality of life. 

Claudio lives together with his wife and two children of 4 and 20 years old.  His dream for work is to sell as much as he can and his dream for his family is to see that his children have a good future and to give them a good life.  He is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza because it will allow him to invest in his business.  In regards to the communal bank group that he is a part of, he says that very good communication exists within it.  On the other hand, the training has helped him to learn new sales and accounting strategies.  

Talca belongs to the region of Maule, located in the center area of the country.  This is the administrative, economic, and cultural center of the region, being the most important city of the Chilean Central Valley.  There is a curious reference to Talca that exists in Chile: the phrase "Talca, Paris, and London."  Among the myths on this matter some say that this is a derivation of what was originally said by an Englishman, "Talca looks like London," for the abundant fog that frequently covers the city during the winter season, similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, chains, oil, and a power saw.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, and all her children go to school. She has one additional family member (her grandmother). She operates a retail shop that she rents. She also gets additional income from farming .She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cooking oil, flour, rice, soap, beans, wheat and crates of soda. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to buy a truck for transporting her stock to the shop. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, flour, rice, beans, wheat and crates of soda.

loans.name: Rafi

texts.en: Rafi is a 47-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married to a kind lady, the mother of his three school-aged children. With the cooperation of his working wife, Rafi has been able to manage the family’s household expenses and thus improve their way of living. He has many years of experience as a car mechanic, and he decided to open his own garage in 1991. As he wishes to better develop his work, Rafi is asking today for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a good quantity of spare car parts at fair prices. This step will enhance his business, allowing him to receive more clients who are going to be served rapidly. Rafi and his family depend on this career, and that’s why another Kiva loan will be way good for him to expand his business and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a good quantity of spare car parts at fair prices.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop that she rents. She also gets additional income from selling fruits and vegetables at the market .She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy cooking oil, flour, rice, soap and crates of soda. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are  to educate her children to university level and expand her retail shop into a wholesale shop. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, flour, rice, soap and crates of soda.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 39-year-old man. He’s married and lives in Lebanon with his wife and three children. They are all studying. He is the one responsible for covering his family expenses and responding to their needs. He also has his wife’s support; she works at one of the local Lebanese hospitals. Bassam is obliged to work continually, for he wants to enhance his family’s way of life. He has been working in the construction field since 1990. His specialty is floor covering, and he has gained a fair number of clients asking for his services. Though satisfied with what he has attained so far, he suffers from a bad financial situation; that’s the reason of why he’s asking today for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his business by allowing him to purchase new construction tools, for he wants to continue offering the best quality of work for his clients. In the near future, Bassam plans to take more loans to open his own paving shop. This is how he works really hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing new construction tools.

loans.name: Clovis

texts.en: Clovis is a forty-two-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For ten years now he has been actively involved in commercial agriculture, and he got his initial capital from carpentry. Just like most farmers he is faced with challenges of unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation; however, he has dreams of venturing into modern farming activities and having a wholesale shop. Clovis intends to use the loan to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This is Ahmad, a 32-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and their one child. He had many years of experience as a barber until he decided to open his own shop in 2003. He intended to open the shop in his town as he knows its entire population and most of them are really close to him. Ahmad always seeks to please his clients and responds to their needs, whatever they are.

He also owns a van in which he transports people to their desired locations. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate his shop’s interior decorations. He notes that this Kiva loan will better improve his work, allowing him attract added customers and thus increase his revenues by 20%. Ahmad is not ready to have a big family until he’s financially satisfied and able to cover all their needs. This is why he’s trying his best to develop his work and enlarge his business as soon as possible.

loans.use: to renovate his shop’s interior decorations.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 25-year-old Lebanese young man. He’s single and living with two of his relatives, because his father’s business is outside the country. Hasan wants to cover their expenses, although he gets a fair monthly amount from his father.  Because of that, he’s working really hard to be able to reach his goals. 

He started his own business as a private teacher in 2009. He receives his students at home, because in that way he will be able to deliver his lessons in a good way. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed teaching materials in addition to stationery and many other items. Hasan is sure that this will allow him to develop his way of teaching and thus his communication with the students. Joining a school is one of his greatest dreams, where he can improve his skills and therefore his way of living.

loans.use: to purchase the needed teaching materials in addition to stationery and many other items.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Don Porfirio tiene 52 años, vive en pareja con Vicenta  y tienen 3 hijos. Es comerciante desde hace mas de 20 años, realiza sus ventas en forma directa y también en forma de pedidos como macatero (vendedor ambulante) en las zonas de la Cordillera, Caaguazú, y Encarnación, cuenta con clientela formada a quienes visita en forma permanente dependiendo de la zona que le toque trabajar.
Cuenta que con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya llego a ampliar la variedad de sus productos, satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, y aumentar sus ingresos, que gracias a eso asume con todos los gastos familiares y la educación de sus hijos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de pesca, herramientas para carpintería, los cuales tienen mucha salida a la hora de vender.
texts.en:
Don Porfirio is 52 years old, he lives in partnership with Vicenta and they have three children.  He has been a merchant for more than 20 years.  He makes his sales directly and also from orders as a street vendor in the areas of Cordillera, Caaguazú, and Encarnación.  He has formed customers whom he visits regularly depending on the area that he works.

He says that with the loans he has gotten from Fundación Paraguaya he has come to increase the variety of his products, satisfying his customers' demand and increasing his income, which thanks to this he assumes all of the family expenses and the education of his children.  He asks for the loan to buy fishing items and carpentry tools, which have great marketability when it is time to sell.

loans.use: to buy fishing items, carpentry tools, etc.

loans.name: Zapha

texts.en: Zapha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, and both of her children go to school. She has additional family members (mother, sister, brother and father). She operates a retail shop that she rents. She also gets additional income from selling new clothes, jewelry and crafts. She has been in business for the last 7 years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of sugar, cooking oil, soap, beans, wheat and crates of soda. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a truck for transporting her stock to the shop, to own a wholesale shop, and to build her own business premises. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, wheat and crates of soda

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband. They cooperate together expecting to bring added income to the family.  She has worked from home as a private teacher since 2007. She also teaches at a local school. As for her husband, he has his own business and works independently. 

Zahra feels that she is helping learners to get their needed education. So she asked today to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to arrange a special room in her house where she receives her students and equip it with required materials and supplies. She notes that these purchases will facilitate her work preparation and will help her do research and studies which will improve her teaching skills. She is very positive about her future and wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to arrange a special room in her house where she receives her students and equip it with required materials and supplies.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a married man living with his wife and one child. He’s a 25-year-old hard worker looking to respond to his family demands and satisfy their needs. Ali has many years of experience in his present job. He’s an independent painter who works on clients' requests. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results. He also works on his van in his free time. He’s known for being well-organized and punctual. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new painting tools and supplies. He will be utilizing the painting in his new projects. He’s grateful for all the good things god has given him. In the near future, he looks to take on more projects, maybe outside the country, and therefore earn superior income.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools and supplies.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children, who are all attending school. With his family’s support, Ibrahim is capable of managing the house expenses and live a proper life.  Despite all the difficulties that he faced, he was courageous and not afraid to take on his  whole family's responsibilities. 

He started to work as a painter in year 2000 and still works on a free-lance basis. He’s expert in his field and knows very well how to deal with his clients. Today, he’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added painting tools for his business in order to be able to handle his new project. This Kiva loan will open a new door for him to take bigger projects and increase his productivity by 30%. In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to purchase added painting tools for his business.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 35 years old, married, and has two children. He is a businessman who sells household goods like cups, plates, spoons, jugs, soap dishes and other items. He has been in business for five years and has been able to expand his business through the help of Faulu Kenya. 

He dreams of growing his business to greater heights and also increase his profits. He requests a loan of 85,485 KES to increase his stock of household goods.

loans.use: to increase his stock of household goods.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old, and he owns Angelica Fashions. He successfully repaid his previous loan because his business did very well. He is a very hardworking man, as he has to provide for his family and also provide quality services for his customers.

He requires another loan of 53,156 to buy cloth, thread and buttons. He wishes to expand his business more and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, buttons and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Bernard used his previous loan to add stock of sugar, cooking fat, soda, soap and rice. His business did well and he repaid his loan. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has become very successful and his business has grown.
 
He dreams of having a big business and increasing his profits. He requests a loan of 90,000 KES to increase his grocery stock.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, cooking fat, soda, soap and rice.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Mbalu is 47 years old, widowed, and has three children. She runs a local food business in Kandeh town Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone, which she has been doing for nine years. She began this business after the death of her husband.   Mbalu sells gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava).  Her business is the only income she has. 

Mbalu is requesting a loan from BRAC Sierra Leone, which she will use to buy more bags of gari to sell. The main challenges to her business are competition in the market and the cost of transportation which is very high.The extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and educate her children. In the future, Mbalu would like to open a gari store.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Agress

texts.en: Agress lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, and one of her children goes to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop that she rents. She also has a motorcycle to generate additional income. She has been in business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of sugar, cooking oil, flour, rice, soap and crates of soda. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals are to educate her children to university level and own a wholesale shop. She lives in a rented house, where the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cooking oil, flour, rice, soap and crates of soda.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mis Sueños” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la amasandería y venta de frituras, específicamente a empanadas, tortillas, pan, sopaipillas, completos, papas fritas, desde hace 10 años. Ella ofrece sus productos y sus clientes llegan a su domicilio a comprar y algunas veces se dirige ella a entregar sus productos a los almacenes, habilitó un lugar en su casa para una mejor atención a su clientela, trabaja de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Comenta que la mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra directamente en supermercados y/o distribuidoras, ya que son lugares en los cuales encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará aceite, grasa, levaduras, harina, papas, kétchup, sal, servilletas, entre otros.
Una de las metas de Maria es obtener un vehículo para poder desplazarse más cómodamente y a la vez comprar su mercadería y no preocuparse de cómo llevársela, además le serviría para la temporada de verano evitando el calor.
Maria vive junto a su hija de 14 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral y personal es obtener su vehículo para comprar mas cómodamente y a nivel familiar darle un buen pasar a su hija y un buen futuro escolar.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le abrió una puerta laboral y le permitirá invertir en su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto al Banco Comunal que forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación y unidad.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Maria is part of the Mis Sueños (My Dreams) communal bank in the city of Talca.  For ten years she has made a living in the field of baking and selling fried food, especially empanadas, tortillas, bread, sopaipillas, hot dogs with salads, and french fries.  She sells her products and customers come to her home to buy and sometimes they advise her to deliver her products to stores.  She equipped a place in her house to better tend to her customers.  She works from Monday to Saturday and she sets her schedule according to her availability.  She says that the goods and supplies that she is going to need she buys directly from supermarkets and/or distributers, since they are the places in which she finds the merchandise at low cost, therefore financially convenient. 

With the loan she is going to buy oil, lard, yeast, flour, potatoes, ketchup, salt, and napkins, among other items.  One of Maria's goals is to get a vehicle so that she can travel more comfortably and at the same time buy her merchandise without worrying how she is going to carry it, in addition to it allowing her to escape the heat in the summer season.

Maria lives with her 14-year-old daughter who is in school.  Her work and personal dreams are to get a vehicle in order to buy more easily, and at a family level her dream is to give her daughter a good life and a good future in school.  She is very grateful and happy for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza because it opened a working door to her and will allow her to invest in her business and also in her personal growth since she has learned to organize and distribute her income and investments in a better way.  In regard to the communal bank that she is part of, she says that very good communication and unity exists within it. 

Talca belongs to the region of Maule, located in the center area of the country.  It is the administrative, economic, and cultural center of the region, being the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  There exists peculiar reference to Talca in Chile: the phrase "Talca, Paris, London."  Among the myths on this matter, some say that is a derivation of what was originally said by an Englishman, "Talca looks like London," for the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in the winter season, similarly to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy oil, lard, yeast, flour, potatoes, ketchup, salt, and napkins, among other items.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Baby from Kandeh town Bo, Southern area. She is married with five children between the ages of 10 years and 32 years. Three of her children attend school. 

Baby operates a gari and palm oil business. She sells palm oil and gari (pickled vegetables) within a busy market area. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business every day, 10 hours per day. Her business is the only source of income she has. She describes her major problem as insufficient capital to run her business and competition in the market.  

Baby has requested a loan in order to buy more local food stuff like gari and palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more local food stuff like gari and palm oil.

loans.name: Saraswati Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, five poor, illiterate rural women of Mahulpada village in Titilagarh Block in the Bolangir district of Odisha, India, formed a Joint Liability Group named Saraswati with an objective to support their family businesses by taking loans from Mahashakti Foundation for the over all development of their families.

Kuntala, about 37 years old, is one among the members who is sitting second from the right with a raised hand. Kuntala is married and resides in a small hut with her five-member family comprising her husband, two sons and one daughter. 

All members of Saraswati group belong to very poor backgrounds. The community of Kuntala especially has a separate establishment in the village. The main source of livelihood of this community is weaving of bamboo baskets of various varieties and selling them in the market. The people of this community are far away from basic needs like education, shelter, health facilities, etc. due to poverty and rural base. 

The business of Kuntala (weaving of bamboo baskets) is a traditional business of their community. Previously, the inhabitants of this community themselves collected raw bamboo from the nearest forest for weaving of baskets. But due to forest degradation, now they have to travel far away for purchasing of raw bamboo. Kuntala and her husband combine to do the processing work and weaving of baskets like kula, tupa, kurli, bhuga, kulei, garna, talei, parla, etc. of different sizes. During marriage season there are heavy demands for these products. They sell the products weekly in the nearest weekly market of the town. Some traders also regularly come to this village to purchase bamboo products. Kuntala earns a monthly profit of INR 2,000 from her business. 

Currently, there is a growing demand for this products and traders are used to supplying this to various parts of the country. So Kuntala wants to purchase more raw bamboo from this loan to work for a longer period without any interruption. She also wants to procure some ready-made products from other weavers. This will help her to earn some extra income to manage the family smoothly. Kuntala hopes to construct a house in the near future.

The other four members of the group are Nalini, Bui, Sukrabari and Padma who are doing similar businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing bamboo

loans.name: Tara Tarini Group

texts.en:
In May 2011, five women from Titilagarh town of Bolangir district in Odisha, India, formed a group named Tara Tarini to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for expanding their businesses. 

Alibha, a headstrong and confident lady, is one of them. The lady sitting middle in the photo raising her hand is Alibha. She is 39 years of old and lives with her husband, two sons, 20 and 14 years old, and her daughter, age 12. All her children are continuing their studies. Her elder son is studying for an engineering degree. Although Alibha is a permanent resident of Titilagarh, due to a residential problem her family is residing in a rented house in the same town.

Alibha has run a mixture and fried peanut supply business for the last seven years with the hand-holding support of her husband. She purchases raw peanuts in bulk, fries them, makes small packets in polythene and her husband supplies them to retailers at a wholesale price. Apart from this, she also supplies mixtures at wholesale. Alibha usually supplies 300 kilograms of fried peanuts to the retailers in a week. She purchases stock of peanuts from three wholesale markets 200 kms away. She gets a monthly income of INR 5,000 from the existing business. 

Out of this income she is hardly able to manage her household and the educational expenses of her children, especially since her elder son is studying for his engineering degree at a distant place. Money poses a hindrance for managing all these expenses from her scanty income. So she wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Alibha wants to purchase more stock of raw peanuts from the present loan. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she usually has to replenish her stock frequently.

Alibha hopes to save enough for building a good house of her own as the present house is a rented one. She has also dreams to give better education to her children. 

The other four members of the group are Ranjulata, Bhanumati, Puspanjali and Surendri, who are running meals hotel, screen printing, tea stall and daily needs businesses respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of peanuts in bulk.

loans.name: Trabajdoras De Saguazu Group

texts.es:
El comite lleva por nombre Trabajadora de Saguazu, debido a que el grupo es bastante unidos y trabajadoras , han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo y trabajar arduamente para poder seguir ayudando a sus familias.
Eugenia una de las miembros, comenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos, nos cuenta que es un trabajo muy pesado, pues debe de estar pendiente todo el día de sus animales, pero también cuenta que su trabajo es el medio que tiene para dar a su familia lo que necesitan, y que por eso está orgullosa de lo que hace. Desea poder seguir aumentando la cría que tiene y de esa forma seguir ganando mejores ingresos para su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, ya que tiene bastantes cerdos que necesita alimentar y no le debe de faltar.
texts.en:
The committee took the name, “Workers of Saguazu” because the group is very united and hardworking. They have made a pact to remain united and to work hard to be able to continue helping their families. 

Eugenia is one of the members. She says that she works to raise and sell pigs. She tells us that it is a hard job, since she had to attend to her animals all day long, but at the same time she says that her job is the only way she has of giving her family what they need, and because of that she is proud of what she does.

She wants to continue growing the animals she has and in that way keep making more money for her family.
She is asking for the loan for the purchase of feed for her animals, since she has a lot of pigs she needs to feed and she can’t miss even one.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Lidia Maritza

texts.es: Lidia Maritza de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto compañero de vida Andrés y sus tres hijos ; ella se dedica a la venta de artículos varios y ropa como camisas, pantalones, vestidos entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia en el mercado de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todo lo que vende es de calidad, a buenos precios y con un excelente servicio; Lidia es una mujer admirable, le encanta su trabajo siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades y nuevas ideas para superarse y sobresalir, piensa que el más grande éxito solo lo gana el que no se rinde en la batalla, ahora que tiene mucha demanda desea invertir más y extender el negocio  pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa, papel higiénico, jabones etc. Lidia Maritza tiene buenas referencias de pago y tiene experiencia crediticia, por eso se hace totalmente responsable del pago del financiamiento, y además tiene fe que así podrá darle a su familia una vida más plena como se la merecen.
texts.en:
Lidia Maritza is 35 years old and lives together with her life partner Andrés and their three children. She sells various goods and clothing such as shirts, pants, dresses, and more. She has worked in this business for several years and has accrued a lot of experience that has allowed her to make the best profits. She sells in the town market and she has earned a lot of customers. Everything she sells is high quality at good prices with excellent service. 

Lidia is an admirable woman. She loves her work since she is always looking for new opportunities and new ideas to improve herself and overcome obstacles. She thinks that the greatest success is simply to win and not be defeated in the battle. 

Now that she has a lot of demand, she wants to invest more and extend the business, but she needs support for the capital.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that would allow her to purchase clothing, toilet paper, soaps, etc. Lidia Maritza has good references for payment and has experience with credit, so she is fully responsible for the repayment. In addition, she has faith that this way she will be able to give her family a fuller life, just as they deserve.

loans.use: purchase clothes, toilet paper, and soap

loans.name: Choko

texts.en:
Choko, 33, resides with her husband and three children in Congo  town. Her children are between the ages of  5 and 14, and are currently in school. Choko stopped her  education in the 9th grade. 

She learned to sell from her mother, and she received the initial capital from her husband to start in this business. She has been involved in used clothing sales for the past four years. She sells ladies underwear and ladies blouses. Because of the good interaction she has with her customers, she makes profit when she sells. With the profit, she buys more goods to improve the business.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase more used clothes for the business to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business to increase her sales.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mis Sueños” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la agricultura (actividades agrícolas  destinadas a la producción de alimentos y a la obtención de verduras, frutas, hortalizas y cereales) desde hace 15 años. Comenta que trabaja específicamente lechugas, cebollas, tomates y pepinos, trabaja desde su casa y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Comenta que sus insumos los compra en distribuidoras de semillas y distribuidoras de articulos de agricultura a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará abono, líquidos biofertilizantes y semillas de pepino.
Una de las metas de Fabiola es crecer dia a dia y ver las ganancias que va recibiendo con sus ventas de verduras, y así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Fabiola vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 13 y 10 años. Quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es surgir como microempresaria y a nivel familiar contar con más recursos en el hogar, porque los hijos van creciendo y a al mismo tiempo crece la necesidad de darles un buen pasar y ver que terminen de estudiar para ver su tarea cumplida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, lo cual la motiva a seguir participando en la institución. Comenta además  que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Fabila is part of the Communal Bank, “My Dreams,” which is in the city of Talca. 

She had been working in agriculture (agricultural activities which lead to the production of food and the reaping of vegetables, fruit, garden produce, and cereal) since she was 15 years old. She says she works especially with lettuce, onions, tomatoes, and peppers. She works from home and her schedule depends on her availability. 

She tells us that she gets her goods from seed and agricultural distributors at a low price, based on what she can afford.
With the loan she will buy fertilizer, liquid biofertilizers, and pepper seeds.

One of Fabiola’s goals is to grow each day and to see what she earns with her vegetable sales, and in that way she hopes to gain a better quality of life.
Fabiola lives with her husband and her two children, who are 13 and 10 years old and who are currently in school. Her professional dream is to become a micro-entrepreneur and her personal dream is to have more resources in her home, since the children are growing and, as they do so, so is the need to give them what’s best and to see that they finish their studies and make sure their homework is completed. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza (“Hope Fund”) has given her, since the loan will allow her to invest in her business. On top of that, she feels comfortable being part of the communal bank, which motivates her to continue participating in the organization. She says that on top of that, the training they give her in the meetings has helped her invest better in her business. 

Talca belongs to the Maule region, which is located in the central area of the country. It is the administrative, economic, and cultural hub of the region, being the most important city in the central Chilean valley. In Chile, there is a funny phrase about Talca, the phrase, “Talca, Paris, and London.” Regarding that, some people say that it derives from the original saying in English, “Talca looks like London,” because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city during the summer season in a similar way to the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, liquid biofertilizers, and pepper seeds.

loans.name: Jay Mata Jee Group

texts.en:
The Jaya Mata Jee Joint Liability Group was formed in the year 2012 by six active women of Titilagarh town of Bolangir district in Odisha, India.Their primary objective was to avail credit from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their existing businesses. 

Ranju, age about 40 years, is one of them. The lady standing in the photo, raising her hand is Ranju. She lives with her husband, three daughters, 18, 15 and 13 years old, and a son, 14 years old. All her children are continuing their studies in the local college.

Ranju has been running a small general store in her locality for the last eight years with the help of her husband. She sells general grocery items like rice, oil, sugar, lentils, biscuits, soft drinks, toffees, etc. Her net monthly income from the existing business is INR 4,000. Out of this income she has been able to contribute some part for household expenditures like the educational expenses of her children. 

Ranju purchases stock for her business daily from the wholesalers of the town. As per her statement, she was able to increase the variety of items in her shop but not the inventory. She wants to increase stock of her business from this loan by purchasing items like lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, etc. for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing costs and save time as she normally has to refill her stock on daily basis.

Out of the extra income, Ranju wants to save some money and dreams to provide better education to her children as she believes that education is the pillar of all success.

The other five members of the group are Jayanti, Sanjukta, Lalima, Sanjukta-1 and Suprabha who are running egg stall, barber shop and tent house businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children and one goes to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food, and rent. 

She operates a pub at the shop that she rents. She has been in business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She also has a motorcycle that provides additional income.

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of soda, beer, water and other drinks. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to buy a plot of land and also to own a fully stocked pub.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda,boxes of mineral water and other drinks

loans.name: Iveth

texts.es: Iveth compró vestidos y calzados con su credikiva anterior; Así invirtiendole nota que su negocio crece y esto es importante para ella, porque puede mejorar su infraestructura, tener mercancias en sus inventarios y cumple con su clientela, lo que le representa utilidades. Está muy feliz porque su esposo que sencontraba desempleado ya tiene un empleo y es bueno para el logro de las metas de bienestar que ambos tienen para la familia. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará papelería, tarjetas y utiles escolares. Su meta es continuar trabajando especialmente en este fin de año, época en la cual se incrementan las ventas pues todas las familias se disponen a gastar y este es el momento para ofrecerles lo que cada cual necesita.
texts.en:
Iveth bought clothes and shoes with her previous kiva loan; investing this way she notices her business growing and this is important for her, because she can improve its infrastructure, have goods in its inventories and serve her customers.

She is very happy because her husband who had been unemployed now has a job, and they can acheive the well-being goals that they both have for the family. 

She is now applying for a new kiva loan, with which she will buy stationery, cards and school supplies. Her goal is to continue working especially at this year end, a time in which sales increase as all families are prepared to spend, and this is the moment to offer each of them what they need.

loans.use: to buy stationery, cards and school supplies

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 42 years old and married. She has five children, ages 7 to 20 years. She runs a general store in Kandeh town Bo in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 13 years and sells bread, sugar, soap and soft drinks at her house. She sleeps in a shop room. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to run it.

Emma requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more stock like bread, sugar, soap and soft drinks. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her capital and educate her children. In the future, she would like to improve her family's living condition and own a residential plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more stock like bread, sugar, soap and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more scrap to sell for cash and repair his truck.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Umu from Kandeh town Bo in Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 13. Two are currently attending school. 

In 2007, Umu established her general store business. She began her business because she wants to raise income to support the home. She works at the business for 10 hours per day and seven days per week. She used to work door to door to introduce her products. She says that the main challenge to her business is proper business location.  

Umu requires a loan in order to expand her business by purchasing additional flour, sugar and cooking oil. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Umu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children and all her children go to school. She has one additional family member (a step brother). She lives in a rented house and the family has access to neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food. 

She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are ever increasing prices of used clothes, thieves and seasonality. Her goals are to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.es:
Gilbert, es un joven talentoso de 28 años, trabaja para apoyar a sus padres, aún no formaliza un hogar propio pero mantiene la esperanza. Es propietario de una casa hecha de madera que él mismo levantó hace unos años y del que se siente muy orgulloso de haberlo hecho. Desde hace 8 años, y a pesar de su corta edad decidió incursionar en la ardua labor de dirigir un negocio propio para poder convertirse en un impulsador del desarrollo de su zona, es así que hasta desempeña como fabricante de cajones de madera para frutas, el cual es bien solicitado por su calidad y garantía que ofrece a las vendedoras de frutas. Asimismo comenta que le agrada mucho el proceso que realiza desde el cordado y armado de las cajas, no obstante le parece un trabajo engorroso, proque debe traer la madera que debe recolectar de los bosques constantemente reforestados.
En la actualidad él ha notado que la demanda de sus cajones va en aumento y es necesario realizar algunos cambios en su taller, desde cambiar el tipo de conexión Eléctrica de monofásico a trifásico, como también adquirir  más maquinas cortadoras para agilizar su trabajo. Este es su crédito número 02 con el cual se compromete a cumplir sin falta a sus pagos, asimismo comenta que le agrada mucho relacionarse con sus compañeros de su banco comunal pues ha notado que es un grupo muy unido con el cual le da gusto trabajar. 
Con los 1,500 soles realizará la compra de accesorios para el cambio de conexión de su taller y adicionalmente el adelanto para su maquina cortadora profesional entre otros para lograr agilizar el trabajo en su taller.
texts.en:
Gilbert’s a talented, 28-year-old man who works to support his parents.  He still does not have a home of his own but he’s still hopeful.  He owns a wood house that he built himself a few years ago and that he feels very proud to have made.  Since about 8 years ago, despite his young age, he decided to start the hard work of running his own business in order to become a business promoter in his zone.  This is how he’s become a manufacturer of wood fruit crates.  He relates that he likes the process very much from the cutting to the building of the crates even though the work is tiring because he must collect from forests that are constantly reforested.

He’s noted that demand for his crates has increased recently and he needs to make some changes to his workshop from changing the electrical system from monophasic to triphasic to acquiring electric saws to make work easier.  This is his 2nd loan and he commits to make all his payments.  He also comments that he likes relating to his fellow communal bank members because he’s noticed that they are a very united group he enjoys working with.  He will use the 1,500 soles to buy parts needed to change the electrical system in the workshop as well as to make the down payment on a professional, electric saw among others to make work in the workshop flow more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy saws and spare parts.

loans.name: Natali

texts.es:
Natali, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y entusiasta con deseos de superación. Convive con su pareja y juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de sus 03 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación. El trabajo que realiza Natali es el alquiler de habitaciones, que los ha ambientado y convertido en hospedaje. Lleva dedicándose  a éste rubro desde hace 04 años, contando con el apoyo de su hijo mayor, que la ayuda con la limpieza de las habitaciones y la atención al público.
Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda constante y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta ésta actividad pues le permite tener un ingreso económico que le permite apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Por tanto, tiene planes de poder ampliar su negocio, construir más habitaciones, comprar camas nuevas y demás enseres propias de una habitación para así poder brindar una atención de calidad y mantener la demanda existente. Este seria el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, se siente muy bien y cómoda en el grupo, y contenta con las facilidades para ahorrar y demás facilidades que le brinda la institución.
Con el préstamo solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, comprará artículos para su hospedaje como sabanas, cubrecamas, toallas, entre otros, además arreglará los servicios higiénicos de las habitaciones que necesitan mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Natalí, 44, is a cheerful, enthusiastic woman who very much wants to improve.  She lives with her partner in their own home with their three children who she wants to provide with a good quality of life and a good education.  The work Natalí does is room rentals.  She furnished them and turned them into an inn.  She’s been in this line of work for four years and her oldest son helps her clean the rooms and tend to the public.

She considers her business to be profitable because of the constant demand and the good profits it yields.  She likes this activity because it allows her to earn income with which she can help her spouse cover household expenses.  Therefore, she plans to expand the business, to build more rooms, to buy new beds and other supplies apt for a room so that she can offer quality service and meet existing demand.  This would be her tenth MFP loan and she feels very comfortable in her group and happy with the easy loan terms and the other benefits the institution provides.

She will use the requested 800 new soles to buy supplies for the inn like sheets, bedspreads and towels, among others and she will also repair the bathroom facilities in the rooms that need maintenance.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, towels and to repair the rooms' bathroom facilities.

loans.name: Umugisha Group

texts.fr:
Aaron  fait partie du groupe  Umugisha et habite à Gitega. Il a 37 ans et est marié à Suavis, une cultivatrice  et commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés de 6 à 11ans, tous étudient.

Il  fait le commerce d’ustensiles de cuisine (bassins, fourchettes, assiettes,…) depuis 24 ans.

Il  est à son troisième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’ustensiles de cuisine (bassins, fourchettes, assiettes,…)  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Aaron, age 37, is a member of the group Umugisha and he lives in Gitega. He is married to Suavis, a farmer and merchant. They have three children aged 6 to11 who all go to school.

Aaron has been selling kitchen utensils (bowls, forks, plates, etc.) for 24 years.

This is his third loan cycle with Turame. He will use the credit to bolster his working capital and stock up on kitchen utensils for resale to boost his profits.

loans.use: to bolster his working capital and stock up on kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (a sister). 

She sells charcoal at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation, seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and become a wholesaler of charcoal. 

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Zainab from Kandeh town Bo, in the southern area. She is married and has five children between the ages of 7 years and 20 years. Two of her children attend school. 

Zainab runs a general stock business. She sells slippers and wax cotton. She has been running this business for five years. She began her business because her husband is a diamond digger but his income is not enough to take care of the home, so she started this business to develop herself and her children. She describes herself as a hardworking woman and says that her business is doing well. 

Zainab has requested a loan in order to buy more wax cotton, baskets and slippers. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to develop herself and improve her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more wax cotton, baskets and slippers.

loans.name: Soley

texts.en:
Soley, 29, stopped her education in the 12th grade. She lives at Congo Town with her friend and two children who are 2 and 6 years old and are currently in school.

For the past six years, she has been selling used clothes at the general market. She sells both boys' and girls' clothing. She makes a profit when she sells, especially during the Christmas season.

With the profit generated from the business, she buys more goods and repays her loans.  

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more used clothes for the business. She hopes to give her children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Con un poco de esfuerzo y entusiasmo, Feliciana a logrado mantener el liderazgo de su familia al punto de lograr que sus 5 hijos son personas de bien. Juntos habitan en una linda casa de adobe de su propiedad que a futuro planea construirla a base de material noble. Nos muestra con orgullo su negocio consistente en la venta de productos de primera necesidad o “tiendita” como cariñosamente lo llama, que desempeña en un cómodo ambiente ubicado en el primer piso de su vivienda. Viene desempeñándose desde hace 7 años, tiempo en el que ha ido ganando experiencia total en el rubro logrando establecer su negocio al punto de convertirse en la principal fuente de ingreso de su familia, además cuenta con el apoyo total de sus hijos, quienes están siempre constantes del negocio y la de su esposo. Planea adquirir productos de primera necesidad al por mayor no perecibles con el afán de tener reserva para un tiempo prolongado así como la confección de un andamio adicional para la exhibición de sus productos, adicional a ello realizará el pintado de su local para hacerlo mas atractivo.
A futuro planea realizar una ampliación considerable de su negocio para así lograr ocupar todo el local en su conjunto convirtiéndose en una de las tiendas mas grandes de su localidad. Este viene a ser su séptimo crédito con el cual se siente muy agradecida con MFP por las facilidades que le brinda, así mismo se siente muy contenta por la manera en como vienen desempeñándose los integrantes de su banco comunal siempre con el cumplimiento y la responsabilidad del caso.
Con el crédito, podrá comprar al por mayor, productos de primera necesidad así como el de contratar un maestro encargado en la confección de un andamio y el pintado de su local.
texts.en:
With a little effort and enthusiasm, Feliciana has succeeded in maintaining the leadership of her family to the point of raising her 5 children to be good people.  They live together on their property in a pretty adobe house, which in the future she plans to reconstruct with finer materials.  

She shows us, with pride, her business of selling staple goods or “tiendita” [little store] as she affectionately calls it, which operates in a comfortable environment as it is located on the first floor of her home.  It has occupied this spot for 7 years, the time during which she has gained experience in this line of work.  She has succeeded in establishing her business to the point of converting it into the principal source of income for her family.  In addition, she counts on the total support of her children, who are always a constant feature of her business, and of her husband.  

She plans to acquire wholesale non-perishable staples, as she is eager to have a reserve to cover a prolonged period.  She also plans to make additional shelves to display her products.  In addition, she will paint her shop to make it more attractive.  In the future, she plans to make a considerable expansion of her business in order to occupy all of the premises, thus converting it into one of the biggest stores in her town.  

This is her seventh loan, for which she feels very grateful with MFP for the services it offers.  Also she is very happy with the way the members of the communal bank are performing the fulfillment and responsibility of the case.  With the loan she will buy wholesale staple goods as well as hire the contractor in charge of building the shelves and painting her shop.

loans.use: to buy products, paint and shelves.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene 55 años, parte de su vida viene desempeñándola de manera independiente con la fiel compañía de sus 4 hijos, asimismo es propietaria de una casa de madera, y del que mas adelante desea construirla a base de material noble. Dedicada por mas de 14 años a la producción de cacao ha sido siempre una mujer muy luchadora, desempeña su labor en unas parcelas que adquirió con ayuda de sus padres hace mas de 20 años recibiendo el apoyo de sus hijos constantemente y de ser necesario contratando mano de obra adicional  que brindan los jornaleros de su zona.
Considera que la actividad del cacao, ha sido siempre su afición debido a que la realizaban sus padres y abuelos. Por otra parte el realizar el secado de sus granos de cacao le es un poco complicado debido a que la zona en donde se encuentran sus parcelas es aquejada por constantes lluvias obligando a extender el tiempo normal que emplea para el respectivo secado.
Dentro de las necesidades y la atención que requieren sus cultivos es necesario contar con un numero considerable de jornaleros para realizar el debido deshierbo de los árboles de cacao, pues en esta ocasión vienen apoderándose  de las ramas y frutos perjudicando el normal crecimiento de los mismos. Adicional a ello desea contar con sacos de abono orgánico y herramientas necesarias para el mantenimiento integral de sus parcelas.
Cuenta actualmente con doce créditos comprometiéndose a cumplir de manera puntual con el pago del mismo y agradeciendo desde ya por la confianza brindada. Con los 2,000  podrá contratar jornaleros para el trabajo de sacar la maleza y fertilizar las plantas de cacao, asimismo comprará sacos de abono orgánico indispensables para garantizar una buena calidad de los frutos.
texts.en:
Maura is fifty-five years old, and at this time in her life, she is working independently with the faithful company of her four children.  She owns a house made of wood and hopes to rebuild it with better material in the future.  She has made a living for more than fourteen years in cacao production.  She has always been a fighting woman, and she carries out her work on some plots of land that she acquired with the help of her parents more than twenty years ago.  She constantly receives the support of her children and, if necessary, she hires additional help that the day laborers in her area offer.

She thinks that working with cacao has always been her hobby since her parents and grandparents also worked with it.  The drying process of the cacao grains is a bit complicated since the zone where her plots are located is suffering from constant rain, causing her to spend more than the normal amount of time drying the seeds.    

Considering the needs and attention that her crops require, it is necessary for her to count on a considerable number of day laborers to do all the weeding of the cacao trees.  At this time, the weeds are taking over the branches and fruits, damaging their normal growth.  In addition to the laborers, she hopes to count on the sacks of organic fertilizer and necessary tools for the comprehensive maintenance of her plots.

She has taken out twelve loans to date, always promising to pay on time, and she is thankful for the confidence she has received.  With the 2,000 she will be able to hire day laborers for the weeding work and for putting the fertilizer on the cacao plants.  She will also buy sacks of indispensable organic fertilizer in order to guarantee the good quality of her fruits.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Bertha Otilia

texts.es: Bertha  de 57 años, madre de 8 hijos de 22 a 33 años,  es oriunda de Santa Fe de Mompox, desde donde en unión de su cónyuge  planearon el estudio de sus hijos y por eso compraron una vivienda  en la ciudad de Barranquilla, para que ellos habitaran allí y estudiaran en esa ciudad.  Como esta nueva situación les traía más gastos, decidió ella emprender su propia aventura de negocios y aprovechando su buena sazón, dirigió su emprendimiento hacia el sector de alimentos. Su negocio creció en este municipio,  pero motivos  ajenos a ella,  direccionaron su vida hacia la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, donde ahora vive y ha trasladado su negocio, desde hace 6 años; en él  vende productos fritos y asados, desde los martes hasta los domingos, y diariamente hasta las 10 de la noche. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una estufa para ampliar su negocio y también insumos, para preparar sus frituras en mayores cantidades, aprovechando la época de fiestas que se avecina,  siendo esto es muy bueno para su negocio. Con su crédito anterior con la Fundación, ella logró mejorar su infraestructura, agregó una vitrina y fue capaz de comprar materias primas en más volumen, ganar descuentos y tener un stock de productos para la venta, lo cual aumentó ligeramente sus utilidades. Su meta mas adelante es convertir su negocio en un restaurante y sueña con lograr que todos sus hijos sean unos profesionales de bien, pues  para ellos trabaja incesantemente y esto la hace muy feliz al lado de su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Bertha is 57 years old and the mother of eight children who vary in age from 22 to 33. She is a native of Santa Fe de Mompox. Years ago, she and her husband decided to move to the city of Barranquilla so that their children could study there. Since life in this city is more expensive, Bertha decided to open her own business in food sales. Her business grew in this city, but six years ago, for unrelated reasons, the family had to move to the city of Cartagena de Indias, where they live and work today. Bertha sells a variety of fried and grilled foods. She works Tuesday through Sunday until 10 p.m. 

Bertha is requesting a Kiva loan, her second with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy a stove to expand her business as well as buy supplies so she can prepare bigger quantities of food. She wants to take advantage of the upcoming holiday season, which is a very good time for her business. With her previous loan from the Fundación, Bertha was able to improve the infrastructure of her business. She added a display window and was able to buy basic ingredients in larger quantities at discounted prices. With these she was able to keep a good supply of foods on display for customers, which helped increase her profits. 

Bertha's goal for the future is to turn her business into a full restaurant. She also hopes that her children become tomorrow's professionals. It makes Bertha and her husband very happy to see them always working.

loans.use: to buy a bigger stove to grow her business as well as supplies to make food.
